Do not let the long lines deter you. The aroma of freshly brewed coffee keeps you company while you contemplate on what to try. They have a very limited menu (that gets the line moving faster) and also pricier, but oh, its still worth it.
author: Steffi C.

description:
No frills place with a limited menu (it's like In n Out!) so the line moves fast and you're not going to be there contemplating how to order every single drink on the menu. Pretty solid [caffe] latte both a bold coffee which definitely provides a nice caffeine kick halfway through. The latte art appears to be the same for everyone depending on how the barista feels, but it's definitely a nice touch. The staff are friendly and efficient.

The prices are a bit higher than the coffee joints we have in San Diego, but no doubt the quality is there. What's even better is that if you pop on over to Humphrey Slocombe right across from them, the BBC Vietnamese Coffee flavor is even better than the drink. Get the ice cream instead if you're going to spend $4+ on something coffee-infused.
author: Christina T.

description:
My fav is the new orleans. Basic, I know. But it's a customer favorite for a reason.
The line can get long sometimes but should move quick. Come here for a quick pick me up of delicious cup of joe.
author: Rose H.

description: We were about to leave the leave the city on a Sunday morning when we decided to stop at the Ferry Building Marketplace. We desperately were In need of a cup of coffee and Blue Bottle happened to be right there when we walked in. We got an Iced Americano made with the Hayes beans. So yum and full of flavor - no cream or sweetener added (not like they had sweetener anyway). But the coffee really didn't need anything extra it was just a spot on great cup of coffee.
author: Nicole V.

description:
I tried to remember what this part of the ferry building was like before blue bottle came in.  Before the long line of hip, knowledgable, &/or caffeine hungry folks became a permanent fixture.

Know what?
I couldn't remember.

Sure, I remember when Slanted Door moved in & how it was packed everyday & night.  And Molinari's Deli having a spot for a while.  But this part of the ferry building without a line & the smell of fantastic blue bottle coffee?  I get nothing.

Blue Bottle has been synonymous w good coffee in San Francisco for years, but now it has become so too w the ferry building.  Fuel up w your cup of choice on a cold foggy morning, on your way to or from your ferry, or to start your perusing of vendors.  

There's nothing you can do about the line.  Just take in the sights, sounds, & the scents.  

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I had a New Orleans iced coffee.. It's very average to me. I can make better at home with some simple Cafe Du Monde and condensed milk.

It reminds me of a iced macchiato or even a light Viet coffee but not as good as any. Overpriced and overhyped for a small meh cup of coffee.

I wanted my coffee sweeter but they only had cane sugar which made it difficult to dissolve in my coffee.
author: Donna D.

description:
Oh hell yeah.  I'm glad my lawyer's office is just down the street from here.  When I visit, they know not to show me that break room coffee.

To get to Blue Bottle at the Ferry Building, I'll walk past Peets and a couple Starbucks, but hey, it's worth it.  I even come to my meetings early so I can savor a sip all by myself and watch the folks come off the ferry.

It's my chill time before the hectic action called my work day starts.
author: Ron L.

description:
There are two lines but you can skip the wait and go outside where there's another blue bottle coffee location!

Workers are so friendly and the menu is super simple. If you like sweet drinks, you probably won't like Blue Bottle Coffee. They have simple syrup for you to add to your drink. They also sell coffee beans and ice coffee containers for you to take to go. 

Lines were long but it moved pretty quickly. I like how the people working took their time to make designs on each cup of coffee. We ordered 2 cappuccinos and it was about $8. There's only one size and it was pretty small but the coffee was creamy, but strong. I had to add some sugar in mine but my sisters BF enjoyed his cappuccino without sugar.

Philz Tesoro and Mint Mojito are pretty good but you have to try Blue bottle coffee!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Love this coffee company and the coffee place. 
The coffee is roasted in small batches so it's always fresh 
It is always ORGANIC! 
The drip coffee drips... Literally! It takes about 5 min to prepare a large 12 oz cup.
No artificial and/or natural sugar substitutes but there is real raw sugar!
author: Kate N.

description:
How do I know if this is the best coffee in the world?  The line was too long to find out.  Last Saturday there were two lines starting in different places and each without about ten people in it waiting for....wait for it...coffee.

I've drank a lot of coffee, but what in the world makes this coffee better than any other coffee?  i don't know, and, frankly, it's unlikely that I'll ever find out.  One day, when there's no line, I'll try....but until then...I need a shorter line...
author: Thomas E M.

description:
I can't help myself but stop at one of their location whenever I am in the area.
While the menu i very simple, i go for the mocha every time and enjoy it immensely, 
Service is great, they get through the lines quickly and really know their coffee.
Prices are ok, I wish they offered more sizes, i get two to go just to last me longer than a few minutes.
Not only is the coffee high quality, but so is the chocolate they use, worth a stop!
author: Nijole T.

description: Came to Ferry Building craving ice cream, was determined to try Humphry Slocombe for the first time... but, the line... was just too long; so switched to Blue Bottle for Affogato immediately... After the first bite... :::gulp::: hands down... it IS the BEST Affogato I've EVER had...!!! The combinations of sweet ice cream with a hint of sea salt plus the bitterness from high quality espresso is simply savories deliciousness !!! Found out they used Humphry Slocombe's ice cream...!!!. Will brb...!
author: Belinda L.

description: coffee is great && fresh plus everyone was super nice from ordering to pickup! thank you
author: Alexis D.

description: This place was very busy on the weekend.  It was cold and windy outside so maybe everyone decided to walk around the Ferry Building and just needed some hot java.  Their coffee was a bit strong and a litter bitter but it was still good and much needed.
author: Jason G.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee is wonderful, and everyone knows this, so the line is always insane.  Once you get through it though, amazing coffee awaits!

In visits to both their Ferry Building location and their new location in Palo Alto, I enjoyed the New Orleans-style cold brew, regular cold brew, espresso, and pour-over.  All were excellent, and reasonably priced.  

Blue Bottle seems to have gotten even more popular than I remember from prior visits to their Ferry Building location, and if pressed for time, I might opt to go elsewhere, but in the end I always find it worth the wait
author: Jeff L.

description:
Roaming around the Ferry Building, I needed a coffee. I do think Blue Bottle makes a better macchiato than most of the coffee shops by my work. I like my espresso strong. Plus, I'm a sucker for the cute designs!

September 2013
Macchiato ($3) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-bottle-coffee-co-san-francisco-8#G_9nTAP1OyOd81GhXE1UDA

No line and they made my macchiato quickly. Since I drink my coffee fast, we were in and out in a couple of minutes. A nice quick caffeine fix!
author: Elena N.

description: Best coffee this end of town. A delicious single origin Colombian to start  off my Sunday wandering here in Baghdad by the Bay...
author: James S.

description: Blue Bottle is bustling and ever so popular. My husband loves their coffee (we live in San Diego, so it's hard to get), and we were stoked to be able to have Blue Bottle at the Embarcadero. He had an iced coffee and I had the best affogato of my life. Seriously. Espresso with blackberry honey ice cream. It had an awesome carmelized taste and oh my gosh, yummm. I'm craving it just thinking about it! If you're a coffee lover, check it out!
author: Gabbi W.

description: What can I say that has not already been said. A blue bottle coffee, a sunny day, and a nice bench outside of the ferry building looking at the water and people watching. How can you go wrong?
author: Marc K.

description: I love this places coffee. It's amazing- however the Staff is NOT amazing. Come in and asked for a latte. Left my name and a tip and was looking forward to it. Until I hear the baristas taping about my name on the cup- and being incredibly rude. Yes it's different. That doesn't mean they should insult someone's name. I quote "wow what an ugly weird name- guess their parents were drunk!" Okay then Blue Bottle. I loved you. Now you are no longer a place I will go to again. RUDE!!!
author: Allegra M.

description: Hand down the best coffee in the bay. At least one of the best!! I love coming in the morning and ordering coffee with waffle! You must try the waffle! It's so good. Sometimes I wish my ferry would come way earlier everyday so I can get I. A big line at the blue bottle and order waffle with coffee. Must try it, no questions asked!
author: Galya T.

description:
Long lines.  Crowding around the stand to order.  Heading to the pickup window far left.
Well, there's another option now.
They've open an outdoor kiosk with tables and chairs just south of Gott's Roadside outdoor terrace.  It is right up against the building so it's easy to find.
On a recent cold morning of market shopping, I sauntered to this stand on the northwest side of the building and read their menu.  After a quick study, I ordered a hot chocolate for now (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=tgMmiiwyE1iYbpW0NjHNwQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) and a double chocolate cookie (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=bnr7TtMAKBgrIzsLxYl8-g&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) for later.  The hot chocolate hit the spot as it was just hot enough.  The best part was that it was only lightened sweetened, unlike those prepackaged Nestle powders from my childhood days.  There is a sugar and cream section just a stones throw away if you want to jazz it up.
The cookie was, like the hot chocolate, not overly sweet and the dark chocolate flavors were strong.  Too bad that I waited a bit long (a day or two later) as the cookie was on the hard side by the time I got to it.
Will be back if a) there is a long line inside at their main store and b) the mornings continue to be this cold!  Happy 2016!
author: Mike C.

description:
I am unsure how I feel about this place. 

I probably need to qualify that statement. I am not a coffee connoisseur by any means. But I know what I like. And blue bottle is ... not on the same note as my coffee flavors. Having lived in NYC, i've had my share of 'hipster' coffees along with everything else that is 'coffee' and out here in california - think coffee, stumptown, la colombe, intelligentia, philz, local roasters, etc...oh and of course starbucks and peets :) I like my coffee to be more nutty and chocolate-y. Oh and I only drink black/plain coffee - hot or cold.

Their coffee (drip) of the day only offered things with citrus note and i know that's probably a more hipster thing to drink, but I just can't. So, i opted to get an americano. It was strong - a good pull, i guess. But i didn't think it was amazing. It was alright. Wasn't bad at all - but with all the hype, i expected it to be mouth dropping, knee weakening, wow good. I think i had that experience when i had intelligentia (i remember cursing a bit under my breath at the price for a tiny cup of americano - then the first sip took away all my shock and anger about the price). Maybe it's one of those things that grows on you - i'll never know unless I live here and drink bbc all the time.
author: Sue K.

description: Get the three Africans pour-over and don't do anything to it. No sugar etc.. best cup of coffee ever..
author: Gary FX L.

description:
Best affogato I've had so far! Great espresso + great ice cream = unbelievable affogato! My 2 friends who traveled down the coast from Seattle swear it's the best cappuccino they've had on their trip and went back the next day for more. 

Tip: there are 2 different lines to place your order. One in the front (usually a long line). If you walk around the corner to the left, there is another window for more orders.
author: Kendra C.

description:
I love this place! It is my go-to for coffee in San Francisco. This location is a particular favourite because once you buy your coffee, you can take it outside and sit along the water. This location consistently has a line, but the drinks are well worth the wait! Skip Starbucks and go to Blue Bottle! 

A little secret tip: there are two windows at which you can order a drink...most people don't realize the second one.
author: Aletta B.

description:
Since this location is in the Ferry Building, you will always have a long wait!

Luckily, I came here while walking back from Fisherman's Wharf and decided to swing by.  This was at 6pm on a Saturday..there was no line..but really who drinks coffee at 6pm?  I do!! Haha!  I can always go for a good cup of coffee!

I ordered the Latte, the foam art was well done and the coffee was even better!  

If you are willing to tough out the line, make sure enjoy the coffee outside behind the Ferry Building with great conversations and view of the Bay Bridge and water!
author: Ian K.

description:
After getting Blue Bottle cold brew at various Whole Foods locations throughout San Jose, it was nice to go straight to (one of) the source(s). Service was super fast on Friday night when there was almost not a peep to be heard in the Ferry Building, though I think you could probably hear my husband raving about the taste of his coffee all the way back to our hotel room.

The next day, it was obviously busier than not and service wasn't as friendly, but it still sure was fast despite the line. They have a cute, clean little set up and the choices of bags of coffee you can purchase seemed like they were always well-organized and fully stocked. It was an enjoyable experience going to the Blue Bottle stall and I'll look forward to coming back again.
author: Emily S.

description:
If you're looking for a stellar cup of coffee in San Francisco, look no further than Blue Bottle Coffee Co. 

Located in the Ferry Building.

Yes, the lines get nuts; however, if you go the side window, it's a little less crazy.

Know what you want before you get the to the window.

They use Clover Organic Milk here. 

Get the Latte. And don't forget to snap a picture of the awesome foam art! 

I'll be back every time I'm paying SF a visit!
author: Meagan C.

description:
I think they overcharged me, but just by .25 cents.
I am not a fan of their use of almondmilk.
High wire coffee can make a nice mellow latte with almondmilk, but it seems as if blue bottle espresso married better with the soymilk they used to use.
Or maybe I am just not a fan of the more acidic espresso they use now.
When they first opened they had a mellow, chocolatey espresso.
author: becke a.

description: Maybe the best coffee in town. This location gets a little crowded on the weekends during the farmers market as you would expect. They don't have any of their own seating but there is plenty around the market.  They've got two lines which is kind of weird. One of them is around the corner on the side. If you see a bunch people in the front line walk around the corner and usually it's quicker.
author: Scott M.

description:
The only stand alone Blue Bottle in SF.

It is always a long line of tourists but I wouldn't expect anything else from the Ferry Building.

Blue Bottle is delicious for its distinct flavor and high quality coffee but it has a totally different vibe from the custom order factor and specialty flavors at Philz. 

Get the New Orleans iced coffee or live in darkness.
author: Tara N.

description:
LOCATION: Inside the Ferry Building!

WAIT TIME: Line can get a little long here, so make sure you have time (up to 30 minutes) for whatever you want to order here.

Came here for the first time to try it out and see what they hype was all about. They have lots of merch lined up and bag coffee that you can purchase and look at while in line. It all smells so good!

Got a cafe latte and it was okay. My little latte art didn't come out, but that's okay. Flavor was good, nothing to complain about. You can see them making drip coffee in the kitchen as well. Others were ordering $3 waffles which looks pretty good too.
author: Wing L.

description:
for the first time SFO experience and a lot happening around me, the cold brew (Three Africans) was the best thing happen to me at Blue Bottle Cafe. 
Must have..
always recommend..
author: Sai Kishore P.

description: Walked by this blue bottle coffee and couldnt resist it. it was a hot day so I was going to opt for a iced coffee. Upon lining up, I notice they also sell affogato! First time I see that in a blue bottle coffee, or I could have missed it on the other ones... Anyway, i like their espresso they used that day, it wasn't the hayes valley one, it was more citrus-y. It matches their caramel icecream really good!
author: Gary C.

description:
My sister recommended this place to my husband and I for coffee. I'm not a coffee drinker myself but my husband is and he loved his. I love hot chocolate so I ordered that. Love the attention to detail they gave my drink. Loved that the whole top of it was frothy. Not many places make you a hot chocolate like this. 
My first impression was that the hot chocolate tasted like a piece of chocolate freshly melted and poured into a drink. It wasn't super sweet but very delicious. Definitely a must to try! Then walk outside as you sip your drink and soak in the beautiful views of the bay!
author: Laura E.

description:
I love all things Blue Bottle. Coffee, ambiance, and now waffles?! Amen!

While I didn't actually notice that they had waffles until AFTER I'd ordered, they did look mighty tasty as I debated biting off a chunk of a stranger's. 

In the spirit of full disclosure, I really only ever get drip coffees so I can't speak to the taste of their hand crafted espresso drinks, but if they're anywhere near as good as their drips - you're in for a treat. 

I've purchased a few bags to bring home before, and while they cost a pretty penny - I still can't tell if it's the coffee beans/roast themselves, or if it's how they brew the coffee that makes me rant and rave about this place. 

Irregardless, even if I only have a few minutes to spare in the Bay Area and I'm near a BB - you'll see me there!
author: Jessica M.

description: This location is super cute! The coffee is super good and smells amazingly good. I especially love the Hays Valley Espresso and the Bella Donovan Coffee always hit the spot.
author: Magz K.

description:
I came her last weekend and I ordered the New Orleans iced coffee! It was delicious. The coffee was smooth and had a great taste. 

I am still craving some of their coffee as I write this review! A must try!
author: Lydia H.

description:
Long lines always but surprisingly best coffee I have had. Better than the ones I tasted in the farms in Kona. I wonder if it would taste as good if I bought the beans and made it at home!
It never tastes the same so will have to put up with the lines
author: Louisa B.

description:
Gave this hyped up coffee place a shot. Went to the location in the SF Ferry Building with a friend of mine and was a bit disappointed. I should mention I do not drink coffee at all and I ordered their hot chocolate. Something positive about the drink would be their milk/ foam art. I had a pretty leaf on my hot chocolate. However, the negative aspect of the hot chocolate would be the taste. It was too thick for me to enjoy and some what dry and bitter. It tasted like I was consuming dark chocolate that was melted into a drink. I did not finish my entire drink due to the taste.  I like my hot chocolate sweet and not bitter. Perhaps for milk be added to the drink and not too much chocolate. I'll probably give it another chance to see if i'd change my mind about their hot chocolate.

I would come back, but only if the line was short and other coffee shops near by are out of hot chocolate. Also, i've heard from my friend that their coffee is amazing so if you do drink coffee do ask them for recommendations
author: Danika P.

description:
I love Blue Bottle Coffee. I love the New Orleans, and it's probably because I actually know what true New Orleans coffee tastes like. Cafe Du Monde, Morning Call, you can't beat a nice cup of chicory coffee with a beignet.  Any who... this is where I first discovered Blue Bottle in the Ferry Building in SF and i'm so glad we have one in La now. Iced New Orleans all the way!

Blue Bottle is definitely one of my favorite coffee roasters ever.
author: Andrew J.

description: Very good coffee and waffles nice atmosphere.  After a good run at embarcadero.  Fun exciting happy atmosphere
author: Anne K.

description:
By no means am I a coffee snob, but I feel like Blue Bottle is hyped up. I had their New Orleans coffee, but it didn't taste like anything special other than that it was strong and bitter. I was also disappointed that they ran out of retail coffee beans. I do like their simple interior and the service was efficient.

This location is just a stand and doesn't offer the "coffee house hangout experience." 
Given its long lines, I'd rather opt for Peet's or Starbucks. However, I'll come back to try their other items to see what the hype is about.
author: Helen C.

description:
Damn, this was so good!

I'm no coffee expert, but this was delicious IMO. I had the cafe au lait, and it simply tasted like lovely roasted coffee beans. Loud & clear.
There was almost no bitterness at all, which was appreciated. I hate bitter coffee!!
author: Kelly O.

description:
OH MY GOD. 

Blue Bottle's New Orleans Iced Coffee!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I don't even understand why people would be basic and order basic lattes when they can have BB New Orleans Iced Coffee all day everyday. LIke what even. 

#dontbebasic #bluebottleneworleansicedcoffeeFTW
author: Sara L.

description: I visited San Francisco during memorial day weekend and one of our tourist stops was the Ferry Building. As we walked around we decided that we wanted some coffee and heard of Blue Bottle Coffee. There was a pretty big line but it seemed as though it went by pretty fast. We ordered two cold brews and they were delicious!! They were strong enough without being overpowering. I think that I drank that coffee super fast because of how good it tasted! I don't know when I am going to get a chance to come back but this is a good place to stop for some coffee while touring some of the great places that San Francisco has to offer!
author: Jelena A.

description:
Let me start by saying that  the coffee here is great and, when combined with a hot waffle, compels me to give it 5 stars. It is the breakfast of champions ;-))

Coffee here tends to have a slight  bitter after taste and, fantastic coffee I have had in many countries around Europe and ANZ (Oz and NZ) tends to have a very slight nutty sweet finish. Having said that, I believe it's the Starbucks effect and, local palates have got used to the slight bitter aftertaste. Anyway, that's just my theory ;-) The milk they use is of high quality and organic I believe (the cartons on display were). 

Staff are friendly and friendly and helpful and, when not busy you get your coffee quick. However there is a lineup in the morning and it can take a while to get your coffee. They have a few breakfast options and also some sweet small things. I was told their affogato is excellent and I will attempt to try it before I leave town. 

I really like it here and will definitely come back :-)
author: Sam S.

description:
Located by Roli Roti outside of the main Ferry Building. 

I came on a rainy day and it was not busy at all. Cash only. Drinks take a bit of time to make.

Mocha Latte - $4.25 - Good latte but it tasted like any other latte I have had. Did not blow my mind in taste. I do enjoy coffee with foam art. Price is kind of expensive for the size you get.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Because TCHO is one of my favorite chocolates and waffles are my weakness, on my visit to Blue Bottle I got their mocha ($4.75) and the carmelized waffle ($3).  In order to avoid feeling broke and diabetic, I would recommend getting ONE item at any one visit.

If you have not picked up the sarcasm in my reviews yet, no I am neither broke nor diabetic, everything is quite pricey and sweet.  I can't assess the coffee quality because it was masked by the predominant and scrumptious TCHO chocolate, but from the caffeine jolt it was decent.  Even though the caramelization was predominant and scrumptious, it did not fully mask the waffle, which was thick, fresh, and masterfully tuned to a crispiness-to-softness ratio.

The ambiance is exactly what you would expect for a popular shop at the ferry building: impossibly long lines, a tiny bar seating area with tiny table space, hipster-looking coffee brewing equipment, and a mixture of an authentic SF ambiance (where locals spend $$$ on fancy coffee) with an overhanging touristy vibe (where tourists spend $$$ on fancy coffee).

Useless anecdote: I came here on a weekday morning with my dSLR hoping to get artsy shots (the reason I ordered the waffle and the mocha against my health-conscious judgment).  I even managed to snag one of the rare coveted seating spots at the coffee bar!  Unfortunately the fire alarm randomly went off in the ferry building so I had to use plastic Starbucks tables as my backdrop instead of the wooden Blue Bottle tables.  Ugh first world problems.
author: Edna C.

description: Such good coffee!  I got a caffe latte and it's for sure better than Starbucks!  Very simple menu and very clean establishment.
author: Nyla K.

description:
Anyone who cannot tell this is the most superior coffee in the world should have their tastebuds examined. Seriously. This is the evolution of coffee at its finest.

Yes the line is long but yes, each cup is hand crafted to perfection. 

I first discovered Blue Bottle on a trip to SF about four years ago and could never replicate the experience anywhere else. You cannot imagine how excited I was to find Red Window Coffee in LA carrying Blue Bottle beans. It's amazing don't get me wrong but the original Blue Bottle experience is definitely memorable and one held in the highest of regards.
author: Elayne L.

description:
Blue bottle never ever disappoints. Ever since I moved here in January I have made it a priority to get blue bottle as much as possible...specifically the New Orleans Iced Coffee. Trust me, if you like iced coffee and have never tried this, it needs to be next on your list. It is the perfect combination of sweet and creamy (without adding anything extra yourself)! 

It's always a good day when Blue Bottle is involved.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Oh what fun! Back from the hiatus known as having a newborn child, I'm here to you all about what you already know.  

Blue bottle coffee is touted by some people, as the best coffee you can get!  I would have to agree.  This place knows exactly how to do a good roast (of coffee beans that is).  It's got a good body and a good selection of beans from different places.  The best part, it's not burned beyond belief like some STAR places you pay multiple BUCKS for a drip coffee for.  Not to say this place is cheap.  

I came here before an important meeting and it gave me the jump to do my best.  I swear they also remodeled since I had last been here.  The queue is smooth flowing and they have two lines.  If your'e in a rush, the side around the corner tends to be a little shorter.  Just a heads up.

Great coffee, at a little more expensive prices than other places.  I am a true fan.
author: Eric L.

description:
Is this a tourist ripoff place? I ordered the New Orleans iced coffee and it looked like the bottled Starbucks frappechino meaning it was all milk and there was barely any coffee in it. Why am I paying over $4 for a small cup of milk with a drip of coffee in it! 
And, the coffee was so watered down that I really couldn't taste much. 

Don't get me wrong I am a coffee snob. I'll pay whatever for the best coffee. I've been into Philz but since they kind of cheat with heavy cream to make your coffee so rich and tasty, I normally brew my own drip style coffee myself at home. So, this was a total waste of time and money! Other Blue Bottle offered a little better flavor but this location really offers poor quality. 

If you want to charge $4.25 for a cup of coffee, it better be pretty damn good. This place can't live up to its hype IMHO.

For the poor quality of coffee, the price, and the long wait, I'll rate this place with 1 star. Soooo not worth it!
author: Cartman P.

description:
I enjoy blue bottle. It is a reliable cup of individually prepared coffee that you can't go wrong with. Their new orleans style iced coffee is also quite tasty. They also have a good presence throughout the city, and can be found at various events as well.

All that being said, I firmly believe that this place does not warrant the lines that it draws. At this location you have to wait almost 30 minutes sometimes for just a coffee!

It's certainly no Philz, but I do like it and it gets the job done when that's the option available is.
author: Mark O.

description:
Oh, Blue Bottle, you make me so happy!  Seriously- it's not just the caffeine talking here.  Blue Bottle has a special place in my heart.  It was one of the first places I visited after moving to San Francisco for a job in FiDi.  Yes, there will probably be a line, but it moves quickly and it's worth it.  

There's something special about the extra care and love that goes into the coffee here-- it may sound cheesy, but you can truly taste it.  Oh, and see it-- I mean, look through the Yelp photos of this joint and observe the artistic dollops of frothy artwork atop each cup.  

I found this little website tidbit interesting....http://www.bluebottlecoffee.com/experiences  ....BB offers weekly coffee discussions.  How cool is that? 

I sincerely hope BB stays true to their roots during their expansion.  I'm excited to see BB spreading their joy, but I hope their originality and charm does not become saturated.  BB, my final word of advice: Don't become Starbucks.
author: Andrea H.

description:
Been to this place to relax and have a coffee. Finally ordered for a Orlando cold coffee. I really didn't like this flavour totally dissapointed this time. Finally I understood it is completely hype about this flavour. But cappuccino is a good try and three monkey is. Good try for who want coffee a bit sweet. A b big outlet for a coffee shop is interesting with cool n peaceful interior.

I love designing of paper cup colour 

Coffee : 3/5
Interiors :4/5
Service : self service
author: Sandeep R.

description:
After seeing Philz Coffee's line was expectedly out the door, I realized I can get my daily coffee fix from the small yet popular Blue Bottle booth in the Ferry Building!

This booth is just one star away from a perfect review due to my experience with their line and post-order waiting efficiency. I found the people crowding near the order receiving area to be largely annoying, making it hard for people to actually recognize and enter the line to the right, and for people to access the sugar & cream stand to the left. Perhaps designate and separate these areas a bit more?

Other than that, I am a true fan of Blue Bottle for their New Orleans Iced Coffee or their Caffe Mocha. This time I got their special Hayes Valley Espresso, which was well worth the $3. 

Next time you're in the Ferry Building look out for the crowd of people congregating around this cute stand, because you just can't say no to Blue Bottle! And with Humphrey Slocombe right across from it? I'm in heaven!
author: Kyrie S.

description: Only go here if you like to wait 20 minutes or longer for a cup of coffee. The coffee is good but not good enough to stand around this long. They should obviously staff it better so there isn't such a wait, though perhaps that is part of their strategy for convincing people their coffee is worth waiting for. Which, for me, it isn't.
author: Robert L.

description: Got off the ferry for a day of site seeing in SF. saw a huge line for this place. Had no clue what it was. When leaving SF I decided to investigate. Coffee place you say? I'm in! I love a good cup of black coffee. So I get a simple cup of coffee. I couldn't finish it. Honestly it tasted like someone scooped out a cup of water from the bottom of a dumpster warmed the water and poured it over already used coffee grounds. I couldn't finish it. Perhaps I don't know what good coffee tastes like. I hate Stumptown too. I'll just stick with Peet's.
author: Josh S.

description:
Even after all these years, I still dig the New Orleans iced. The baked goods are GREAT too...and this is the only location that has waffles, which are thick, delicious and made on the spot. 

A quick and sure stop for any coffee and baked goods lover.
author: Annie S.

description: Favorite location to go to of late. Never crowded in the morning or around lunch and my favorite chocolate spot, Dandelion is just around the corner!
author: Kristina B.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee - Latte Art = Culinary Creativity

Definitely a nice spot for a coffee shop at the Ferry Plaza Farmer's Market.

The lines here maybe long, but sometimes the wait is really worth it. I do like that I am able to taste the flavor of the coffee upon taking the first sip. This is exactly one reason where visiting Blue Bottle, Bello and Four Barrel comes in. It's definitely a great way to enjoy coffee from different coffee shops. I also like the views here, it's a very good way to get a clear view of the bay.

I absolutely enjoy the New Orleans Iced Coffee and I will definitely have to try the handcrafted version next time.

Overall:
- Clean facility
- Friendly staff members
- Coffee and Pastry items are of good quality

Positive first experience here so I highly recommend this place.

A very nice spot to get a good view of the bay and I enjoyed it so I'm coming back.
author: Bennett W.

description: I had the New Orleans Styled Iced Coffee. It was perfect. The hype over this place being famous and delicious is so real. It did not disappoint. Even though it was located in the hustle and bustle of the Ferry Building Farmer's Market it had its own feel. As soon as I walked up I felt like taking a deep breath in and relaxing. Everything was so sleek and efficient. My coffee was so yummy and smooth. The flavor rich without being a slap in the face. I love that I could just order it and it be perfect without adding sugar or cream. They know what they are doing and they are doing it better.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Delicious coffee. Be prepared for long unorganized lines. The sizes are pretty small and pricey for what they are.
author: Samantha R.

description: I know a good cup of coffee when I taste it. I got the New Orleans iced coffee and it is probably the best iced coffee I have ever had. It was very smooth and slightly sweetened. The sweetness level is perfect and really allows you to taste the coffee.This place can get pretty packed though, but the lines move pretty quickly. If you get a hot drink, they do great latte art too. Very pretty!
author: Jennie T.

description:
Blue Bottle Coffee Co.  I usually go to the one on the fifth floor of the SF MOMA; however, since the SF MOMA is closed until 2016, there are other Blue Bottle Coffee Co. branches to go to.  After going to the cinema, my friend suggested going to Blue Bottle Coffee and walking around the pier area before heading home to the East Bay. While we were in the queue for ordering our coffee, I looked at the shelves and took a few pictures of the establishment.

I knew Blue Bottle Coffee Co. had a branch here in the Ferry Building.  It used to be located in another part of the Ferry Building.  I see it has relocated where a flower stand used to be about five years ago.

My friend had the iced coffee.  I did my litmus test, their version of mocha.  My friend advised me the mocha was delicious, Blue Bottle makes it with TCHO chocolate.  Okay, that sounded really good and I was convinced I made the right choice.

Well, the wait was long for my mocha.  Hey, where is my mocha drink?  Other customers ahead of me and behind me got theirs.  Where the heck was my mocha?  One of the barristas noticed my perplexed look and asked what I was waiting for.  I advised him that I was waiting for a mocha.  The barrista looked through the orders, could not find it, apologized, and he made one for me heating up the milk while his colleague worked on the coffee.  He gave me my mocha drink along with an apology.  He told me that sometimes orders do get overlooked occasionally.  I took a picture of his mocha artwork which I posted here.  If it was not for this barrista, I would have given this Blue Bottle Coffee Co. branch either one or two stars.

When and if there is another opportunity to come back to Blue Bottle Coffee Co. at this location either with friend(s) or solo, I will be up for their coffee for sure.  Especially if the considerate and helpful barrista is there!  Thanks Dude!

P.S.:  It is worth the wait!
author: Chiara A.

description:
Come here for your cup of joe.  But the lines are killer!  You've been WARNED.  The weekend lines are crazy.  The weekday lines are bearable.

I can't say this is my fave coffee.  I can handle strong coffee, but I personally think this is weak.  Perhaps, I need to try it straight up.  I do get the foo-foo drinks... I usually stick with cappuccinos and lattes here.  

That waffle though... is dang amazing!  I would come here for the waffles every day if I was near by. ;)  It comes out warm and semi-sweet, and it goes so well with the latte.
author: Julie C.

description: Got around to trying the new orleans, even though I was advised against it by the bf, who didn't like it last time he got it. I liked it a lot! It's iced, milked, cold dripped and sweetened a little bit, but there's simple syrup on the table to adjust the sweetness. There was a good strong coffee taste, but not overwhelming. He got the cafe latte, which, to be honest, doesn't need any sweetening. It's the perfect amount of bitterness which is offset by the frothy milk.
author: Larissa L.

description:
Don't love long lines, but I do love Blue Bottle. The line is a testament to the quality of their products. Either a simple drip or the New Orleans Iced Coffee! Perfect.
Also a must-try is the affogato!! Espresso over Humphrey Slocombe ice cream. So good. You can ask for one scoop of ice cream instead of two, so it's a smaller afternoon treat! Just what I needed!
author: MaryKate M.

description: Fantastic coffee, and the line moves really fast, so don't let it intimidate you! Their snacks are tasty too.
author: Natasha K.

description:
This place is a must-stop for me to fulfill my coffee cravings when I'm at the Ferry Building.

Just be forewarned that there's going to be a crazy, long line but it's worth the wait. Expect to wait about 10-20 min for your coffee.

I would either get a drip coffee, which is made fresh a cup at a time. I also love their New Orleans Iced coffee.

If you haven't tried blue bottle yet, you're totally missing out!
author: Lily Y.

description:
First time, and liked their new orleans iced coffee! They was a long wait line however moved pretty fast. Also had another cashier/ordering place right around the corner. 

Next time would like to try out something different.
author: Stella L.

description:
New Orleans Style Iced Coffee. 

Nuff said!

We are surely spoiled for those of us who work and live in The City. We have two great coffee companies in Blue Bottle and Philz - both homegrown and both continuously pushing the boundaries on creating amazing concoctions made from the coffee bean.

I usually get my morning fix from Peet's since their closer to work; but when I have time, I'll stop by the Ferry Building and grab me a Soy Latte or two. If I really have some time, I also order their Belgian Waffle to go. Or, we'll come here during lunch time and have some coffee after lunch and enjoy the view of the Bay and the Bridge. 

On those warm, sunny days, I'll order the New Orleans Iced Coffee. I still remember the first time I had this coffee several years ago during the San Francisco Street Food Festival in the Mission District, and I have been a fan ever since. The flavor and aroma all hit the notes one would expect from a coffee and instantly gives you a jolt of flavor reminding you that you are alive. It awakens all the senses and for that moment, makes you feel like everything is going to be all right. 

Sh*t....I think I just described how one would get high from smoking crack or snorting cocaine. Hmmmm, I think I'm on to something here. 

Yes, this stuff is addictive. 

NOTE:

On the weekends, especially Saturdays during Farmers Market, this location get very busy. They have two Coffee Stands located outside the building. Also, there is more than just one line for this place. They also have an outside window on the side, and that line is usually shorter that the main line.

You're welcome!
author: John G.

description:
Need I echo the overwhelming number of positive reviews? 

Coffee: Best cappuccino ever. First-timers should experience the pourover of the day where the quality of BB beans really shines through.
Food: They serve freshly made Liege waffles! The smell is spellbinding. And a very small selection of baked items.
Location: In the Ferry Building across from Humphrey Slocombe. Get ready for a long wait during peak morning hours and lunch.

If you're willing to walk 15min from the Ferry Bldgs, there's another location on Sansome that has spacious seating and a beautiful interior with natural lighting.
author: Angela L.

description:
I don't watch the show but am fairly certain I experienced a "Portlandia" moment here.

Dude carefully setting the precious craft roasts on the shelves asked if he could help, as I appeared unsure what to get.  When I mentioned what must have sounded pedestrian (Jamaican Blue Mountain?), he said he wasn't familiar then launched into all sorts of barista lingo.  I understood maybe ten percent of what he rattled off.  Finally I thanked him, scooped up a couple of bags and got back in line.

Blue Bottle staff are nerd-tastically knowledgeable as well as über-serious about their product.  Really intense vibe.  No smiles or grinning that I noticed.  But there was a redonkutardedly long line of customers that inched along. ;[ And I know slow; I am the slow.

[Time lapse:  25 minutes]

While purchasing an espresso drink, a drip coffee, and the two coffee bags, I inquired, "is this pre-ground?".  Cashier looked at me as if I had five heads, chartreuse hair, and no eyebrows.  I was sternly told:  "We do NOT sell pre-ground, these are all whole bean, we do NOT grind beans for customers, if you don't have a grinder, there is one for purchase here"....

Whut, juss, hoppunn'd?

Replying 'ohh okay', I paid and was asked if I wanted a receipt.  I said yes, but soon felt badly about it.  Because maybe the eco-ethical proper thing to do (in order to avoid polluting Earth with another piece of paper that might or might not make the recycling bin), would be to memorise amount paid, input to 'smart'phone or directly in a personal budget application for later tracking?  I don't know.  All I know is I felt judgy eyes on me, like I should have declined a receipt.

Then I scampered outside to wait for my meticulously produced drink.

[Time lapse:  15 minutes]

Dammmit, Blue Bottle-landia.  If that wasn't one of the richest creamiest *costliest and TINIEST* soy de-caff cappuccinos I ever had.
author: Jade T.

description:
The coffee is good, I guess. But with the long line going straight through the hustle and bustle of the Ferry Building, this is not the kind of place where the wait feels worthwhile. 

I tried a cold brew (iced) and thought it was fine - to me, no better or worse than other cold brew coffee I've had (and honestly, no better or worse than Starbucks' standard iced). It could have been a random experience, but I also didn't love the fact that the barista had to pour the milk for me, and plopped it into my cup one tiny droplet at a time.

If I'm going to wait that long and pay that much, I'd prefer Philz - but to be fair, I'm no coffee connoisseur. I'd be curious to try the New Orleans iced... maybe if I catch the counter without a line, I'll give it a go.
author: Catie F.

description:
Whenever I'm around the area, I would go in the Ferry building just for a cup of cold brewed New Orleans styled iced coffee. 

There's usually a line but it moves pretty fast and staffs are very friendly. This time I got the New Orleans styled iced coffee like usual and my boyfriend got the single origin drip coffee. 

If you have room in your stomach, definitely pair your coffee with their caramelized Belgian style waffle. It's warm and tasty. You won't regret it!
author: Angelyn S.

description: I lovee coffee... this place has a really good cold brew. There's a subtle chocolate taste that I really like. Also I tried the cascada fizz and it's slightly fruity and sweet so the flavor isn't overwhelming but the drink is refreshing. I recommend this place of you're looking for a coffee fix.
author: Monique T.

description:
If you are an SF local, you already know you shouldn't be at THIS Blue Bottle. The line is guaranteed to be insane (expect a wait from 15-30 minutes) as tourist-types exploring the Ferry Building jostle for a cup from this Bay Area institution. 

They have a lot of branded items for sale at this particular location for you to look at (be sure to marvel at the high prices). 

Nonetheless, you cannot go wrong with Blue Bottle. Get the perennial favorite New Orleans Iced Coffee or classic Latte....or, really, anything. I've tried the Mocha here as well, and it's definitely got a great chocolate-y flavor.
author: Olivia C.

description: Took the recommendation from another yelper on have a New Orleans style iced coffee, specifically on the hot day it was today. It was fantastic and the the baristas were even better!
author: Alex H.

description:
who doesn't love BB??!  perfectly crafted espresso drinks is all i have to say.  never sour and never any bitterness.  I love the TCHO mocha.  if you haven't had one, you haven't tasted the good life!

a must-stop anytime you visit San Francisco.  take some beans home to keep the SF goin'.  when you're out of beans, it's time to make another trip to the Bay.  it's that simple.
author: Angela A M.

description: You know.. It's sadly and disappointingly over hyped. Philz coffee was better than their Gibraltar. It wasnt bad Starbucks-like coffee, but it isnt stellar either. Just decent. The coffee had a meh acidic aftertaste. I cant give them a 4 star because even my Affogato was good only beause of the ice cream, and the ice cream isnt even theirs. It's from the ice cream store across from them. So now I'm gonna sulk in a corner and pray I forget about the hype surrounding Blur Bottle coffee.
author: Elena C.

description: Great cup of coffee.  Pour-overs for a reasonable price.  Not much else to say, except that there is a Starbucks and a Peets in close proximity.  Skip both of those and choose this.  Your taste buds will thank you.
author: Laurie V.

description:
In my opinion, the hype is real!

I'm not much of a coffee drinker, and yet I could taste the difference here! 

Ordered a New Orleans iced coffee and was so impressed. The coffee isn't sugary or too bitter, but it's also very smooth yet still strong. 

Next time I come back I want to try the latte and waffle.
author: Andrea L.

description:
This was the longest line I stood in at the Ferry Building Marketplace. But it was worth it. I'm actually not a big fan of coffee (the perfect coffee for me is half full of milk and chockfull of sugar) but I do love it when paired with ice cream! I mean, who doesn't love anything when paired with ice cream?! :P

The affogato is served with Humphry Slocombe ice cream and the menu notes that "all espresso served double ristretto" (which means nothing to me *shrug*). All that is important is that the affogato was delicious. Definitely recommend it :)
author: Esther K.

description:
I didn't really enjoy Blue Bottle that much, but I am going to 3 star instead of 2 star because I feel like it's partly my fault. I was looking for a cool little coffee shop to hang out and get some work done in, but at the Ferry Building it's basically just a stand, there's nowhere to sit and hang out. 

Also, I've never tried coffee before so usually in coffee shops I'll get tea or something else and I feel like there weren't a ton of options for a non-coffee drinker! I had a hot chocolate, and that wasn't really that great either. Maybe I was just in a weird mood that day. It is a coffee shop though so I feel like I can't ding them too much for not catering to me lol.
author: Ryan P.

description:
You never forget your first cup of Blue Bottle and I had my first cup here.  It was more than two years ago and I got their New Orleans iced coffee.  Now, two years later, that's still what I get from them.  What can I say?  I stick to what I like.

Although they've opened a bunch of other locations since that time, I still like to walk to the Ferry Building on occasion to enjoy the sunny weather while it lasts and to sip coffee while strolling near the water.  

FYI, there are two lines so make sure to line up in the shorter line since it gets reaaaally hot inside the Marketplace area on sunny days.
author: Ben H L.

description:
"Oh, ooh, ooh, there's Blue Bottle coffee," my co-worker says, as if she sees Brad Pitt or George Clooney behind the bar making her Caffe Au Lait.

Then, she cradles the coffee as if they gave it to her for free, instead of her paying nearly $4 for it.

My latte was around the same price, but was I as excited as Homer Simpson in a doughnut shop? No.

Personally I don't understand the hype, or the wait.

Yes, they make foam art. But so does Trouble Coffee, Ritual, and Sightglass.
The coffee is decent, but it's not 5 star worthy. 

When you can draw me the Simpsons (pick a Simpson, any Simpson) in my coffee cup, then I'll give you 5 stars.

But since they're like other good coffee shops, I'm giving this place 4 stars because that's fair.

Interesting to note that when we got back to the office, she said the Café Au Lait she got wasn't that good. I guess the magic only lasts for so long...
author: Jack R.

description: I feel like I'm the last person to jump on the Blue Bottle bandwagon and be in complete awe. Why did it take me this long?! Ugh, now I'm annoyed at myself. The wifey and me frequented the Ferry Building location and of course it was busy but shockingly not that long of a wait. Since it was a beautiful and warm day in the city- I know, rare, we both decided on the New Orleans iced coffee and a waffle. FYI- you don't have to add anything to that iced coffee because it is completely perfect. As for the waffle, crazy good. If I can have breakfast waffles made like that at home- I'd never leave, have a weight problem, but be happy as a friggin' clam.
author: Vanessa O.

description:
This review is only for the waffle served from the take-out window.
This was the first time I had a chance to try the BBC waffle.
Freshly made to order, it's nice to have a warm waffle served in a coffee filter in the morning.
The waffle was bigger than my hand and had a lovely golden brown hue to it.
Unfortunately, the waffle itself did not distinguish itself in flavor. Baked batter (yes). Buttery (sort of). Warm (yes). 
Other than that, for $3.24 I'll get my waffle elsewhere. I know a better place...
author: Joanna T.

description:
I've heard nothing but positive reviews about the Blue Bottle Coffee location at the Ferry Building.

However, I did not enjoy my first experience this past weekend...

I went to the side window (no line), to order an iced coffee. A man was wrapping up his order and placing his money back in his wallet. Naturally, I got in line behind him. I was told by the woman at the register that I had to get in line. A reminder, the gentleman that paid was done and leaving. 

Okay.... I got in the "line" that was marked, even though I was clearly next. The girl at the register looked in each direction before yelling, "Next!" to the only one in line... me.

I walked up to the register and asked for an iced coffee, and if I could get a splash of almond milk. She automatically said, "You want the New Orleans," and swiped my card before I could say no.

NO. I wanted an Iced Coffee. A New Orleans is iced coffee with milk and sweetened. Besides, if I had wanted a New Orleans. I would have asked for one.

The lack of customer service and this woman who ordered for me when I clearly didn't ask for it...


Maybe I should have just battled the long line in the front of the store. Perhaps the customer service would have been better... if I decided to wait a good 10 minutes.


Coffee itself was good. Just wished that I had an iced coffee.
author: Angelique M.

description:
Same good blue bottle coffee. I had a Cappucino and I loved it as usual.

If you are visiting here make sure you check out the second line in the back. Its usually much shorter.

The only reason I gave this place a 4 is that the staff disn't seem welcoming. I can understand its a business area and crowded but I don't think you have to look angry at a customer because they are thinking or reconsidering :)
author: Salim M.

description:
I love blue bottle coffee, but I would suggest avoid this place unless you are a tourist checking out sf for a few hours. The lines are always long because if tourists. Try the Sansome st or mint st location close by for a better experience.
If you are here though, try the Afogstos, you only get in in blue bottle coffee. 

Also although I avoid this location for the crowds, blue bottle coffee is an uncredible San Francisco experience. Do not leave sf without trying it
author: Sourav C.

description: Good coffee.  The quality speaks for itself, you'll notice this as soon as you see the menu.  Don't let the long lines scare you.. they get it out fast.  If the crowds allow, don't hesitate to go out to the pier, find a seat, enjoy the coffee and the views.
author: Will N.

description:
Super nice guys, they saw me with a competitor coffee in my hand, the offered me to taste their cappuccino.. one word: amazing!
Must try!
author: Antonio C.

description:
I've had tried the ice cream version of Blue Bottle Coffee because Humphrey Slocombe and absolutely in love with that flavored ice cream. So one day while I was burning time before my shift starts, I decide to stop by to try the actual coffee for reals.

I decided to go with the Mocha which was pretty creamy & strong. I tend to like coffee a bit sweeter so this may just not my cup of coffee..
author: Amy C.

description:
I was introduced to this place back in 2012? Lol by  a friend of mine from law school.  Affogato!  It was so delicious that I came back almost every other day till I noticed that i had gained a substantial amount of weight lol 
I come visit from time to time but there seems always be a line in front of blue bottle coffee:(
author: Alanda B.

description:
Burly iced New Orleans coffee- stronger, less milk

Cappuccino- wet side, some employees make better foam than others. I take it their blue bottle way even though I normally take it dry.

$3 waffle- like a waffle donut and huge. Split it.

Walk outside and sit along the side of the building next door in the sun in December.  Take off jacket and get a tan (because it's too cold and windy to do that in the summer in SF). 

So good.
author: Candice H.

description:
I don't mean to be a hater, but I don't really think their coffee is any better than most coffee elsewhere. I judge my coffee based on just plain black/drip coffee and got the Three Africans blend. I may not be a coffee expert, but I don't think good coffee should leave a bitter/acidic aftertaste. Their prices are pretty typical of SF, but their standard size is smaller than average, so it's technically more expensive.

Sorry Blue Bottle, but I think I prefer Philz
author: Jessie L.

description:
Wow. 30 minutes wait for a small cup of cappuccino that you empty within 1 minute? Not including the 30 seconds for taking evidence for Instagram. People must be crazy.

I was crazy enough to line up there - what else would you do on a Sunday afternoon in the Ferry Building (nah, not really). No, I was in the mood for good coffee and 4 1/2 stars on Yelp don't lie.

After intensively studying the rest of the thirsty coffee enthusiasts behind or in front of me, and after wondering long enough why on earth they'd close the small, hidden take-out window on the side (without coming to a conclusion), it was my turn to order a $4 cappuccino. 

As the ritual demands, upon receiving my nicely foamed cuppa coffee I immediately made a top shot for Instagram, Yelp, and Google Local. I also made sure everyone around me notices how much I enjoy my $4 cup by making a loud "ahhh, hmmmmm" noise.

Blue Bottle certainly knows what they do - great quality coffee, friendly baristas. It's up to you if you want to wait there for 30 minutes plus. Hey, but the Instagram afterwards is just worth it.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
"Smooth" is how I would describe blue bottle coffee. Compared to what you'd get at Starbucks or another SF hotspot Sightglass, the coffee at blue bottle is more pleasant to the palette and isn't as dry. That doesn't mean the caffeine is any less stronger though!

I've tried both the Cappuccino and New Orleans iced coffee. The New Orleans had a good espresso to milk ratio, and was just the right amount of sweetness. I'd get it again!
author: Vivian W.

description:
There's a second shorter ordering line hidden around side on the left, you're welcome !

Staff was friendly, efficient, and cool, (woman with blue whale tattoo, woman with killer eyelashes, another apparently less memorable woman later who also provided fast friendly service).

Coffee was killer.  I came back again after I got off my ferry trip for a second cup!
author: Andrew T.

description:
I like blue bottle, I really do, but today I don't like them so much. 
I asked the cashier if I could get my usual order- single espresso and a cold brew, and since my 1+ old daughter wanted some milk, I requested for a small cup of milk - not knowing they would charge $2 for it! What coffee place charges for milk?!? Its not like it was even almond milk. Just regular milk. 

Shame, shame, shame. And you know, I don't mind paying for milk if you tell me I have to pay for it- but I was shocked when I found my receipt online and saw that I was charged for it. 

Sorry but I'm not going here anymore like ever.
author: Faye L.

description:
Woo! Blue Bottle!!!! I love the cappuccinos, sooo smooth and balanced. This time around we tried the New Orleans cold coffee too, which you would like if you're into vietnamese coffee, but less 'thick' - the cold coffee here has a smoother taste to it, very refreshing.

The coffee beans make a wonderful gift, and the book they have on coffee brewing is AWESOME, tells you about how Blue Bottle transformed from a little boy's disgust at black and bitter coffee is into curiosity at creating better coffee, one backyard roaster, one wooden coffee stand,... then into the Blue Bottle today, large but equally amazing quality. Great for any coffee lover since it also talks about coffee regions, coffee beans processing, with great colored pictures. Very worth that $25.

This place deserves 5 stars because the cappuccinos are on point every time, and I don't know how the establishment can do better. Thanks guys for always a top-notch experience! can't wait to try the waffles here..

Tip - take your coffee to the seating area near Peet's for a good space to relax :)
Tip 2 - they sell the cold New Orleans coffee at Whole Foods too
author: Maggie G.

description:
The entire building was packed and of course, the line for Blue Bottle was one of the longest.
I got the New Orleans - I think it's their signature? I originally wanted a latte but the barista kept pushing for the New Orleans. ​The coffee tastes a bit like a iced macchiato but more rich. Not too sweet or too bitter.
author: Sarah B.

description:
All you new Blue Bottle newbies, I recommend starting with the New Orleans iced coffee. This creamy and smooth coffee concoction will cool you down on a hot day. With a gorgeous view of the Embarcadero Waterfront and tons of opportunities to people watch, I would say this is a great date option.

There are two lines: one for strictly coffee, and one for food. The coffee line tends to be the shorter one (read: get in and get out and less wait time). Decent customer service.
author: Joanne K.

description: Great coffee, but super expensive, and hipster. Always busy. 4$ for a small coffee. I come back all the time but would prefer if they made the price a bit cheaper.
author: Johnny B.

description:
I was told this coffee is amazing and I must try it .... I walked past it during my trip to the Ferry Building and made a mental note "MUST VISIT"!!

The next day I took a walk back to Blue Bottle ... got in a line of about 20 deep and thought to myself, this shit better be good!

The gal that took my order looked like she must have had a long night out since she asked me for my order at least 4 times LOL ... it paid off w/a free cup of drip coffee since she gave me 2 instead of 1 and let me take the extra free of charge.  This was great since I got to sample a black drip and one with a little milk mixed in. MMMMMMM

I also ordered a latte (decorated w/the leaf) and a NO Ice Coffee.  I was WIRED YO!

Another place I will definitely visit again next time I am in SF.  Plus I really want to try the waffle!
author: Dennis H.

description: Best cappuccino I've ever had...period. These baristas don't play. Their coffee is their passion (at least it seemed that way to me). The ferry terminal is beautiful. Come grab a coffee and soak it in.
author: Michael W.

description: The cappuccino was great. The hubby and I were interested in perhaps trying their cold brew as well and the barista offered us a sample -- it's excellent and that was super sweet of them to do!
author: Marzia A.

description: After the ice cream, we decided to wash it down with some iced coffee.  Across the way was Blue Bottle Coffee.  Even though there's a Blue Bottle location near me in Venice, it is always a nice treat.
author: Rochelle R.

description:
You haven't had a latte until you've had a Blue Bottle Latte. So smooth, rich and pure!! Please Bring Blue Bottle to Sacramento!

This was a popular spot, so I had to try it out. I ordered the almond milk latte and it changed my coffee drinking experience forever! 

A MUST TRY if you're in the area.
author: Diem N.

description: The Liege waffle is the perfect little breakfast item with just the right amount of sweetness. It's quick and easy, plus made-to-order. For about $5 it's fresh and filling. If you're looking for something more than a boring muffin to start your day then I highly recommend changing it up with one of these.
author: Shanice P.

description: Excellent pour-over to compliment the walking of this beautiful city.  The staff was very nice and while the line was long, the wait for my drink was not bad and completely worth it.  I definitely will make this a stop when I am in SF.
author: DeliaDana Z.

description:
When there's a long line, you know something is being done right! 

If you want a treat that will give you a pick me up, get an Iced Mocha Latte. I can't tell you anymore about this drink because there are literally no words to explain how wonderful it is.
author: Kendal Ann M.

description: Every time I come to San Francisco I have to stop by for my obligatory blue bottle soy latte. Yum!
author: Eve V.

description:
I'm not an elite hipster and have probably only had 5 different types of coffee in my life, including the best coffee ever I make myself in company break room.

Can't say I fully understand the blue bottle coffee hype, but it definitely tastes better than your typical Starbucks sugar-dump in a cup. I also found blue bottle's new orleans iced to have an interesting multi-layered flavoring twist (I may just be trying too hard).
author: Tian Q.

description: Great Drip coffee! yummm... and love the latte art! The line was long, but moved pretty fast :)
author: Jenny Z.

description:
I finally made my way to BBC after hearing so much hype about it. And I must admit, it lives up to the hype in my opinion. The menu is short and sweet, but when quality of this magnitude is being served up, short and sweet is all you need right?

I ordered a mocha (made with TCHO chocolate...quality stuff!) and it was strong while tasting rich and smooth at the same time. I would drink one everyday if they had one in Sac. Ooh...that would be dangerous. 

And now...let me give a shout out to those waffles...

Ah those waffles. Those waffles! It's a handheld sweet piece of wonder. Handheld waffle you say? Why yes! At first I thought it was weird. How the hell will I keep the syrup from dripping down to my elbow?? And then my friend told me it was so good, no syrup was needed. WTF? But he was right. Oh so right! It has this caramelized sugar coating that is encrusted in every nook and cranny of this thing. When you bite into it, you almost get a slight shatter effect similar to a creme brulee when that spoon breaks the sugar shield. SO GOOD. 

Get the waffle. Whatever you do, get the waffle!
author: Mel L.

description: This coffee place is always pack. Always be ready to be in a long line at peak hours. The baristas will artfully decorate your espresso drink or any drink that has some type of cream or foam. I enjoy getting it because it always feels like a real good treat for me. Keep up the good work!
author: Hilda M.

description:
I've been to SF more than a dozen times, and I've yet to try any of the famous Blue Bottle Coffee shops (probably because I'm more distracted by the city's amazing cocktail bars). On a rare sunny-and-70 San Francisco day - and feeling somewhat warm inside the A/C-lacking Ferry Building - I opted for BBC's iced cafe au lait with my pick of almond milk. Perfection! 

Note that the line is long, but there's a slightly shorter "to-go" line around the corner.
author: Farrah A.

description:
I was looking forward to trying out Blue Bottle Coffee, which, like Philz, has huge buzz in the San Francisco coffee community. In San Francisco for an afternoon, I stopped by their Ferry Building location for a sample. Bracing myself for long lines, my timing was serendipitous, because there were only a few people in front of me (not long thereafter the hordes returned!).

Blue Bottle's menu is spartan to say the least. No need to worry about in-the-know names for small, medium and large - at Blue Bottle one-size-fits-all.  Prices are reasonable. 

I'm an iced coffee fan, so I was looking forward to trying their New Orleans Iced Coffee, which a lot of people rave about.  I ordered that and a waffle, another yelp recommendation. I stood and waited for my order; this is essentially a coffee bar, very small,  no tables, and only five stools next to a short counter in front.

The iced coffee came right away, the waffle shortly thereafter. A few sips of the New Orleans and I quickly realized it was not what I expected. The website describes it as "sweet, creamy", so I'm thinking something like Philz's Iced Mint Mojito. But only a black coffee drinker could describe this as "sweet" - if there was any sweetness it was not easy to detect. I thought about adding some Splenda (heresy, I know, but I had some in my pack), but there were no stirrers (not green?). Maybe a knife? There were two silverware slots, one for clean, the other "used" (plastic utensils also not green I guess).  But I had visions of a rushed customer putting their utensils in the wrong slot, a less than appetizing thought.  I drank the coffee as is.

The waffle had a very subtle sweetness, bordering on plain.  Not sure if there are optional toppings available - didn't see any signs to that effect,  I forgot to ask, and no one volunteered anything.  The waffle wasn't bad, and helped offset the coffee taste for me, but it was like eating pancakes without syrup.

Blue Bottle appears geared for coffee purists, and they serve this market well.  But if you have any kind of a sweet tooth in your coffee tastes, you may be disappointed here.  Perhaps the Caffe Mocha is more "sweet", but even if that's the case, Blue Bottle's flavored coffee choices are much more limited than many other coffee shops.
author: David F.

description:
The coffee is delicious here.  They really take the time to brew their coffees at the optimal times and temperatures for the best taste.  The only thing is that this may result  in your coffee not being as hot as you may like.  If you value temperature over taste, ask for your coffee to be made extra hot. 

Get there early to snag a waffle as they tend to run out of them.  It will be the best waffle you have ever eaten.
author: Kathy C.

description:
GREAT coffee, the New Orleans ice Coffee is really good, however it is kinda over priced and for not a lot coffee, For example, a 12oz bag of coffee at Blue Bottle costs around $19, whereas  a 1lb bag at Phil'z will cost you $18  both Phil'z and Blue Bottle are comparable. 

Blue Bottle is a GREAT place if you are in the Fidi district , and I still go, however I still  prefer Phil'z only on the account that you get a better deal and the coffee is still good.
author: Alex M.

description:
I've heard so many good things about blue bottle, so I was pretty disappointed when my iced latte pretty much just tasted like milk. :,( maybe I'll try something else next time. My bf got a regular coffee with whole milk- not very strong, tasted better than my latte, it was ok. 

I probably won't go out of my way to come back, but if it's in the area and I need that energy, I'll just grab a black coffee since ya can't go wrong with that. Guess I figured out I'm more of a philz gal!
author: Mischelle D.

description: I ordered the New Orleans style iced coffee. They wanted to add milk/cream, but I declined. There was no need to add anything. The coffee was really good. I would absolutely recommend!
author: Joelle K.

description: I can't leave you, BBC, without dreaming of you. Legitimate-in-the-states-coffee. Double espresso macchiato. Not anything close to Starbucks purgatory.
author: Jen L.

description:
The line is wayyy too long! If you have the time, it's worth it.

I wanted a machiatto, but they only offer that drink in their cups so you can't order it to go. So... I got a latte. I liked the way the barrista took his time to carefully froth each batch of milk. It was very controlled and I felt like he really cared about how each drink came out. The foam art is pretty and the first sip you take, you can really taste the espresso and not just a bunch of foam and milk. This coffee will spoil you. It's delicious.

I want to try the New Orleans iced coffee next time. Unfortunately, the extra window on the side where you can order is closed (permanently?).
author: Michelle K.

description: Really good coffee, probably the best I had in San Francisco. Rich and full-bodied. Service unfortunately is pretty slow.
author: Tian B.

description: My office is one floor above this blue bottle and I hardly ever come here anymore. it is a bit too expensive for a tiny latte (cuz the regular coffee just doesn't quite cut it) and I'm starting to think Blue Bottle is a bit overrated :(
author: Mingmei N.

description:
we've had your coffees in LA and SF before, but didn't realize how amazing your hocho was. if you like hot chocolate on cold rainy days to give you that feeling inside that coffee can't give, blue bottle is a must have, just make sure to order it extra hot.

we will be regulars in your LA locations for sure but how can we get some cold and rain to go with it?
author: NYSD G.

description:
Every time I'd pass by Blue Bottle on my way to the Farmer's Market, there would always be an INSANE line waiting for coffee. I'm never patient enough to wait, but today, the line was not bad at all. 

I decided to try their iced coffee, and immediately fell in love. The coffee was rich, and the ice cubes they use were large cubes (the kind that you might see in your fancy scotch), and the size of the cubes allow the ice to melt slower so that your drink won't be diluted.

Blue Bottle does live up to the hype-- I only wish they'd make various sized cups.
author: Grace H.

description:
On its face, the coffee is superb. But they act like they're carving the next great piece of Renaissance sculpture. I heard them interviewing the woman in front of me about her coffee preferences (when she didn't know what she wanted) like she was making a life decision. The pace was glacial. Don't get me wrong: I love a great coffee. But maybe some perspective is in order. 

After all, it IS only coffee, not brain surgery!
author: Heather L.

description:
This was the best coffee I had on my California trip. I've been eager to try Blue Bottle since I have been considering their monthly shipping program. The staff was very friendly and helpful in deciding what type of coffee I should try to best understand their roast. I got a black drip coffee and my wife got a latte. We loved both.
Tip: There are two windows you can order from.
Tip #2: Take your coffee down to the other end of Ferry Market near the water (by Peet's coffee). There's a lot of open chairs their to enjoy your coffee while watching the water from inside.!
author: Tom S.

description: Best lattes and amazing  customer  service ! ! I wish they had a bigger  size cup option as well.
author: Gergana N.

description: Finally walked down to the Ferry Building today and tried this out! The store is in the Ferry Building which itself is super nice with plenty of different shops inside. Blue Bottle has two places to order their food and drinks. The "front" of it had a huge line. I walked to the side and found that the line wasn't as big so I went and ordered from there. I ordered a bit of a creation (basically an iced macchiato). The barista was very nice and recommended me to it and it was great! It's a bit stronger than stuff I normally drink (i.g. Starbucks), but I enjoyed it. Overall, I found the place clean and the drinks good. I definitely will come back and try some more stuff soon!
author: James R.

description:
There's a LINE!

No joke. It didn't matter that I came here in the middle of a Tuesday. There was STILL a line. My friend recommended coming here and said Blue Bottle was the up and coming thing to drink these days. 

I went with a SOY LATTE: yum, smooth, and frothy. Me gusta. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Kr1gMG4nxHqsLyORqrbuSw&userid=x2kIaq8x6Q2I6uJxmVg4cA I also tasted the ICED LOUISIANA DRIPPED COFFEE. http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=0SHxf_0ierIJrLVqsZSohA&userid=x2kIaq8x6Q2I6uJxmVg4cA If drip is THAT good, then where has this concoction been my whole life?!

Overall, I agree with the hype. The drinks here are pretty.. damn.. good.
author: Marthie D.

description: A little pricey, but definitely worth it. I hadn't been to Blue Bottle before and am usually a plain black coffee guy - the barista could not have been more helpful in asking for my taste preferences, explaining drink items, and making suggestions. I ended up getting the New Orleans iced coffee, which was delicious and not too heavy.
author: Chandrabh A.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying one thing: I am not a coffee drinker. I never drink coffee. Like ever. I don't mind the aromas and flavors of coffee, but I'd much rather have iced tea instead. 

With that said, I was absolutely amazed at how awesome Blue Bottle's New Orleans iced coffee was. I was able to have it nearly every single day, for about a week, for breakfast after getting off the Larkspur ferry and looked forward to it every single time.

With that said, the lines are very long and the service is a bit slow. But then again the reason the line is so long is because it's so good. I'm definitely a fan and can only hope that this small chain expands into Boston at some point in my lifetime so I can get more of that delicious drink.

As far as service goes, they're friendly and pretty quick. The stand itself doesn't offer much besides coffee and a few coffee-themed knick knacks. There's a few pastries available but nothing that great or worthwhile. There's no seating on the premise either, but you should be able to snag a spot around the Ferry Building if you walk around.
author: Jeremy K.

description: There are two blue bottle stores. We went to " take out " store where they offer sample coffee.  I  had cold brew New Orleans.  It was cold and refreshing ... ask for less ice since their ice was like huge !
author: Hannah K.

description:
Four years later, Blue Bottle is still the best spot for your espresso drinks anywhere. This place has its craft down pat. You will not find a better cup of cappuccino anywhere else. There will be no burnt taste, no scalding hot milk, and no flavored syrup in Blue Bottle's drinks so that you can actually taste how amazing coffee is supposed to taste.

Yes there will always be a line, but that's a given.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Blue Bottle like my life depends on it.

I am truly, madly, and deeply in love with the soy latte from Blue Bottle. No matter where I go as long as it is a Blue Bottle location, they always make it perfectly. It tastes like perfection every single time without much variation. The brew is always solid, the latte is always well made and the baristas are always friendly.

This location is, of course, no different. They are very busy but still manage to be up beat and make a killer cup of coffee. 

SO. HAPPY.
author: Lorrie M.

description: Ridiculously long line for ridiculously good coffee. The staff works as quickly as they can to serve amazing artisanal beans that are perfectly brewed. My decaf Americano was amazing. I will def come again but make sure you have lots of time and patience.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Why you have to be so faaaar! This weekend you captured my heart! Warm fuzzies every time I took a sip of you! You're absolutely better than Philz.... sorry someone had to say it.

This day I needed a pick me upper and you did me rigggght! I found you at the ferry building with a long line... Went up the barista and had a small convo with him.

Me: Can I have a redeye please?

Barista: Sorry can't do it.

Me: Can I have a redeye please?
