Barista: Sorry can't do it... by doing that I'm doing a disservice to you and our coffee. You'll have to buy them separately and pour it in yourself I can't be part of it. 

Me: Okay that's fine! *Mind punching his face...Whatt a coffee snob you are!*

Turns out that conversation led me to conclude that you were right... and I was wrong! Love at first sip! mmmmmmmmmmmmmmm! Hearts all around!

Recommendation: If you want to experience coffee at its finest, drink their coffee plain. If you put sugar or creamer or milk in it, you don't know what you are missing!

You made me a believer! Please have a location in the 626 area please!
author: John T.

description:
Blue Bottle just may become my SF quick breakfast routine! The drip here is big, bold, strong and made with love. I am also not usually a sweet breakfast person but these fresh waffles are to-die-for! They come warmed, in a coffee filter (um cuteeee!) and are just sweet enough.

Beware of the long line: at 8am on a Friday, I waited 15 minutes and then a few more minutes for my coffee and food but if you have time, it's well worth it.
author: Ninette C.

description:
One of the things I loved about staying near the Ferry Building was being able to walk over every morning and get Blue Bottle coffee. Both the mocha and the latte were smooth and flavorful. I also tried the single origin drip which was a very reasonable price and pretty good.  

The carmelized waffles are $3, and really tasty. It's already slightly sweet so no syrup needed and a really nice breakfast if you're on the go.  Coffee in one hand, waffle in the other.
Service was friendly, and despite the lines the coffee comes out reasonably quick.
author: Ed L.

description:
I don't really get the Blue Bottle train. The coffee is fine but not something I would wait in line for, really. 

I got the Louisiana iced coffee here. It's... OK, not terribly sweet. But I was expecting ambrosia from the way these reviews read, and ambrosia this was not. I did ask for skim milk and then I watched the barista pour regular milk into my cup. I was running late so I didn't feel like throwing a fuss and having her re-make it, but seriously?
author: Danielle C.

description:
Blue bottle!
I really love blue bottle coffee. I've been here multiple times and I love it! I got a caffe latte which was really good! The latte art and foam was lovely and the coffee had a really nice flavor. 
One of the things I love the most about blue bottle is the waffles! They are the best waffles I have ever had. They are fluffy and have an amazing texture to them and sweet without being overly sweet and great to go along with a drink (like the latte I got). 
I always wait in the side line but it can get long. Even if the line is long, it is still worth the wait!
author: Jenny G.

description: Honestly, I guess my expectations were kind of high? But I wasn't really stunned....I got a Three Africans coffee...It was pretty smooth, but I wasn't particularly amazed. Maybe I just don't have a very sophisticated taste for coffee and should have tried something else. I was kind of tempted by their waffles, so maybe I'll try it with a latte some other time..... but as of today I felt like it was kind of overrated, and the line was so long...a bunch of touristy people were standing by the cafe and taking selfies with their coffee cups, but it was just too hypey for me.
author: Diane J.

description:
I was debating between coffee, gelato, or a doughnut (so many good eats in the Ferry Building!) for a sugar/energy boost and caved into Blue Bottle. Sometimes caffeine just wins out! Who am I kidding, caffeine ALWAYS wins. 

I got a {MOCHA} and it was one of the best ones I've had in awhile - smooth, just enough foam, and not overly sweet. Starbucks has really made me forget what a good drink tastes like. And Blue Bottle uses TCHO chocolate in their mochas!

SERVICE - as with most Ferry Building locations on a weekend, it was busy. I saw a short line as I walked by and took advantage of the situation (although I was still waiting in line for 15 mins). My patience was rewarded with a beautifully decorated and equally yummy mocha. 

If you're a caffeine fiend, this is worth a visit (or any of the other Blue Bottle locations in the city).
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
The absolute BEST affogato over gelato I've ever had. Their cappuccinos are also excellent but seriously. Try their affogatos. 

I like this location because the atmosphere just absolutely feels perfect for coffee. It's inside the market place building and when you step outside, you get a perfect view of the bay. Let me tell you, having coffee by the bay is one of the best small pleasures you can have in San Francisco 

Buy a latte or cappuccino and walk around the marketplace. It's great

The only criticism is that they take a little bit longer
author: Kairos A.

description: Spent the morning visiting all the great eateries and shops in the Ferry Building.  My first stop was to Blue Bottle Coffee to warm up with a latte.  We only have a handful of great coffee places in Hawaii so I make it a point to visit great local coffee roasters when traveling.  Yes, the line is looooong, but the coffee does not disappoint.
author: Nadia K.

description:
Finallyyy tried Blue Bottle Coffee during my visit to SF and I am a fan!! Also love this location inside the Ferry Building! There was a line but it moved pretty quickly. 

I had the hardest time deciding which drink to try. If it's your first time, they recommend getting what you normally order at other coffee shops, since there isn't exactly one amazing drink they recommend. They're all good! So I decided on a cappuccino and my husband tried the New Orleans Iced Coffee. I really enjoyed my cappuccino! It was sooo smooth and had the perfect balance of flavor, not too bold or bland. I tried a sip of my husband's New Orleans Iced Coffee and his was also delicious! It's a little on the pricey side but I'd say it's worth it! 

I heard they're opening several locations in LA soon! Can't wait!!
author: Diana I.

description:
We were in the area and came by for a couple of coffees and a shortbread.....we had a new orleans and a macchiato. The service was efficient. The stand is set up in a very open plan area. It does not have the Blue Bottle feel of most other locations. So it is coffee without the environment and feel!

The coffee was good. Not the best of the Blue Bottle group and maybe that is because it came in a take out cup...my favourite Blue Bottle destination is still at Mint Plaza....
author: Mick A.

description:
So real talk, I ordered a New Orleans Iced Coffee (my typical order) and learned the perils of the Blue Bottle plastic lids. As I attempted to pierce my straw through the top of the plastic lid, the plastic lid decided to prove its resilience and inner strength and defied my best efforts. So instead of the straw-through-the-lid motion that is often taken for granted as an everyday occurrence, I witnessed the straw-pushing-the-entire-coffee-off-the-table-and-onto-the-floor motion. 

Sad. 

Consider this your warning about Blue Bottle coffee lids. Otherwise, Blue Bottle is absolutely delicious.
author: Olivia T.

description:
Blue Bottle is the stuff.  I think I still prefer Philz Coffee more days than not, but Blue Bottle is a close second.  

That being said - this is my least favorite location to pick up a cup of that delicious, smooth, caffeine-packed beverage.  TOO MANY TOURISTS!  Gladly, many of the tourists fail to notice there is a side window to place your order.  So often, my husband and I can still manage to grab a cup without much wait.  But if it's during the peak of tourist season, forget about it.  You won't find me anywhere near the Ferry Building - eek!
author: Rachael S.

description:
Wow! Some of the best espresso I can ever remember having!

We walked over to the Ferry Building one morning from the Hyatt Regency San Francisco to get our caffeine fix on. As we walked up, there was this amazingly rich, funky, delicious coffee smell - better than any I've ever smelled and experienced! I wanted to bottle that odor and rub it all over my body and spray in my car, my house, and everywhere!

I ordered a quad shot iced latte with whole milk. The drink was fantastic! Rich, bold, robust, flavorful, and strong!

The second day, I wandered over mid-afternoon and ordered a doppio espresso. They serve it in a small espresso cup with a side of water - a small shot glass of water to "cleanse the palate." I skipped the palate cleansing and let the richness of the espresso inundate my olfactory receptors. Strong, delicious espresso! I was bouncing off the walls for the next 30 minutes! :-)

If I lived around here, I'd be frequenting Blue Bottle religiously!
author: Neal E.

description: Boring compared to the Hayes Valley location, but I can't get enough of their New Orleans Iced Coffee.
author: Hugo C.

description:
Cap. with almond milk, was absolutely incredible.  
   or maybe it was just the location...
author: Scott C.

description:
Seriously the best coffee ever!! I have had lattes from many different coffee shops and I always feel like I need to put a packet or 2 of Splenda (and sometimes more) into my coffee. However the coffee at Blue Bottle is so amazing and I never need to add any sweetener. The best beans are used for their coffee and the beans are roasted perfectly. 

Another amazing aspect of Blue Bottle is that they never brew a pot of regular coffee. Instead the drip each cup of coffee fresh to order. You can tell a huge difference in the fresh drip coffee. 

The location is amazing as well. Located in the ferry building. I love grabbing my latte and go outside to drink it. Watch the ferries come in as well as an amazing view of the bay bridge. Best way to start your morning.
author: Rose Z.

description:
Nice ambiance by the bay.  

Normally they have two windows open.  This Sunday morning when I came by one was closed, so there was a long line for the side window.  I hope the closed front was only a temporary move. 

They have some good looking waffles. 

The coffee/espresso is worth the line.  

Plenty of European tourists, which is good for people watching
author: Joseph B.

description:
A friend wanted to try their coffee but was hesitant about the long line. I stood there with her because I knew and reassured her it would be worth it.

She got the affogato and I got a New Orleans Iced coffee with a sesame Absinthe bar. 

That affogato was amazing. The New Orleans iced coffee was super good and really woke me up. The sesame Absinthe bar was okay. Maybe I just don't like Absinthe.

Great coffee. Worth the long line.
author: Sofia R.

description: As a self proclaimed coffee fanatic this is simply the best quality coffee.  It is going to take about ten minutes for your pour over.  Take it easy in the beautiful environment while you wait.
author: M F.

description:
1) Affogado is $5.50 with two gigantic scoops of caramel ice cream. I thought it was worth it, considering how everything else in SF is insanely overpriced...

2) Open til late unlike other locations, other coffeeshops.

3) No seating but plenty of places to sit inside this Ferry building.

4) Great view outside if you want to take your caffeine to the pier/harbor.

5) If you can, get the espresso...
author: Marina S.

description: Flavor is great.. took off 2 stars because they basically give you a cup of ice for $4
author: Anna B.

description:
The mocha is so rich and smooth.  I love that it's not overly sweet like Starbucks.  

Get the waffle! It's so delicious.
author: Candice H.

description:
Blue Bottle really is great.  The coffee speaks for itself, and its the best emerging brand in the Bay Area.  There are a few smaller players who have good stuff too, but Blue Bottle is really solid, and they deserve the premium they charge over Peet's, Starbucks, etc.  That being said, they haven't cured cancer or reinvented the wheel, so I wouldn't ever wait in a line for 10 min+ for the espresso shot I drink in 30 seconds- Peet's will always be quicker and that's 1 minute away down the walkway and around the corner....  

There is a ton of available data for you to read about Blue Bottle- but my advice is the following:

-Ignore the 'main line' and always go straight for the 'semi-secret' window just around the corner facing the back doors of the Slanted Door restaurant.  This is just 20 feet from the main line but a lot of people don't notice it.  This line is always shorter and faster.

-I like the espressos a lot- they serve them with a little spritz of sparkling water on the side.  The New Orleans Iced Coffees are a great cold beverage option as well.  Affogatos (vanilla ice cream with espresso poured over) are fabulous as well.

That's about it.  Enjoy!
author: Andy S.

description:
I'm not the biggest coffee snob but a bestie of mine is and so this was on her must do on our trip to the ferry building.

The line was very intimidating but it went pretty quick and was way worth it.

She got the Three Africans drip and said it was incredible.
I just liked watching the whole process happen right before our eyes.

I also drooling over the fresh waffles but since the foodhall was so vast and interesting, I passed in order to save my calorie allowance for the cheese counter nearby.

Because this location is on a corner there are actually two windows to order from - not everyone knows that the side window takes orders too so you might just get served quicker with this little insider tip!

Enjoy your joe!
author: Kimmy T.

description: I was in San Francisco and I decided to find a Blue Bottle Coffee. I have had the pre-made product from the grocery store, and it is really delicious. I figured that fresh would be even better and I was right. This is some of the best coffee I have ever had. The quality is top notch. Every sip is worth the price. I think more coffee chains could learn a thing or two from Blue Bottle Coffee.
author: Kassie R.

description:
BBC in the Ferry Terminal is substantially sub-par beyond what I've come to expect from them. I usually avoid this outlet due to the long lines but friends wanted coffee so we did. 

Affogato  was afforgettable. Too much ice cream meant the mix of sweet vs bitter was gone. Ice cream tasted oddly salty and had a gummy texture.

Espresso - this was the most disappointing. Far from the standards first set at the Mint Plaza outlet (I think they have been slipping here too). This was bland and weak. Dare I say no better than Starbucks? Thankfully, I skipped the single origin for a buck more. I suspect the crowds and long lines mean the standards just drop like a stone.

If you're a coffee aficionado, there're vastly superior choices in the City, e.g. Ritual, Sight Glass, Four Barrel, etc.
author: Norman S.

description:
What can I say?  All the beans here are sold within 48 hours of roasting with multiple single origins available by pour over.  The espresso drinks are all on point and cold brew can be had as well on hotter days.  Even the long lines move fairly quickly.

Love Blue Bottle's coffee and can't say enough great things about each and every single origin roast I've tried.
author: Eric F.

description: If you're not familiar with Blue Bottle, they have great quality coffee! Their standard drip is actually a pour over. What they gave me was a little darker than what I'd normally drink but I still really enjoyed it. Great beans and a great location. A little bit of outside seating (this is a walk-up location) and a lot going on in the area.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Delicious coffee!! Some people may say it's over hyped up but I give blue bottle 5 stars because I enjoyed it thay much!!

It was a sunny day in embarcadero and we were in the ferry 1 building. I ordered the new Orleans styled ice coffee with soy milk. 

Pure deliciousness!!! The soy milk was the perfect touch. It almost tasted like coffee milk which tasted so nicely on a hot day.
author: Tina Y.

description:
I think it's better quality than Starbucks. 

Get in before they sell out!
author: M R.

description:
Was recommended by a friend and she was right! Line was fairly long on a Friday at 2pm. Ordered a drip coffee au lait and an affogato. Staff seemed a little bored , annoyed and pretentious. 'I'm a barista in San Francisco and I'm better than you ' vibe so that's the only reason for the removal of one star.  The coffee was tasty, well presented and worth the 10 minute wait as it's filtered in individual jugs. 
The ice cream they used was delicious and when I asked the barista where it was from he said ' I don't know, it's ice cream'.
author: Arlene M.

description:
Seeing how this location is a "stall" inside the Ferry Building, it's one of the busiest and is a to-go establishment (no seating). If you've never been to the Ferry Building, it's on the Embarcadero so there's only street metered parking or paid lots. Weekends or holidays are extremely packed. 

Drink Menu as of March 2014:
Espresso: $2.50
Macchiato: $3
Cappuccino: $3.25
Caffe latte: $3.75
Caffe Mocha:  ($4.75) made with Tcho Chocolate: 
Affogato: ($5.50) All espresso served double ristretto over Humphry Slocombe ice cream
Drip coffee: ($2.75) individually prepared
Cafe au Lait: $3.75
New Orleans style iced coffee: $3.75
Hot chocolate: ($3.5) made with Tcho Chocolate
Apple Juice / Lemonade: $3
San Benedetto Water: ($3) Sparkling or Still

I love how they use high quality ingredients in their drinks. They use Clover organic milk and they also provide raw sugar and a simple syrup at their condiments stand to add to your drink.

My go-to-drinks are the New Orleans style iced coffee, Cappuccino, or the Caffe Mocha. Strong coffee, it keeps me going when I'm walking around like a zombie. Generally good but since they are busy, sometimes the drinks aren't brewed well and are a bit on the watery side.

I've also tried the affogato which was a great way to get something to cool down and get caffeinated! :)

Note: They now sell the New Orleans style iced coffee in the cold brew section at Whole Foods if you don't live nearby.
author: Kitty K.

description: Seems to be going downhill. Coffee is slightly burnt, just not as fresh as expected. Cup sizes are small and pricey. Cups are cheap and flimsy. Careful not to topple your cup trying to put the lid on.
author: Raul M.

description: Excellent mocha. I much prefer it to the latte. But regardless of what you get, take it outside the Ferry Building and walk around because it's absolutely gorgeous.
author: Madhur B.

description: After vising the exploratium with the bf we walked through the ferry building to grab a snack. I've been wanting to try this because my  friends been raving about how the coffee is from here. I ordered the caffe latte and it was alright. It didn't taste like awesome enough for me to stand in line and wait for it and have to have it all the time kind of thing. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, I will try it again next time but order something different.
author: Judy V.

description: They should come to LAAA!!! Husband loved the coffee. Fragrant with a punch of "good morning, wakeeeeeeee up!!!" We bought the coffee grains so we can go home and enjoy them summore!
author: Isma S.

description:
There's always a wait here and it's almost (but not always) worth it. I usually buy a pound of fresh coffee when I'm here, and like that they have detailed description cards you can take with you (just ask for one, they're behind the counter).

I always get an Americano, not one of the fancier drinks, and it's on the stronger-side. Some might say bordering on bitter, but it's just right for my tastes. It's not americanized-corporate behemoth coffee - but people that source and roast their own along with lovingly pulling the shots.

Also - randomly I tried a pretzel from here last time and it was really good. Fluffy on the inside, crunchy on the outside. Not sure what bakery they use, but was a nice snack.

Highly recommended if you're a coffee-addict like me.
author: Joshua B.

description:
I've heard of Blue Bottle Coffee from so many of my friends over the years and I always pass it whenever I come to the Ferry Building in SF but I never stopped to try it because, well, 1) I'm not the biggest coffee aficionado and 2) I thought, "Can any place really beat Philz iced mint mojito coffee?"

Let me tell you.. I wish I stopped to try this place earlier in life!!! I recently made a trip to SF to eat at Hog Island and after my meal, I decided that it was time for me to try Blue Bottle since I've walked past it so many times. I got in line and started reading Yelp reviews because I had literally no idea what to order. I narrowed it down to either the Affogato or New Orleans iced coffee. 

When it was my turn to order, I asked the cashier which one she recommended and she said both are really good and popular and then she proceeded to tell me that the New Orleans iced coffee was already pre-brewed. After she said that, I caught myself wondering "How good can pre-brewed coffee be? Seems less fresh.. But then again I'm not a coffee expert nor do I drink it religiously so I guess I will have to see what the hype is about." I decided to go with the New Orleans iced coffee instead of the Affogato (espresso over ice cream) since my friend and I were already going to grab ice cream from Humphry Slocombe after. Since the New Orleans iced coffee is pre-brewed, my drink was ready by the time I finished paying. I took a sip of it, not expecting much, and WOW it blew me away!!! It was the perfect blend of creaminess and smoothness and had no hint of the bitterness of coffee that I don't like. 

I'll definitely be stopping to get Blue Bottle every time I come visit SF. Now I'm going to have a hard choice of deciding between Philz and Blue Bottle whenever I'm in the city... I guess I'll just have to get both :)

I just realized my review is a little long for a coffee place.. Oops sorry!!! I don't think my excitement from trying this place a few days ago has worn off yet heh. Let me make this a little easier for you... 
LONG STORY SHORT, YOU HAVE TO TRY THE NEW ORLEANS ICED COFFEE!!!
author: Melody Y.

description:
The line is a huge issue.

I'm a coffee snob and love the coffee, however, how much of my life do I want to spend waiting in line?
author: Petra S.

description:
At first taste of the latte I ordered, I wasn't impressed. For $3.75 (not including tip), I expected something a little more...richer in flavor. 

But upon asking my friends who are more familiar with the food and drink scene, I will definitely come back for their New Orleans Iced Coffee and base my new review off of that.
author: Viet N.

description:
Cafe Mocha. Heavenly. If I could hook this stuff up to an IV, I'd be a happy camper. 

Their service is cheerful and friendly, in spite of the never ending lines (which let's face it, if filled with tourists, could really grate on ones nerves) and their coffee is delicious. 

Grab a cup, stroll down the Embarcadero, be happy. The end.

PS: See pic.
author: Shachi B.

description:
For me, it was multiple things:

1: I don't know if I expected too much since I hear people rave about blue bottle so often, but it wasn't that great. For $5, I feel like it should have been so much better. I don't know I keep giving them chances and trying different things, cold brew, latte, whatever. 

2: For the young, probably in his twenties, cashier, i feel like if the drink was meant for someone else, don't give it to me. AKA: I see you holding it, calling another name for a good few minutes, decide that you don't know who it is, and leave it on the counter. AND THEN WHEN I ORDER THE SAME DRINK BY COINCIDENCE, YOU GIVE ME THAT SAME DRINK THAT HAS BEEN SITTING ON THE COUNTER. 

3: Same cashier dude, don't just grab my money out of my hand and then start talking to another customer and attempt to take her order as you are already #1 not done with mine, #2 aren't listening as to how I don't want the coffee that has been sitting there, and #3 clearly have trouble counting how much change you should be giving me back. 

Eventually I just got shoved out of the way and the cashier never paid attention to me again after just randomly placing my second drink on the counter and walking away. I was just so frustrated, I left. 

It's my fourth time trying this place, I'm over it, never again.
author: Alex L.

description:
Good.  I liked the ice cubes but they consumed a good amount of the cup's volume. 

The store associate said it would be strong without the milk and sugar so I got 3/4 coffee and 1/4 water.  It wasn't as strong as I was expecting but it was okay for iced coffee.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Always a mandatory stop whenever I'm in town! 

Despite the mayhem that is the Ferry Building, going through the long line to grab an espresso to quickly stop and enjoy is great. 

You can honestly never go wrong with Blue Bottle. I never venture off past my black coffee or espresso/Americano, but their New Orleans Iced Coffee is great!
author: Sarah C.

description:
What a delight it is for me to walk around the Embarcadero on a nice day. 

Destination: Blue Bottle Coffee. 

This perfect cup of coffee feels amazing on a nice day. 

Con: The line is freaking huge most times.
author: Irina R.

description:
Finally came around to trying this place after hearing their positive reviews, and I was not disappointed. Ordered their latte and cappuccino and I cannot forget how perfect the drinks were. I've had many lattes before where the espresso left a bitter aftertaste, but not this one. I liked how I could taste the layers of steamed milk from the the milk foam. The cappuccino was great as well-- milk was super frothy.

Lots of people were waiting in line but I liked how the baristas gave each drink individualized attention. Expect a line, but it'll be worth it.
author: Bryan L.

description:
What can I say that has not been said already?
The Pacific Northwest has brought down to our neck of the woods some awesome baristas. Most of them seem like they care and that means a lot. 
9 out of 10 times it's a winsome experience.
I like the two lines to order from and they are pretty quick.
The integration of Square on a swivel-y iPad stand just adds to that San Francisco Bay Area tech vibe and it makes me think of future-y things.
The fact that I can get aspectacular view of the Bay just seals the deal.
I gets me the NOLA iced in the summer heats. Drip when I want to save $1.
Caffe Latte when i am feeling creamy and want a bit of gas for the day.
author: Chris A.

description: The line was too long inside the Ferry Building, but got my first try in front at one of their stands. I've heard about Blue Bottle Coffee for quite some time, and to be honest, I wasn't so impressed with their iced coffee. It was okay, but I think I had too high of expectations that the coffee flavor was light, and possibly too much milk watering it down. Will have to try again and request more coffee than milk.
author: Denise L.

description: I wanted to try a San Fransisco spot for coffee, instead of the regular Starbucks you can get anywhere. I was happy to hear from my local friends about Blue Bottle. I got the Cafe Mocha which was really good and pretty with a heart in the foam :) Nice view of the Bay Bridge from the Ferry Building, too!
author: Cara H.

description: Just a coffee place. Not a lot of variety on the menu, but the cold brew was good. My wife asked for just a pinch of chocolate in her latte, since it was the only flavoring they had, and they loaded it up making hers undrinkable.
author: Ben B.

description: Espresso on ice cream.  Now you are talking my language.
author: Brad S.

description:
Great coffee made with care!

This place gets really crowded, and the line wraps around sometimes. But the staff still take their time to make every cup of coffee perfectly, and the patrons still all wait patiently because they know it's worth the wait. It's a little on the pricey side, but superior to the Peet's a few steps away. 

Try the cafe au lait - drip coffee with steamed milk. Organic milk! Oh, and don't expect this place to carry flavors like caramel or hazelnut. Straight deliciously prepared coffee.
author: Nancy N.

description: I was so excited to check out this legendary coffee spot.  It certainly did not disappoint!  I opted for the New Orleans iced coffee, and a Belgian waffle.  The line was long, but did not take long to get to the counter.  The coffee was smooth and rich with a nice chicory flavor.  I loved the waffle which was hot off the iron.  The staff is super friendly as well.
author: Amelia S.

description:
About the staff: It's very patient, upbeat and topically passionate about where they work. It makes a tremendous difference when experiencing premium coffee places. 

A happy cheers and recognition of their efforts and everyday battles. Thanks for keeping SF awake!
author: Ryan K.

description:
Ummm , I think it tastes better than Starbucks  of course. Their coffee has more flavor , but too little ice in ice coffee. I like more ice in my coffee . The ice cream affogato taste too sweet . Not as good as the review. 

I still prefer my Dunkin donut ice vanilla coffee .
author: Nguyen A.

description:
Good pit stop on a walk down the embarcadero. Iced coffee was strong and refreshing. Quick service too. 
Thanks dude!
author: Aaron S.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Blue Bottle Coffee. Every time I visit the Ferry Building, I MUST stop here for a coffee drink. 

MY LOVES:

CAFFE MOCHA- quality TCHO chocolate used, tasted more like a dark chocolate mocha, not too sweet (even my non-coffee drinking mother loved the Blue Bottle's hot chocolate, which used the same TCHO chocolate mix)

AFFOGATO - espresso poured over scoops of Humphrey Slocombe ice cream. A sweet, caffeinated treat, great for the afternoon pick-me-up.

MACCHIATO - nutty espresso and milk foam perfection, each sip has a thick and creamy finish

Plus, I love the foam art. Hearts and leaves, although common and basic art shapes, still leave me a happy customer.

Drinking a cup of Blue Bottle Coffee helps me wake up in the morning or keeps me peppy through the afternoon.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Who doesn't love a great cup of coffee for an affordable price? The line is usually a tad long but that's when you know its good! Cups might be small but they definitely pack a punch! I tried their new Orleans style iced coffee and usually I don't like anything in my coffee but I was open to this twist. It was a pretty nice change from my usual black coffee. My sister got the hot chocolate and it was so rich and chocolate-y you feel like you're drinking melted chocolate. It was THAT good. Yummm, can't wait to try the one in LA!
author: Katherine K.

description:
if you are a latte person, the workers will suggest you not force yourself to order the coffee here just because of the name! INSTEAD they suggest goin with whatcha NORMALLY prefer!

SO i got the soy latte (comes in a pretty small cup!)

it was good, smooth w/ NICE FOAM.. but not almost $5 bucks per latte amazing!!...... next time i will try the coffee!
author: Jenny S.

description:
There is a reason the lines are long, and that is because of the pure quality of their coffee.
They have an uncomplicated menu, which allows good quality control and proves that you don't need 60 flavors of drinks to lure in customers. 
I sampled the New Orleans iced, which brought me right back to my trips to New Orleans. It had a bold, strong flavor without being acidy. This isn't just hot brewed coffee poured over ice, it is actually cold brewed coffee with chicory. This place definitely has expertise in good coffee!
It is also fun to go across to the ice cream shop and get Vietnamese coffee ice cream from blue bottle.
author: Suzy W.

description:
The most awesome decaf espresso shots and caramelized Belgian waffles but so incredibly crowded.

Update.
On our most recent trip here we found only 3-4 people in line. Here's the trick. Come on a Monday, or maybe any workday, instead of the weekend  and come in the winter instead of tourist season. Oh, and try to arrive between the arrival times  of the commuter ferries from across the Bay. This is the Ferry building after all!

We got really lucky, just because of circumstance. The coffee, the food and the people are just as wonderful as on our last trip, two years ago.
author: Sara M.

description:
I love the coffee here! Because there are no flavor options, you really get to savor the coffee itself. And I must say, even when you brew their coffee beans at home, it is not the same as coming in.

When I visit on Saturdays during farmer's market it gets a bit busy (15 minute wait) but worth every sip. My favorite: latte with almond milk ($1 extra). 

In a nut shell: super rich-tasting artisan coffee!
author: Marissa P.

description:
They must have 4 or 5 locations at the Ferry Bldg. We were in dire need of caffeine and we basically pulled off a foot traffic version of what we all see at the bay bridge entrance. Stand in line for a really short time, skip over to the next lane. Repeat. 

We found ourselves at the outdoor stand and I wanted to try the real deal NO Iced Coffee. I had a taste at Burlingame Produce, but those folks have checked out. They made it up nice for me. It's pretty sweet and has some chicory flavors going on. Nice, strong cup of iced coffee mixed with real cream is such a nice treat. 

I purchased some whole beans for the road. Mexico Chiapas. My lovely lady, who happens to be 100% authentic Mexicana, made an interesting point as we walked away. Post purchase of course. 

Me "Babe, how ya like me now, with my Mexican coffee beans?"
Lizzy "Babe. Since when do Mexicans make good coffee?
Me Silence

That being said, it's not to bad. It's good in a pinch while I await the arrival of Stumptown Coffee.
author: Hector G.

description: This is at 1 Ferry Bldg, Ste 7, San Francisco, CA 94111. Very popular area for tourist and locals. Right on the water where the ferry terminals  are . The coffee is high-quality so be willing to wait alittle longer than your normal coffee spot. You will enjoy the view and the coffee.
author: Jennifer F.

description: I know this is a coffee place, BUT OMG THE WAFFLES. I've never had better waffles before. Perfectly warm and caramelized on top. Goes wonderfully with any coffee you get. Between my friends and I we tried the New Orleans style and mocha and they were both good. Can't wait to come back here for a latte!
author: Debika M.

description:
Overall, this highly hyped Blue Bottle Coffee location in the Ferry Building deserves four stars.

When the drinks are good, they are really good. Many times, I've had creamy, tasty, and rich mochas. The New Orleans Iced Coffee is also very tasty when it's brewed correctly-- try it with some milk for added creaminess!

However, the drinks have been bad on a couple random occasions-- the drip coffee has tasted burnt, and mochas have been all milk and little chocolate or coffee. The pastries are also not that good-- I haven't found one that is mind blowing. They seem to be overhyped...

Despite the few poor experiences, this location seems to be the most consistent for a tasty drink. This is a must stop while visiting SF!
author: Jackson L.

description:
While standing in the never ending line at the Blue Bottle stand, I overheard (ear-hustled) someone else say that Blue Bottle was on a list of "must visit" places in SF. After two visits to BB, I'm thinking that list writer doesn't get out too much. Not that it's bad coffee, oh no. In fact, it's great. But is it really worth going outta your way for?

The sexy Yelp n00b (Ms. SYN) I was with, suggested we get one soy latte from both Blue Bottle, and one from Peet's to compare. The verdict? It's a good thing I don't work for consumer reports. After taste testing both, I had a hard time choosing which one is "better". They were different enough, with Peet's being stronger flavored & much hotter in temperature, while BB was more balanced and you could tell it was made with care. The Peet's latte looked like a hot mess when sitting next to the artfully crafted Blue Bottle cup. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-bottle-coffee-co-san-francisco-8?select=9oC8_Fq3Nt6VVglqpLsOCg#w0MkmQpoPiWPnHOviXJ1Tg If that's worth paying an extra .20 cents, I can't blame you. In fact, I would choose Blue Bottle for the simple fact that they don't charge extra for soy. It's a flat $3.75 for a latte. Even if they are more expensive overall, it's the principal. At least if I'm getting robbed for my caffeine addiction, so is everyone else.

My only complaint about Blue Bottle would be consistency. Ms. SYN & I had been here once before, and we both remember it being a better cup 'o Joe. Then again, that time was a drizzly SF night around Christmas time so maybe it was just the nostalgia of the moment uplifting the entire experience. However, I can see how things could get a little wonky with the barista cranking out shot after shot for the ceaseless line of tourists. 

pro tip: OK, more of a realization that I'm a total n00b. I didn't even realize that Blue Bottle has two lines. One on the main thoroughfare of The Ferry Building, with the other being just around the corner from it.
author: John B.

description: Love all of the blue bottles, this one has less of a selection than others, and normally doesn't have the worst line (unless you go on weekends or during morning rush). The coffee is awesome as expected. Nice staff.
author: Jonah K.

description:
This was my first time actually buying coffee from Blue Bottle.  I've always seen this place so packed and I'm assuming it's because it's located in the Ferry Building.  Depsite the long line, the service is pretty fast.

I tried the Soy Mocha and a Belgian Waffle.  The Belgian Waffle was warm and not too sweet.  Pretty yummy.  I'm not much of a coffee drinker but I must say that the Soy Mocha was quite delicious.  Blue Bottle is one of the places I would definitely come back to if I were ever craving coffee (or a Belgian Waffle).
author: Rose A.

description: Fast service and friendly employees.  I am visiting from out of state and my friend said this is a must have.  He ordered the drip coffee and I had a iced coffee.  We also shared one of their famous waffles!  This is a  must have even if you do not normally go to coffee shops.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
So their coffee is nothing to write home about. The lines are long, and service is slow. Prices are ridiculous. I mean 4 dollars for a freakin small cup of mediocre coffee? It seems that if you pose yourself as a hipster place you're bound to be phenomenal. They didn't have any alternative sweetners like stevia or agave. Only brown sugar, which is not like so many other fair trade organic coffee places.

As a coffee conuisser Would recommend going to a local roaster buy yourself a pound of organic fair trade coffee ( about 10-12$) and make at least 20 cups of coffee in the comfort of your own home. The only redeeming quality is the fresh waffle which was definitely tasty!
author: Muja B.

description:
Unless you are a big coffee purist you probably have not heard about this place. But you should know some do pilgrimage here. And looking at the queue you may want just to skip it. Don't! 

This place is the art of coffee on a cup. Everything is micromanaged for you to have the best coffee experience posible. You may not appreciated the first time, but you will definitely notice the difference.
author: Tina S.

description:
This is my second favorite Blue Bottle shop only after the Oakland Webster St. because it's located in the eventful Ferry Building and they serve their deliciously made Belgian waffles! The lines can be quite long but they do move fairly quickly. 

Note: prices are slightly higher at this location.
author: Henry P.

description:
A long line is expected, but Blue Bottle is worth the wait. I got a simple drip coffee and it was perfect black. Personally, I love black coffee but the other members of my party also decided to take theirs black because it's that good.

If you wanna try it at home they have a great selection of beans, all recently roasted. If you don't have a Blue Bottle nearby they have a subscription program.

They also have some cute gift items. This is coffee for people who love coffee, not specialty coffee drinks - just an FYI.
author: Amy R.

description:
After hearing rave reviews about this place my mom and I decided to try it after running the sf marathon (only the half, because there's absolutely no way I would want any coffee product after running 26.2 miles ). The line was crazy long and seemed to move a little on the slow side, although it was probably from the marathon crowds. Ihe service is great, I feel like this staff is friendlier than other locations.
We both ordered the New Orleans iced coffee and I got a yogurt as well. In true hipster fashion the parfait was served in a mason jar but tasted amazing. The iced coffee was amazing, not too sweet but not too bitter, except the cup size is a little small for the price. 
Blue Bottle has become a must for both of us every time we're in the city. I'll brave the lines and the packed Ferry Building to get my iced coffee fix.
author: Debbie F.

description:
I ALWAYS stop by Blue Bottle when I'm at the Ferry Building.

When it's cold outside, I order the mocha. When it's warm outside, I get the iced coffee.

They are always super friendly in spite of all the customers they have to put up with all day long. I appreciate that.
author: Grace C.

description:
Five words: New Orleans Style Iced Coffee.

Get after it.
author: Jonelle T.

description: you will certainly get a very consistent cup of pour over coffee here, but will pay premium and stand in an incredibly long line. There are two places to pay for coffee and one is typically cash only and no espresso drinks. They sell some of their very limited release whole beans, as well as retail goods for homebrewing. Of the staff are friendly, there's very little time to chitchat as this is the coffee place in the ferry terminal marketplace. Good option for an after meal, warm drink, or something to go with your dessert.
author: David M.

description:
Coffee worth the wait.  Over the course of our trip to SF many, Many cups of coffee and its derivatives were consumed, much to my enjoyment.  Our friend introduced us to Blue Bottle Coffee.

Overall, the coffee is great.  They make each drip cup TO ORDER.  It's kind of nice unless you're in a hurry (too bad if you are) because you'll have to wait with the other zombies until you get to place your order.  Macchiato, Cappuccino, Affogatto, Mocha, Americano, Plain... all of them great.  Strong, rich and full of flavor.

*Splurge and order a waffle with the affogatto, it's a great combo.

Is it worth it? Yes.  Are there other places that serve equally delicious coffee and drinks? Absolutely, but that's for another review.
author: Dan H.

description: Waffle review:  YUM!  crispy and a great treat.
author: Jackie K.

description:
Waited 20 minutes at this location. Got the New Orleans Ice Coffee and it was rich, creamy, and delicious. 

+3.75 for an ice coffee 

The coffee was good, but I really wanted to try the one with ice cream in it. I definitely will come back and probably buy the coffee beans and make it myself. 

Good location too because you can walk about Ferry Building and enjoy the view.
author: Adam J.

description:
So I'm in San Francisco for the weekend and really wanted to try out some local coffee shops. I'm from Southern California so I asked someone I know from the Sacramento area who has been to SF a lot. He told me about Philz, Contraband, and Blue Bottle. I really just came here because there's one at the Ferry Building and we were nearby. 

My brother and I ordered for us and his girlfriend who was waiting outside the Ferry building with our puppy. I almost couldn't decide what I wanted but me and my brother's girlfriend went with a mocha, and my brother got a black coffee (the Guatemala one?). I also got a double chocolate cookie. I didn't know what to expect because 1. I don't usually get mochas and 2. I'm more of a iced coffee girl (but I was really cold, so decided to go for a hot beverage).

I was pretty impressed. We had waited maybe almost ten minutes for our drinks (there were a decent amount of people waiting for almost 6pm). They had given us one mocha and the black coffee, so we asked about our other mocha. I think the guy realized they had forgotten it or messed up because he looked a little surprised but said, "Oh yeah that'll be right out!" So I knew he was gonna do us right. I think I heard him say to one of the baristas to "fluff that one up." I'm not sure if that's what he said, but he had given some special orders to her. I was excited to get my drink because from the reviews I saw they did a cute design (I've never gotten a coffee with a design), but I think because they were kinda backed up they weren't doing that, which made me sad when I got my normal drink with no cute design. When they had called us for our second mocha, I was happy to see the cute design so I think that's what his special orders were. It was one of those nice extra touches that make your experience that much better ya know?

As for the taste, my mocha was pretty good. It was like liquid dark chocolate coffee, which might not be for everyone. The one thing I could complain about is that it wasn't as hot as I would've liked so it got cold somewhat quick. My brother's black coffee was definitely hotter, but he said he really enjoyed his too. Oh also, the cookie was yummy! I'm not giving it a 5 star just because it wasn't the best coffee I've ever had, but still really good and I was impressed with their service for being pretty busy. You can also tell they were trying really hard to get the drinks out efficiently even for having to handcraft each one individually.
author: Celine D.

description:
SO GOOD.

SO SO SO GOOD!

I got a vegan chocolate soy mocha, and it was delish! I am so used to having to not get mochas because everyone's chocolate powder has milk powder in it too, so I was happy not to have to forgo my favorite drink in the world this time around. Smooth, creamy, chocolatey, satisfying in all the ways something with milk would be without having it (and possibly even better).

Bonus points for having compostable lids! Grab one, head for the bookstore, buy a book and read it on a bench facing the ocean. Perfection.
author: Lynne S.

description:
Dear waffles + coffee from Blue Bottle.
I love you.
Sincerely, Joanne.
author: Joanne W.

description: Interesting hot chocolate. My boyfriend got the herbal tea and thank god I was driving home because it was camomile tea, we did not even think about asking what type of herbal tea it was. My hot chocolate was not the best it tasted very organic and had a hint of some type of mint I think. There was a line out the door for this coffee but I'm not quite sure why, I don't think we will be back to this coffee shop anytime soon. Not quite sure what the big hoopla was for this coffee.
author: K Elizabeth G.

description:
New Orleans (++++++++)
Belgian waffle (+++)
Poppin ass music (++++)
Cute granola mason jars (+)
Chatty staff and very friendly (++)

Hella long lines even at 7 am (----)
Chatty staff so expect to wait (--)
Completely forgot my order (---) 

But apologized! (+)
Bonus: now they have plastic cups for iced drinks! No more soggy paper cups yay! (++++++++)

Tip: ask for light ice in the New Orleans!
author: Shirley N.

description: I just love my blue bottle! A stroll down the embarcadero with an iced new orlie on hand, is just what I need. Great coffee and they roast/deliver whole/ground beans to your door with a subscription based service offered on their website. Cappuccinos and New-Orleans style iced coffees are my go to's! Enjoy :D
author: Haydee B.

description: Blue Bottle is my absolute favorite coffee place in San Francisco!
author: Christy V.

description:
MMMM. Blue Bottle Coffee always soothes the soul. 

Tried the affogato here as well, and it was the BEEES KNEEEES. Perfect combination of just the right amount of bitterness and sweetness. For a good month or so, my dude friend thing and I craved the tastes of this affogato... but we couldn't find any affogato that could compare in San Jose. I guess we'll just have to drive back up to San Francisco. 

Oh! Oh! And the servers are very kind!
author: Kim N.

description: It was super busy when I went on a Saturday morning. I went mostly for the fancy latté art and was a little disappointed when it didn't turn out that pretty. I got the latté, and it was perfect, not too sweet. I would go again.
author: Danica F.

description:
Overrated for sure. 

It is in a nice location in the ferry building at Embarcadero, right on the pier, but it is expensive and wayy too bitter.

I got the New Orleans iced coffee and it was disgustingg! It was soo bitter, it was practically sour.. my friend I told later insisted that they must have messed up on making mine, but I don't know if I'll be coming back for a second try.

Philz' iced Mint Mojito is the way to go!
author: Hye-Min O.

description:
Well Blue Bottle is great, of course.  Today was my first visit to the Ferry Building location.  Three quick tips:

1. There are two lines for this booth -- one in front of the booth and one off to the side, near the restrooms.  The second line seems to be less noticed than the first.  For example, I didn't realize it was there until I had finished my purchase.

2. My purchase: it was an affogato made with a Humphry Slocombe honey-infused ice cream.  Great stuff!!  As far as I understand, the BBCC affogato is offered only at this location.

3. Although most people get their drinks (and affogatos...) "to go" in paper, you can get glass or ceramic if you ask for it.  I got my affogato in a big white ceramic bowl with a metal spoon.  Oh, by the way, the affogato costs $6.02 (including tax) but features two generous scoops of ice cream and a double espresso.  It's definitely worth trying.

On this bright warm Friday in June, the Ferry Building was teeming with tourists and local office workers who were forming long lines in front of places like Gott's Roadside.  Those lines looked like they weren't moving very fast.  By contrast, BBCC did a good job of getting people served.  I probably didn't wait more than 10 minutes between my arrival at the booth and the delivery of my purchase.
author: Kenneth R.

description: I was here last week. The coffee was average and expensive, and the staff was soooo pretentious. Walk across the street and have a better, less expensive coffee practically any place else.
author: Mike C.

description: Beautiful venue, nice staff, but weak drip coffee, which is what I ordered. The espresso drinks looked delicious and I think that is what I was meant to order here. Based off of the long line and plentiful recommendations for BB, I would come back and try one of those before making a final judgement. :-)
author: Kathy M.

description:
Ahhh...At last we meet...

It has literally been years, that I have been eagerly anticipating the face to face encounter with this highly reputable coffee known as Blue Bottle and all I can ask my self is, WHY???

I decided to go on a morning jog over at the embarcadero one early morning recently and since I had not had my morning joe yet, I decided to allow the embarcadero to present me with the perfect place to get my fix on. Strolling down past all the little shops, I saw the famous words BLUE BOTTLE COFFEE.... It almost felt as if I had been stranded on a ship for days and finally saw land from a distance" Are you serious I said to myself" of course I headed on over to an (expected) extremely long line.

Its a small little shop here though, everything was presented quite well. They serve the drip coffee, lattes, Cafe Au Laite, a few tempting pastries and of course a generous selection of there whole bean coffee's.

I got a soy Cafe Au laite (they only have one size) and an 8oz bag of there Giant Steps whole bean coffee. Total came to about $11 and some change.

OMG was my Cafe Au Laite not only foamy and decoratively appealing, It was absolutely smooth, delicious and out of this world good! No bad after taste nothing! Perfect!!! Not to mention the service was exceptionally sincere and friendly!

Oh, I will be back fo sure!!
author: Shannon H.

description:
Legit coffee, which is probably why the line is so outrageously long. I'm not a legit coffee drinker and had to add a ton of sugar to my latte. It was still enjoyable nonetheless! 

I also grabbed a ginger molasses cookie, which was to die for. I definitely recommend trying their baked goods!!! The cookie was soft and delicate with a rich ginger flavor. YUMYUMYUM!
author: Maryann S.

description: Had to try blue bottle after hearing from so many fans. It's sooo good. Smooth and just good.
author: Berg T.

description:
Starbucks, get out of the way. 
Blue Bottle Coffee is amazing. Its not cheap but totally worth the splurge. I had an iced coffee on a warm day in San Fransisco and walked around the water drinking it. IT was slightly sweetened, but not too sweet. I wish we had it in NY.
author: Stephanie Q.

description: Delicious, always consistent brew. My favorites are the latte and New Orleans iced coffee. Check out the  sweet and savory treats as well - olive shortbread is my personal favorite. Can get crowded, especially on weekends with long lines of tourists, but worth the wait and patience.
author: Sarah T.

description: I've been wondering about the hype for Blue Bottle for a few years now. I've dozens of reviews and I have to admit its an excellent coffee. I had a latte at the SF Ferry Building location. The line was long but the staff was very friendly and fun. The barista did a great design in my steamed milk and the taste was fantastic. I normally sweetener in my coffee but the Blue Bottle really didn't need any it tasted that good. I bought a bag of beans to take home and I will be back on my next visit to the Ferry Market place.
author: Shawn R.

description: Maybe it was just a fluke day but the New Orleans Style Iced Coffee wasn't that great. Three of us ordered it and none of us liked it that much. It didn't really have a taste to it besides bitter. It did taste less terrible with "2%" (just a mix of whole and non fat milk) because it tasted smoother and less bitter. Maybe I'll give it another chance when there's no line but in my opinion, it just seems like all hype.
author: Justin P.

description:
While my wife stood in line, I took my two boys to the gelato place down the hall. We come back to find about a dozen strangers standing around my wife high-giving her like she's a rock star. Turns out that some chick snuck up to the front of the line pretending to look at the merchandise only to make a quick switch-a-roo and cut in line to order a latte. My wife, who is a 7th grade English teacher, is not afraid to call a cheater out. She caught the offending cutter in the act and lambasted her in front of her other caffeine jonesing brothers and sisters. She earned stardom from the crowd and was treated to the absolute best latte in town. 

I'm sorry, but there is no better place for an espresso drink in the City. These people care about their craft. The milk is the perfect temp and the foam is not too dry, not too wet...dense and smooth and almost silky. The coffee is true to its character, slightly smokey and strong. 

This place is worth the wait!
author: Donnie Mac M.

description: First time for me at a blue bottle location, I've only had the boxed stuff up til this point. The single origin cold brew was delicious, and the ice cubes they use are primo stuff.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
New orleans iced coffee. Soo goooood. If youre not much of a coffee drinker id highly recommend it. Its not too strong or bitter. Tehe they have cute cups too.

Unfortunately thats really all ive tried the 2-3x ive been here. Definitely gotta try that gibraltar the next time im here.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Ive always wanted to come here
There was none in LA when i lived there
Love their coffee 
Unique and sweet

Hard to find parking
author: Kristine S.

description: Yay have finally come to this Blue Bottle. I've tried Blue Bottle all over the place, but never got the chance to try the Ferry Building one. And at the end of the day.. they maintain their usual consistency and deliciousness. I got an iced coffee most recently when I came here. Lines are really really long here. If you ever come on a farmer's market day, I'd actually recommend going to one of their booths outside of the Ferry Building since the lines are much shorter outside than they are inside. Coffee was good and prepared super quickly, classic Blue Bottle.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Blue Bottle always delivers a good cup of coffee! You can choose between several coffee types for a drip or pour over coffee or usually two different types of iced coffee, as well as espresso based beverages. This location tends to have a line due to its popular location in the Ferry Building, but the line usually moves fast. This is a great stop to make during a day of exploring.
author: Charlotte A.

description:
The bottom line: this is a very good coffeeshop, with baristas that will take the time to answer questions and recommend blends. The product itself is high quality, too. It is a bit expensive, but you pay for quality -- and we are talking San Francisco here. 

I had been wanting to try Humphry Slocombe ice cream (local to SF), and was a bit disappointed that the outlet in the Ferry Building wasn't yet open. However, Blue Bottle had me covered with an item that was HS ice cream with their own delicious coffee poured over it. The sweet/salty ice cream and exceptionally rich coffee was great.

The wife had New Orleans iced coffee. I must say we've been to New Orleans and have tried this in the Crescent City itself... and they managed to capture it perfectly. Again, it was delicious. 

While I haven't tried all the outlets (Blue Bottle is a small chain), based on this experience, it is a gem for the city.
author: Ian T.

description:
My first time at Blue Bottle lived up to its hype. 

I ordered the New Orleans iced coffee and received one for free b/c the worker was having a terribly long day. It may be the best iced coffee I've had in my life. I sort of wish I could drink one every day.
author: Caroline J.

description: Best coffee for this trip. Ordered drip coffee and it was perfect. It tasted light at the first sip, subsequently revealed its medium bodied taste. A friend of mine ordered latte and cappuccino, and it was perfect too. Totally recommend this to coffee drinker out there.
author: E T.

description:
I've made it a point now to stop and get my caffeine fix here anytime I'm anywhere near the Ferry Building. 

Yes, lines are long with tourists (like others have noted, check out the side window if the main line is too long) so just chat it up with your friend, person next to you in line or just play Angry Birds on your phone and before you know it, you'll be at the front of the line. 

The staff here has always been very friendly and serve up their delicious coffee with a smile. My usual go to is the cappuccino which is nice and smooth and always comes with a cool foam art design on top so you can Instagram the sh*t out of it.

I'm going to have to try some of the other menu items next time I come around, like the New Orleans style iced coffee or the waffles that everyone on Yelp have been raving about. 

Blue Bottle, I'll be back
author: Craig F.

description:
I find it surprising that very few places can make a good latte, which in my book requires 3 things: 1) microfoam, 2) a distinguishable espresso flavor up-front, and 3) an aftertaste of coffee.  It must be difficult, really I have no idea how difficult, but based on my experience searching for the latte triad, I can say that it's worth 5 stars if I find it. And Blue Bottle has it.

...Now add liege waffles to that.  Ok, they're not anywhere near the best liege waffles, but any liege waffles beats the pants off of no liege waffles.  When was the last time you were at a cafe and knew deep down that you would say no to a hot, sweet, fluffy liege waffle?

So, I'm quite glad that I decided to stand in the 10 minute line, and I'd do it again.
author: Ryan B.

description: After looking at a few reviews on Yelp, we decided to try this place out. The lines were certainly long no matter what time you decide to get in.  I had their New Orleans style iced coffee and it tasted okay, fresh with a slight tartness to it.  Other coffee lovers might enjoy it more than I did.  I do feel that the shop was a bit overhyped and not really worth the 30-minute wait. There's also no seating area, so it's a grab-and-go shop inside the Ferry Building.
author: Nick A.

description:
Meh... I can't believe I waited over twenty minutes for an "ok" coffee. 

As a Nespresso drinker I found the Drip Coffee from Blue Bottle Coffee a bit weak and bitter. I like bold roasted coffees, but I thought the drip coffee I ordered was a little too "bright" and "acidic". Perhaps I should have ordered an espresso or latte instead?  The coffee was expensive, but it wasn't any more ridiculous than the prices at Starbucks or Peets. The drink menu at Blue Bottle Coffee seemed limited, but maybe it was a smaller menu since we were in the Ferry Building Marketplace?

I'd give the coffee another shot, but I won't wait in line for 20 minutes next time!
author: Michelle M.

description: It wasn't my favorite. I saw the long line and heard about the hype over this coffee shop so I was excited to try it. I had the "Single origin" cold brew and it tasted fine. But I wasn't impressed enough to want to go back and stand in the line next time. To be fair, the lines are long because of the way they make the coffee. This is a drip coffee store. The plus side is that the company is environmentally-friendly. They have stainless steel spoons at the mixing/customizing table. Woot woot.
author: Jules K.

description:
This coffee is as good as it gets, i get a waffle as well when i didn't have breakfast. 
The waffle is slightly sweeten and really does melt in your mouth. i have tried all the coffees they offer and love the cappuccino the best.  Their latte and Hot coco are amazing as well. not a big fan of the New Orleans Ice Coffee, but that might just be me as i don't really like iced drinks. 

there coffee beans are mainly from El salvador, and they smell amazing. 

Service is great, there is a line but it moves fast. and always love the latte art they do. they even do it on hot chocolate which i have never seen before. 

Definitely try thier coffee, it is one of the best and competes with phillzz in quality, might i say even better.
author: Anuj C.

description: I had the iced coffee and it was delicious flavored with Blue Bottle's own concoction of sweetened milk. But my favorite part? The perfectly square, large ice cubes! Yes, I'm a sucker for a gimmick but really made drinking my coffee an "experience". LOL!
author: Frances H.

description:
Blue Bottle is our go-to coffee roaster...though this may change.  I have to say that the BEST cup of coffee I ever had was from here - natural processed Yirgacheffe.  It was a delight.  About 6 months ago my boyfriend started subscribing to Blue Bottle through the mail.  The beans we get are okay, but not always amazing.  And they are pricey...I think we may have to switch up roasters...

Back to this actual location - located in the Ferry building.  There always seems to be a line.  The waffles are amazing to go with your coffee.  I usually get a pour over or an iced coffee.  Both are on-point.  No big complaints except there really is no seating and you can't really chat up the baristas.  This seems to be more of a spot to grab a good coffee and stay on the go.
author: Jackie B.

description:
Coffees here are pretty great.  But there is always a huge line up.  

They are more pricey than your average beans, but the difference in taste is pretty noticable. You'll appreciate paying the extra dollars for their coffee. 

Tips!
- If you are buying just beans you can go sideways just go straight up to the counter.  
- There is a secret windows line on the left hand side, down the alley way, its also often shorter and has everything on the menu as the main shop front. 

Should definitely try their waffles, its delicious!!!
author: Maggie F.

description:
Long lines but worth the wait. We stood in the express or to go line because it was shorter than the other line.

Loved the cafe latte. Blue bottle coffee is awesome and the real deal when it comes to coffee. 

The New Orleans style iced coffee was delicious if you like your coffee on the sweet side. 

So glad I finally got to try this place!
author: Tracey W.

description:
My favorite Blue Bottle location features a side "express" window where you can order and another line (the line at the express window is usually shorter). In addition to excellent coffee, they have unique pastries (e.g., Arborio rice cake, coffee cake, shortbread), affrogato made with Humphry Slocombe ice cream, and yogurt parfaits. They also sell coffee accessories and BB apparel. 

* Gingerbread http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-bottle-coffee-co-san-francisco-8?userid=NOUfyJW-BAo_-Cbfo8edww#9oC8_Fq3Nt6VVglqpLsOCg: has coffee in it, moist, strong, and spicy, very good
The espresso drinks come in one size. Nonfat milk is available. Drip coffee is individually prepared. Cups and lids are compostable.
* Latte ($3.75): smooth, strong and not bitter, pretty foam art too. Too bad this doesn't come in a larger size. 

Expect a long line. Not cash only (yay).
author: Lolia S.

description:
Always a line, but well worth the wait! Today I had the waffle for the first time which prompted me to finally write a review. This is the best waffle I have ever had! I heard the lady in front of me describe it as "melt in your mouth goodness." I had to get one after I heard that and it lived up to what the woman was saying! I want another one!

Soy mocha was perfect! I love the tcho chocolate they use. Friendly service and wonderful vibes! What a great way to start my morning in the city!
author: Darcy R.

description:
VERDICT: Definitely not worth the long wait.

QUALIFIER: You should know exactly what you want before you get to the front of the line to order!

FOOD: They have a short order list. There was very little flavor in the espresso coffee.

SERVICE: The lines extend out into the corridor! Be prepared for a long wait. We only waited about 30 minutes in line.
author: Harry T.

description:
Going to raise it up a star. Blue Bottle consistently makes the best coffee drinks I've ever had outside of Philz (which I haven't been to in a couple of years). Lines are still super long at this location, but if you're there relatively early, it isn't too bad. 

Americano was superb. They also source interesting and delicious pastries. Always worth a try. 

Beautiful foam art as well.
author: Nora S.

description:
While the line is excruciatingly long, the coffee is certainly worth the wait. Especially when you have great friends waiting in line with you, chatting it up. Hi Lora!!!

Lora M. introduced me to this place during one of our many girls' day in the city. We went to the ferry and I needed a little pick me up, so Lora directed us to Blue Bottle.

I ordered the Mocha (my staple drink) and it was absolutely delicious. The rich, smooth coffee mixed in with (I believe TCHO) chocolate entices you to moan in delight. It's just freaking smooth, smooth like Ryan Gosling in Crazy Stupid Love. It's just that sexy.
author: Elsvette B.

description: Ordered the caffe latte while I was in the ferry building.  It was great for a chilly walk to Chinatown.  Ordered at the secret side window and there was a short 10 min wait.  I wouldn't mind coming back here again, but try a different location.  This one is too upscale and commercialized.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
Smells delicious, looks delicious, tastes delicious.
Espresso and mocha were both winners.
You know the drill, get in line, and make an order.
P.S.  skip the lid
author: Andrew H.

description: I don't think Blue Bottle care about their quality or customer service anymore. My coffee is never hot or brewed with care, the cup is always wet or dirty on the outside from being splashed around. I get that it's hectic on the weekends but for the increased prices, I can't do it anymore. But they don't care cuz I'll be replaced by another tourist.
author: Candace C.

description: OK.  My first review as not so good for them for the plain coffee.  This time, I ordered a latte and I now can see why people line up for this place.  The line was still pretty long, about a 20 minute wait on a Saturday morning.   Personally, I would skip the line and go to another cafe close by but my family loves this place.
author: Ken K.

description: Well, I do like blue bottle despite the long lines and snobbery.  So when I do wait in their evil line, and pay their high price, I expect a very good product.  And what I received was inexcusable, the mocha slopped all over the mug and plate, and I mean a lot.  And they still served it to me, without either wiping the mess up or offering a new one.  OK, I can live with that.  But then they did not even mix up the chocolate in it.  $5 bucks, a 15 minute wait, and a lousy moccha.  Very disappointed.  Try Paramo, superior.
author: gary g.

description:
Overrated. Inconsistent. Overhyped. 

The baristas are ALWAYS rude. It's like the slightest variation or question is met with a "how do you not know that" look. 

The lines are ridiculously long...all for burnt tasting coffee. There's so much better tasting roasts that are better brewed elsewhere. 

Unless you're a hipster who likes being berated and drinking burnt coffee, then yeah go for it.
author: Sujin Y.

description:
I consider myself somewhat of a latte guru, and I was excited to try Blue Bottle after hearing all the reviews. The line took about 8 minutes to get through on a Friday morning which wasn't bad, especially considering my latte was ready about 3 minutes after that. OMG- really guys these people know what they're doing. Bought a chèvre-jam sandwich on fresh brioche from the cow creamery next door and took it outside to enjoy the sunshine. 
Unfortunately I returned the next morning and the line was out the building due to farmers market.
author: Summer S.

description:
A morning at the Farmer's Market is not complete without a cup of Joe from Blue Bottle. This continues to be my favorite coffee in the city. 

I almost always take my coffee black, but here I'll welcome the exception with the Caffe Latte. Creamy, but light! There's a small cart outside, which moves along really quick. If you're willing to wait, try going inside the building to the actual shop where you can grab a waffle. It's not too sweet and the texture is great. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The waffles are made to order, which can take about 10-15 mins. Go if you have time, but you're not missing out if you can't grab a bite. 


Don't be too quick to cap/stir your coffee!! The barista will hand you your cup topped with foam art, which always helps with the Instagram likes!
author: Vi K.

description:
It would be easy for the baristas in this fast-paced, tourist swamped location to cut corners or lose their cool, but they don't. 
The coffee here is as great at any other blue bottle location, and the service is gracious.
author: Katrina H.

description:
Perfect location - right inside the ferry building 

Pros:
- excellent drip coffee
- friendly service 
- cafe mocha & New Orleans iced coffee

Cons:
- long, long wait

Overall:
4 stars. Extremely good coffee - wish we had a blue bottle in SoCal! Great location in the ferry building along the embarcadero. However, also a very tourist location so the line was ridiculously long. The cafe mocha  was extremely rich and delicious and service was superb. The two barista were very friendly and apologetic for their line - great service and amazing coffee, blue bottle!
author: Thu H.

description: New Orleans Iced Coffee, that is all.
author: Tim R.

description:
I had one of the best lattes that I've had in the US (the other one was in Boston I think?....) here. You'll find Blue Bottle Coffee Co. at one of my favourite places in San Fran.... The Ferry Building Marketplace!

We, Aussies, love our coffee and our love for this beverage makes us really passionate about it, to the point where we can be quite critical about a cafe that doesn't do the drink justice. Anyway, Blue Bottle gets it right in my opinion (hang on.. Am I quoting the Good Wife?).

They've got a cool logo and a nice setup. The staff are really friendly and nice. I love it... It's definitely worth its spot at the Ferry Building.. 

Check it out!
author: Kevin S.

description: This place is fantastic.  I bought a bag of coffee and ordered a New Orleans and since I bought the bag he gave me my drink on the house!  Also - the New Orleans - try it.  A standout amongst other cold coffee drinks!
author: Jeff S.

description: Visited about a week ago. Ordered a hot chocolate which was chocolaty but not too sweet. Perfect way to warm up during the chilly evening.
author: Jackie M.

description:
A homeless man once told me 'blue bottle coffee  cures cancer."  

I'm pretty sure he was right.
author: Sean E.

description: Friggin, best place for coffee! Everything organic from the milk to the beans! Even the water is micro filtered to its purest form. They don't use coffee beans that are 48hrs old after the bag is opened. Oh, and the waffles are amazing!
author: Victor H.

description:
This place was remodeled since I was last here about a year ago! As always, the storefront aesthetic was clean, simple, and overall just beautiful.

I ordered a mocha because I was craving a hot chocolate on a windy San Francisco day, but needed a caffeine kick at the same time, so a mocha seemed like the perfect solution. However, it wasn't as chocolaty as I was hoping, and although I appreciate that it wasn't too sweet, I think it could have used just a touch more cocoa. But the quality of the coffee was stellar; I know if I had ordered my usual cappuccino I would have been a very happy camper.

Overall a great experience. Staff is friendly, love the design of the shop, and enjoyed my coffee. Definitely treat yourself if you're in the area!
author: Sabrina C.

description:
The cappuccinos and lattes at Blue Bottle are nice and smooth.  I try a different Blue Bottle location every time I visit, Jack London, SOMA, and Ferry Plaza and they're all consistently good.  I try to savor my drinks, but it usually only lasts about 10 minutes.  I do have two gripes:

1. I appreciate that there are two lines to make the wait shorter, but that's confusing.  Especially since I'm not from around San Fran, it gave me a little anxiety, which line do I stand in?  Do I stand here and make my friend stand in the other?  I felt like we had to be strategic just ordering a cup of coffee. 

2. I like iced drinks because I tend to drink it slower, but why don't they have plastic cups?  When I ordered the iced drinks, they used the same paper cups as hot drinks.  It makes the drink start to taste like soggy paper.
author: Adrienne K.

description:
Heard about this place for a few years now, so I'm sure my review is late to the game! It was a perfect, warm afternoon to be roaming around the ferry building. What's a better way to cool off the sweat and quench your sun-causing sleepy thirst? That New Orleans iced coffee or AFFOGATO (espresso over a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream)

Definitely one of the better cup of joe I have ever had. They also have the option of substituting milk with almond milk for an extra dollar.  I'm usually not a huge fan of coffee, so for me to like this was impressive! 

The line can be overwhelming, but it moves relatively quick. Give it a try!
author: Johanna T.

description:
In my one year as a San Francisco resident and my 1.5 years as a law student, I would say that I have reasonable knowledge about coffee... or so I would like to think.

Blue Bottle is easily the best coffee that I have had in the City!  It not only tastes good, but it is also quite potent, which is mostly what I look for since I study 24/7.  Even if you aren't a seasoned coffee aficionado, Blue Bottle just tastes good.  Blue Bottle certainly does not have an extensive menu like Philz Coffee does, but the latte is a safe bet.  

If you're in a rush, I wouldn't recommend getting Blue Bottle, because it can take a while - especially in the Ferry Building.  However, if you have time to walk around, I suggest getting a cup of coffee, sitting at the bar, and talking to the baristas!  They are very talented and some of them have attended barista competitions (:  You'll learn a thing or two in a couple of minutes!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Being an Aussie, I can be incredibly pedantic about my coffee. American coffee has generally had a pretty terrible reputation but I'd heard so many good things about Blue Bottle I just had to give it a try.

My boyfriend and I jumped on the end of a fairly long line and ordered two macchiatos. We waited about 5 mins for them to arrive and they were INCREDIBLE. So smooth, so flavourful, no bitterness whatsoever. Hands down the best coffee I've had in the USA.

It was a bit pricey, but totally worth it.
author: Tracey Y.

description: I am not a coffee drinker but this place makes me wanna enjoy a coupe of latte. Absolutely delicious. Unlike any coffee I have ever had. Consistent quality. I have had this about 10 times now.
author: Amit T.

description:
This will probably be my shortest review to date because I am leaving my Blue Bottle experience totally indifferent. More of a bad thing than a good thing I'm sorry to say, almost even confused. The highly touted New Orleans Cold Brew was unexciting. Solid, yes. But worth the wait, not really. Maybe it's me not knowing what to look for as a self proclaimed non-coffee afficiando. But having a plain Starbucks hours before, I was hoping to have that "ah ha" moment. That one moment where I regret the consistent loading of my gold Starbucks card, or the rare times I chose Peet's, Philz, Coffee Bean, and Dutch Bros. But alas, that moment never came. Maybe Ritual or Sightglass will do it for me. 

But the biggest issue I have it with my experience was surrounding the Liege Waffle. To preface, I had a tiny piece of this snack in the past and remember it quite fondly. Now was my chance to have my own. When I ordered it, the cashier responded that they no longer sold the waffle after 2PM. Please correct me if I did not see it, but there was no sign in sight that announced that fact. Couple that with the customer 2 ahead of me delightfully devouring his waffle, I was clearly confused at the cashier's "we don't serve it anymore." Tell me you ran out. Tell me the waffle maker broke and you're burning every single one. Tell me you don't like me and like there other customer better. But do not tell me you aren't selling the waffle 2 min after you sold the "last one". I walked away from Blue Bottle unimpressed and looking for ice cream instead. Hey, you get one extra star for your great looking cups.
