Drip coffee is unique and delish. Also like their new Orleans on ice w soy on a warmer day. Waffles are $3 each, hot off the press, thick, dense, crunchy, a tad sweet, and buttery. Definitely a yum!! I always buy my few months worth of beans too..hmm
Love coming here Saturday mornings, enjoy my coffee and walk around farmers market.
author: Linda T.

description:
I finally got to try this place on Saturday. It was crowded but the line went pretty fast. I heard that this location is always busy, so I didn't mind the crowds. They actually have two lines going; one in the front where all the other business are, and one to the side of the shop. This is really nice because it cuts the line down by half. 

Blue bottle coffee lives up its hype. A delicious cup of joe with beautiful latte art. I got a soy latte and my boyfriend got an iced New Orleans coffee.The coffee that blue bottle uses is perfectly smooth, creamy, with a slight nutty tasty that creates a coffee explosion in your mouth. BBC definitely put a smile on my face. :D
author: Stacey L.

description:
After hearing about Blue Bottle for such a long time, i had to try it when we were at the Ferry Building.

The line wasn't bad at all, and the guy who waited on me was really pleasant.

I'm strictly a black coffee drinker, so choosing their house drip was a no brainer, (they also have latte, cappuccinos, and such.)

It does take longer than your average cup of coffee, but that's because each cup is individually brewed at the moment you order it. (No scorched old coffee here!)

I'm not a coffee connoisseur by any means, but this was a good cup of coffee and very reasonably priced.  It seemed to have more caffeine than what I drink at home, since i had a bit of a rush after drinking it, (which doesn't normally happen.)

A game changer for me? No, but for a true coffee snob, maybe:)
author: Amanda G.

description: Worst part of this spot is the wait; there are many patrons eagerly awaiting this amazing coffee every time I'm here. Big tip of the hat to how fast the baristas turn people through with their orders. Always worth the wait.
author: Mike S.

description: I've heard about this place way before I even moved to the city. Its known for it's great coffee. Dare to compare it to Starbucks (the locals will not take it lightly). Well, my colleague brewed a pitcher in the office one morning. I was expecting the OK tasting Peers Coffee we usually have but this one made my morning. It was absolutely delicious!!! Flavorful and bold. I hunted down the person who made this delicious elixir. To my surprise she told me it was Blue Bottle coffee. I immediately fell in love. I have to say, it's really really really good. I visited their location on the Embarcadero and of course there was a line out the building (I wonder why?). I ordered a latte and it was amazing. The workers were very friendly and very fast. This is without a doubt my new favorite coffee joint (sorry Starbucks. We are done). It does cost a bit above the competition but well worth it.
author: Jermaine J.

description:
When I am at the Ferry Building, the first stop is always Blue Bottle. There are two lines. If you are in a rush, choose the left line (I've timed it and it's always faster). The right line takes more time, but you can enjoy reading about the various coffee making instruments on the shelves. 

My favorite is the gibraltar (named after the glass). Thanks to helpful tips on 4square, I've learned this is a secret menu item. A gibraltar tastes like a hybrid of a macchiato and a cappuccino. Since it is served in a glass, I am reminded to sip slowly.

The belgium waffle is delightful; lightly sweetened and crunchy. My ideal Saturday morning is sitting on the bench, enjoying the view of the Bay Bridge, drinking aromatic coffee, and sharing the tasty waffle in good company.
author: Sophie C.

description: I got the Americana, it's from some good coffee bean :D. My friend got the New Orleans ice coffee and tastes pretty good, tho for that type, it doesn't have decaf version. So, grab a coffee, and sit in the sun outside, always a nice choice for a casual afternoon.
author: Julia Z.

description:
I don't drink coffee often but when I do I prefer Blue Bottle. It is brewed just right, so the taste is impeccable. I am in love with their mochas and the coffee art is just a cherry on top.
Last time my boyfriend ordered an affogato. If I wasn't getting out of the cold I would eat his whole cup. It's perfect if you have a sweet-tooth like me
author: Renata G.

description:
The great SF debate: Blue Bottle or Philz? 

My homegirl swears that SF is up in arms on who is best... and as I prefaced the Philz review, I'm diehard Dunkin Donuts.

However, at last I tried Blue Bottle.  Did a basic soy latte, and I would have to say, Blue Bottle is my SF fav.

Philz and Blue Bottle will say that I'm comparing apples to oranges, because Philz is one cup coffee thing and Blue Bottle is espresso.. and all other ways to differentiate it.. But for me.. it's all fruit to me.

I preferred Blue Bottle, because it seemed like the coffee was not as bitter.  With the well manicured foam, you have to give it up for just being pretty.

The staff was down to earth, and pretty real.  They were serious, but they were not as like HARD CORE as Philz.  They are hardcore.  Which in turn made my Blue Bottle experience more approachable and not as intimidating.
author: Natalie G.

description: Nice to grab a cup of latte and take a walk around ferry building in a sunny afternoon.
author: Katherine W.

description:
The coffee was ok.  The 'big deal' is that they try to personalize every order.  

Then have the nerve for ask for a $1, $2, or $3 tip on a $3 drink...takes balls to do that - I'm not impressed.
author: Miki K.

description: Long line at 1:30 PM on a Friday afternoon, but well worth the wait. A delicious Cappuccino that got me through the rest of the day happily.
author: Delilah B.

description: was told great things of this place. coffee is ok tastes smoother then starbucks. got an iced latte. $4.50 had nopastry or cookies or anything. decent place but i dont think ill come back. but my drink came out pretty fast tho
author: Maryse JR G.

description:
OVERRATED.  

I actually prefer Starbucks coffee instead of this place. I couldn't believe there was a long line for bland coffee and mocha. Their presentation in the drinks are nice. The servers will decorate the drinks with heart shaped foam on top. But I'm all about the taste instead of presentation. And their coffee isn't anything special in my opinion. 

I would never stay on line for this again. Just a complete waste of my time. Starbucks is just across the street and I'd rather get their commercialized coffee instead of this so called gem. 

If you really want good mocha in SF, I suggest going to Momi Toby's Revolution Cafe instead.
author: Al S.

description:
On Thursday, I made my second visit to Blue Bottle Coffee and I have to say that I was, once again, impressed.  Being a farmer's market day, around 11:00 a.m., there was already a line of about 10 people; but I didn't mind because the line moved fairly quickly.  The location is fairly small, unlike their Mint St. location; there isn't any seating and it's more of a to-go place.  (They also sell some goodies/gear, including tote bags, coffee makers, etc).

The menu is pretty standard as a coffee shop, but what I really love about Blue Bottle is their New Orleans style Iced Coffee ($3.75).  It is really flavorful and very refreshing.  Plus, I like that this drink is made for you instantly, you don't have to wait, as with the drip coffee or latte (but even if you do have to wait for your drink, they never take more than a few minutes to make it, which is great.  They even add beautiful coffee art to the top of the drink.)  The New Orleans style Iced Coffee is about half coffee and half milk.  It's pretty easy to drink, even for a non-coffee drinker, in my opinion.  

This location also has a variety of baked goodies.  There is a case below the cash register counter, so you can't really see the options until you get to the register, but they have a lot of variety, and everything is fairly priced, at about the $2 range.  They have cookies, muffins, coffee cake, everything you would expect.  Another thing that I love about Blue Bottle is their waffle.  Made fresh when ordered, these waffles are flavorful, warm, and have a little bit of crisp to them.  There is some sort of caramelized/sugary glaze on top which makes the waffle a little bit sweet, and it goes great with coffee.  They serve it in an easy-to-hold, coffee filter, so you can eat it on the go.  All of my friends loved the waffle.

Overall, I would suggest that every one try Blue Bottle if they get a chance.  I've always been impressed by the quality of the product, and the service.  They are quick, helpful, and take pride in the product that they serve.

Notes:
-They don't have tables/seating (but you'll probably want to walk around the ferry building anyway)
-Try the waffle!
author: Samantha L.

description: Went here for the first time a few weeks ago. I think my mocha latte was a little bitter. No worries though, they sweetened it for me and it tasted great. Love this place. A++
author: Ameera D.

description: Some of the best coffee around. They have quick and friendly service, and it's very affordable. Did I mention how great the coffee was!!! Do yourself a favor and try this while in town, it will make your day!
author: Hailie C.

description:
Yes, I am a caffeine junkie and I LOVE coffee.  Hot, cold, with or without milk, I love the taste and smell of coffee.  I'd gladly drive to the ends of the earth for a flavorful cup of joe.  Or in this case, wait in an insanely long line for legendary coffee.  

Now that I've had Blue Bottle New Orleans Iced coffee... it is strong, and flavorful.  But for the long lines I don't know if it is THAT amazing.   I'll probably have to try Blue Bottle at least once or twice again before deciding whether it is as good as all the hype.
author: Kelly K.

description: The line can be LONG, but it is worth the wait! We came around 10:00am on a Sunday, and the line was already 8 people deep, not to mention the small crowd that had already ordered and were just waiting for their drinks. It took less than 5 minutes to place our order, but close to 10 minutes to get both coffees (a drip and a cappuccino). Their coffee is really smooth and drinkable, and you can't really go wrong with anything you order from here (the New Orlean Style Iced Coffee is one of my faves). A must try if you're a tourist, or a native Californian who has never had Blue Bottle before.
author: Amy D.

description: When ever I come to San Francisco I make Sure to make the time for a great Maciahto and cappuccino. This is the spot. Inside the ferry building. A great to watch the sunrise from.
author: Dawit Z.

description:
4 stars for the delicious, individually-made cups of coffee and -1 star for the nutso wait.

If you're a fan of coffee that hasn't been sitting out, that's fresh from the beans to your mouth - then you really should pony up the funds for a cup of Blue Bottle coffee. 

The flavors were intense (and bitter as it cooled) but an experience worth having if you enjoy the java.
author: Mark F.

description: Mmm. I still can't stop thinking about the Mocha. I usually don't get Mochas because they are overwhelmingly chocolatey, but the Mocha at Blue Bottle Coffee was just perfectly made. It had the perfect amount of chocolate and coffee, making it not overwhelmingly sweet but not too bitter either. I can't wait to go back for more!
author: Kate B.

description:
I love blue bottle's iced coffee sweet without milk. No problem right?  Apparently not if you order from the girl with blonde curly hair...ordered iced coffee and asked for no room. She says it comes with milk. Ok but I don't want milk. She keeps asking if I'm sure. Yes give me my damn coffee. She gives me my coffee WITH  room. I need caffeine and I'm paying you!!! I don't care if you wouldn't drink it the way I do...

Yes, good coffee is worth the $$ but nothing's worth pretentiousness
author: Ann C.

description:
First, I love the name.  
Second, the coffee is great.  
Third, cool latte art.
author: Josh G.

description:
Everyone raves about this coffee for a reason, and it was one of my first stops in San Francisco once I arrived.  Their New Orleans Iced Coffee makes me love life.  I went 1-2x every day while I was in the city and never regretted it.

This place is in the ferry building, so naturally it has insane lines almost all the time.  If it gets really busy, try the express window that is on the side of the main shop, it's usually faster.
author: Frank W.

description:
There is nothing more that can be said about Blue Bottle except for a reiteration of what so many others have pointed out. Blue Bottle is among the top five on my list of coffee shops. While I've seen competitors expand and drop in quality, Blue Bottle has been consistently delicious year after year. Great coffee made by great people. You can't go wrong.

This location has a few more tourists than the others do it gets crowded at strange times. Hey, try a waffle.
author: Nathan E.

description:
I walked from the Alcatraz boat line all the way here to just get a coffee, it's that good. 

I recommend the New Orleans or any espresso drink :) 
Cappuccinos are also a favorite of mine. It's all about that foam ;)
author: Sharon C.

description: This location is currently under construction and has a LIMITED menu. So don't make the mistake I made, and come here expecting an affogato because there won't be one (yet)!!!
author: Alice H.

description: I love the coffee unfortunately they don't have my Kyoto here. They do however have the New Orleans and that is my second goto. Often crowded but they move pretty fast. Friendly service and a great spot to have a caffeine stop while shipping amongst the various Ferry Building retail
author: Kim N.

description: Ahhh their coffee is so flavorful and prob one of the best I've gotten in a long while. Get the iced Louisiana Coffee! Especially on a sunny day :) Lines can be a bit long.
author: Janet H.

description: Saw a huge line and noticed this place was one of the recommended place for me to try. Got the iced coffee. Like everyone said it is pretty tasty and not too sweet but I think it is a bit overpriced. The size of the cup and the amount of ice made this coffee extremely expensive in my books. Not to mention that the lines were pretty long. I could've just stepped outside where there were no lines and got the same thing. I also found that SFO in terminal 2 served their coffee so I kind of waited for nothing.
author: Jacob H.

description: What can I say, I love blue bottle.  It's always worth the wait.  :)  they do hand press their espresso, so there can sometimes be minor variations with each order.  I do like them all the same
author: Aaron E.

description:
I was never a big coffee drinking till I tried their New Orleans Iced coffee. I am addicted. This is one of the only places I have found that does chicory coffee well and I cannot stop thinking about the sweetness and slight spice of this iced coffee. 

The waffles make me drool like Pavlov's dog in a bell store. Just the perfect amount of sugar and toasted to perfection. 

I also have to say that the staff at Blue Bottle always brings a smile to my face. Always pleasant and fantastic.
author: Andrew K.

description:
No sugar needed in any of their espresso based drinks. The non-fat lattes and cappuccinos are so smooth and creamy...seriously blows other latte drinks out of the water and makes them taste like water even thought you ask for it with whole milk. Seriously. 

I would stop by here every morning if I could! Hopefully they open a location in the heart of Union Square...I like people who are used to Starbucks/Peet's would appreciate Blue Bottle way more...
author: Karina C.

description:
The line is ridiculous but I guess that comes in tourist territory yeah?
Wait a decade and then have fun people watching. Honestly, Blue Bottle is always quality but this location is about the view.
author: Susy C.

description: My SF friend said if there is one thing I need to do before leaving the city - it's try a Blue Bottle Coffee.  Got there and the line was obnoxiously long... and even the more "unknown" line on the side was long as well.  But we waited and luckily, it moved fairly quickly.  So what's the verdict?  It's good coffee!  But hey, for those of you who don't like their coffee strong - this probably would not be the place.  As for me... I like my coffee strong so I am a fan!  Tried the drip coffee - each cup freshly brewed.  And my friend got the iced coffee.  I don't know what they put in the Iced Coffee but it was some good shiznats!  It almost tasted like a coffee candy.
author: Lora H.

description: Best capuccino ever!! I saw the line so I thought it would be good, but I wasn't expecting it to be so transcendent. I've never thought almond milk could be this creamy and smooth. Like angels singing!
author: Jeff S.

description:
I laugh at all those people who were in the main line ordering. Go to the side and you will be laughing at them too.

My latte was made perfect!
author: Kien M.

description:
This place is great, great coffee. 

Attitudes of the employees....not so good....smile folks!!!!!
author: Samantha S.

description: Blue bottle coffee is the best of Bay Area . We never miss it cappuccino whenever we at this building.  Alway a long line.
author: Syrena L.

description: As much as we wanted to love this coffee (and the great story that goes with it--read "Our Story" on their website), it just did not measure up to some better brews that we had in Seattle.  Sorry, San Francisco, but I think Seattle does coffee better.  The Ferry Market Building location is great and you can sip your coffee while looking at the Bay Bridge.
author: Friend of D.

description: The best Mocha I have ever had!  A little bit pricy but coffee is so good!
author: Victoria G.

description: It's my go-to coffee place whenever I'm in San Francisco - The USA for that matter. I'm an Aussie who struggles to find a good coffee in the US - Blue Bottle certainly delivers. It is worth the wait - usually you have to queue, and that says a lot about a place.
author: Tamara M.

description:
The New Orleans Iced is very special, it always makes me feel better when I drink it. Caffeine is a solid anti-depressant, and the New Orleans Iced is practically lithium. 

The TCHO mocha is a goddamn work of art. Chocolate has potent dopamine-raising abilities, but most businesses assume you're a garden-variety sugar addict and fill their mochas with nasty syrup. Here, the chocolate is bitter and has depth. A total delight.
author: Maria D.

description: Best. Coffee. Ever.  This stuff is amazing.  So smooth.  So fresh.  Skip Starbucks and go here.
author: Derek W.

description:
I've tried this place quite a few times, and I must say ..its really overhyped.

In my opinion, the drip coffee is just okay, and its a bit annoying that you can't choose what blend you want. I would stick to the espresso drinks.. but they're so expensive! and the wait is guaranteed to be long

I really do love that waffle though ....
author: Nivita T.

description:
You know when the 10th Doctor proclaims that he's "sorry, so sorry"?  Pretty much.

The coffee is good.  That this is high praise is such a sad statement about coffee.

I've had the coffee over many years, although not regularly.  I also know quite well the travails of the coffee market.  The roasters do a very good job delivering the mass-expected flavors.  But they're not alone in this, and the fact that everyone recognizes a few rather than the utter depravity of the coffee market makes me sad.  

Maybe my rating is skewed.  Blue Bottle remains a place (err, two places? three counting multiple stands?) to find a decent cup.  If any damned st... no, won't even go there.  sigh.  Those places will be rated higher because their clientele doesn't know a damned thing.
author: Jason R.

description: I don't even like coffee, but I loved theirs!!!
author: Jen B.

description: I'm a regular here for their Gibraltar but today I discovered their ridiculously oh-so-good Affogato. It was 80 degrees in SF and I thought I needed a cold treat. I hit the jackpot with this dessert made with brown butter Humphry Slocombe ice cream and BB's velvety espresso.
author: Reena C.

description: Amazing. Get this now.
author: Bobb S.

description:
Just before the holidays, I headed to the Mint Plaza location to procure some presents in the form of Blue Bottle coffee beans for friends and family.  

Turns out that Mint Plaza had no coffee beans whatsoever- looks like everyone had the same idea I had regarding Christmas presents.  So I rushed over to the Ferry Building just before closing, and was surprised to see a huge portion of the shop dedicated to bagged coffee beans, with plenty of varieties in stock.  Even though the line was ultra long, employees were really helpful in explaining the differences between the varieties.  I picked up everything I was looking for and Christmas was saved.

So yeah, if you're looking specifically for coffee beans, Blue Bottle at the Ferry Building is definitely the location to visit.  

And just so you don't look like a fool if you needed to ask:  no, they don't grind.
author: Joanne G.

description:
I saw a huge line up for Blue Bottle and wanted to see what all the fuss was about so I got in line when it was relatively short (15 ppl or so) and got a non-fat Mocha.They use TCHO chocolate and it isn't sweetend, so you get to add your own sugar to taste. 

It was definitely good... chocolately and went down smooth. No bitter aftertaste or "coffee breath" from overly sugarly/milky coffee.

Maybe because I'm not a coffee connoisseur I don't know how to truly appreciate Blue Bottle?  Just a warning to other non-coffee connoisseurs out there who are wondering what the fuss is about...in the end, you may or may not get it either, but it's definitely worth a try.
author: Camille B.

description: Heard a lot of good things about Blue Bottle Coffee, but expectations were shot due to rude service. Coffee is nothing special, had better coffee at other shops. Snooty attitudes will stop me from coming back here.
author: Melissa H.

description: The line is long on Labor Day's morning, but all the staff just take their time, hanging around.After 10 minutes waiting, I got a cup of warm Latte, not hot at all, tasted like it already sit there for ten minutes, please train your employees how to make a Latte.
author: I-Ling H.

description:
Maybe snobby coffee just isn't for me?!?  

I should have ordered a drip as that is what everyone raves about, but I am a cold-hearted girl and like my drip iced.

Here the only way to get the coffee iced was to order it "New Orleans" style.  Which apparently has sugar already mixed in and is then mixed with whole milk.  Well...I don't like my coffee with sugar OR whole milk...whomp whomp.

It was fine...just not the way I like it and it perturbs me that I didn't have the option to get it the way I like!
author: KB S.

description: I would take Philz over this place anyday.  The coffee is okay but not the best I have ever had.  I had the New Orleans ice and I asked for light ice and it was packed with ice!  The waffle was nothing special.
author: Lily F.

description:
This place was swamped when we got here one weekend. My wife wanted a coffee but decided to get the affogato instead, and she was delighted! The icecream was amazing and so was the coffee - we will probably be going here again the next time we visit SF :)

Not the place to sit and work though - this is in a mall kind of place.
author: Vivek R.

description:
Not a place I would go to everyday, rather, a place I would go to on a special occasion to treat myself. 
I usually get the mocha. It's not overly sweetened and sugary like most (starbucks) I've had, but at the same time it goes down sooo smoooth and creamy like. Very satisfying.
Like I said, as much as I'd want to go there everyday, it's in the incredibly crowded ferry building, the line is too long, and it's a tad expensive.
author: Marie O.

description: People always talk about their coffee, but did you know they make waffles? It so yummy, I wuv them!!
author: Ellen Z.

description: Affogato with Humphrey Slocombe was an explosion of flavors. Creamy espresso goodness. The line tends to be long at the Ferry Building location, try going between the morning and lunch rush. But it's certainly worth the wait.
author: Shannon C.

description:
I can always count on Blue Bottle to give me simple coffee perfection. You can taste the quality. 

On this rainy day I opted for a cappucinno, which was served with their signature "fern leaf" design etched into the foam. My friend had an affogato, which we shared because I kept eyeing it :) The affogato consisted of two scoops of Humphrey Slocombe's vanilla bean ice cream, served in a bowl, topped with warm espresso. It turned into a creamy coffee mess, but it was delicious!

They lose a star because they don't have as large a food selection as the Mint Street location. However, it's not that big a deal since Miette and California Coffee Cake Company are so closeby. Also, seating is limited (there is only room for three at the small side bar). Service is basic and never exceptionally friendly, but that doesn't bother me much.
author: Mariela D.

description: To accompany our Miette macarons we had Blue Bottle Coffee.  The coffee line was long, but it moves fast and the service was friendly.  I had a caffe latte and hubby had a cappuccino.  Their coffee was rich, smooth with no bitter aftertaste which we like. Next time I want to try their New Orleans style iced coffee and Belgian waffles.
author: Racquel E.

description:
Blue Bottle, how I love you so! I fell in love with their New Orleans style iced coffee a while ago (at the Blue Bottle location in Brooklyn) so naturally I had to have some Blue Bottle straight from the source. 

The espresso based drinks here are phenomenal. I loved the soy latte I got here, smooth, nutty and only slightly acidic so that I really needed no sugar at all. Yup, they offer soy milk, no coffee nazis here!
author: Cecilia Z.

description: Good coffee, but pretty slow. Ordered 15 min before the ferry was supposed to leave and had to run before a drink was done so we didn't miss it. Things were faster at their larger store.
author: Cole G.

description:
Mmm...I have had a lot of coffee over the years. I have even worked at different coffee establishments as side jobs while growing up. I heard nothing but good things abut the coffee at blue bottle and my first experience lived up to the expectation. I got the iced coffee, my favorite. 

When I first received the drink they had left room for me to add e cream. I really don't need much room so after I out I the cream and it wasn't the coffee wasn't filled to the top, the worker said she could top it for me without me even having to ask. If you are ever in the ferry building or near any of the other locations, you have to try the coffee and experience the superb customer service!
author: Tyler M.

description:
Blue Bottle is my favorite coffee ever since I tried it the first time a year ago. Their cappuccino is the best I've had. It goes down smoothy, has a great after taste feeling, and is always consistent every time I go. The new orleans iced coffee (NOIC) is also a must-have. I live about 30 minutes away from a blue bottle, so I usually get the NOIC carton package at Whole Foods when I don't have time to drive there. 

If you come on Saturdays, they are two other blue bottle stands outside the ferry building at the farmers market. It makes for a great grocery shopping experience.
author: Calvin L.

description:
I've only been here a few times, and I have only ordered the cafe au lait and the New Orleans iced coffee.  One thing's for sure about their coffee:  FRESH AND STRONG.  I like to think that coffee drinking is similar to wine drinking.  If you like big bold reds...you'll love your coffee the same way:  big and bold!

The line's a pain.  I've waited as long as 20 minutes for a cup of java!  No bueno!  Prices are on the higher side, too.

I've bought bags of whole beans for my home in LA, and they brew up just beautifully in my French press.
author: Sharon T.

description: This little coffee shop is quite the bustling hub of activity in the busy Ferry House market. They have two lines on either side of the shop and the lines for both stretched around the corner. The service was friendly and the coffee was delicious. In addition to standard options, they offer a drip-coffee that is made per cup on demand. It's a pretty impressive little setup.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Yes, you're gonna have to wait. Yes, it's worth it.

I got the affogato. Humphrey Slocombe vanilla ice cream covered with an espresso shot. This ended up tasting like a wonderful coffee ice cream. I stole a piece if my friend's waffle and dipped it in the affogato...that was a really delicious bite. Cold and creamy ice cream with a warm and crispy waffle...perfect.

The husband got a regular mocha. The gal 'drew' a cute swan with the milk. The drink itself was nice and smooth, with the right amount of richness and sweetness.
author: Gina J.

description:
I have to admit I was shocked, initially, at how long the line was!!  Walking into the already crowded Ferry Building Marketplace was an adventure but to see the long line was just a shock!  And my first thought was:  The coffee MUST be GOOD.

I decided to just go ahead and order the drip coffee, which is individually made and not brewed in a large pot ala Starbucks.  All I can say is that it was definitely worth the wait as it's some of the best coffee I've ever had! A definite winner in my opinion.

Bottom Line:  Don't be discouraged by the long lines, it will be worth the wait =)
author: Michael C.

description:
A HAIKU REVIEW

Amazing coffee
You wait in line and wait there.
Wait. Then. BOOM! Caffeine.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Came here due to the hype - mildly disappointed.

I got the drip coffee and a snickerdoodle.  The coffee was good and strong, but not otherworldly like Blue Bottle die-hards would claim.  The snickerdoodle was great in combination, not too sweet.

Just for background - Starbucks tastes burnt to me, and I would prefer Peet's over Blue Bottle.
author: Clark U.

description:
The service was wonderful and the coffee was amazing. 

Tip: There are like 3 blue bottle stands with a much shorter line at the Ferry Building. There are other establishments in SF that serves Blue Bottle in addition two at least two other Blue Bottle locations to get your coffee fix.
author: Sarah C.

description:
How many times have a I been in that Ferry building and bemoaned two things: that Blue Bottle always has an annoyingly long line and there is never anywhere to sit.

Finally, one day I pass it on my way to a double scoop of gelato to go with the 10,000 calorie cupcake.  Whaaat?  No line?  And I am pretty sure God is saying, ok, little Missy, just go ahead and make a day of it.  Get the bloody 1/2 & 1/2, too while you are at it.  And who am I to say no to The Almighty?

This coffee had many things going for it, including, but not limited to its coffee-loving and enhancing companions that day, namely my scoops of gelato and my cupcake.  Never underestimate the power of food and beverage pairing, people.  It was fantastic, let me tell you.

Oh, and on that day, I actually got a seat as well!  That's what happens when you say yes to God.
author: Adrienne A.

description: Was recommended to this place by a local while vacationing. The line was huge but my wife insisted we wait. The line moved surprisingly fast. I had a decaf drip cafe au lait. It was the best I've ever had. This place does an interesting made to order drip cup of coffee. You can tell that the coffee was of high quality. My wife had a vanilla latte and she loved it. I will definitely be back on my next trip. I'm afraid I'm going to crave this place and no way to get my fix:) Don't be afraid of the long lines. If you have time to spare it's well worth the wait. Tip...for whatever reason the left line moves quicker than the right side. Not sure why but a local in line pointed it out to us and she proved to be right.
author: Brian B.

description: I was skeptical that a cup of coffee could be that good but since it was a short walk from my hotel I decided to give it a go. All I can say is I am glad I did. This was the best coffee I have ever had. The lines were long but seemed to move along. I did use the "secret" side window but I don't think it was really any quicker.
author: Tom C.

description: While in SF I make sure to get a latte, or two, or three. Long lines means they must be doing something right..right? I'm still confused as to why there are two lines but I  go on the side line closest to the door and I got my order within 5 minutes. Perfect,hot, and amazing as always.
author: Mary M.

description: Lets all start chanting "overrated" the way hockey fans and WWE would cause this place was clearly that. I was looking forward to this place as being my Ferry Building gem but this place was trash when I got to it. Milk, sugar, paper napkins all over the counter and the floor. They served my iced coffee in a Styrofoam cup...wtf? They had no waffles, not a lot of options, I went with the New Orleans style coffee and umm yeah nothing special.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: I was so excited to finally get to try the blue bottle coffee...  The line was super long on a Saturday morning, but oh well, good things are worth waiting for, right?!  I finally made my way to the register and the girl that's taking my order starts a conversation with a person next in line completely omitting small talk with me. A little rude, but tolerable. My name gets misspelled and I get a shout out of a variation of something bizarre slightly resembling the phonetics of what it should be. Oh, well, Starbucks does that too.  No big deal, just little annoyance factors. It is a pre-coffee Saturday morning after all.  Then my latte arrives with foam art. Oh, what a sight!  Half the cup is foam, the rest is lukewarm latte that I just paid $5 for (12oz?) and waited for about 25 minutes.  The taste was good, but it didn't really matter at that point.
author: Mela D.

description:
Friends from SF brought us some beans when they visited, and they rocked our world.  So when in SF, I had to visit the mother ship.  I got some beans, and my friend got the iced cafe au lait that makes her heart leap.

This location doesn't have a Clover, but on my next visit I'll have to hit up the one that does.  But pour-over method Blue Bottle is still a great thing.
author: Cherie C.

description: Best coffee in San Francisco and being a Kiwi we know and love good coffee!
author: Lisa W.

description: Really good coffee and great presentation. However I was expecting a better brew based on all the hype.
author: Jason G.

description: Best. Coffee. Ever! We came here after getting a tip from a friend and I'm so glad we did. The line was long, and I hoped that meant it was worth the wait. I was not disappointed! The latte I got was incredible. I'm not sure what made the difference but it was the best latte I've ever had. My only complaint is that there isn't a store in Ventura county!
author: Jessica D.

description: The New Orleans iced coffee is so tasty! It is so strong too... It's expensive. Long lines. All worth it.
author: Michelle T.

description: Buzzing with happy, alert baristas and excited patrons awaiting their delicious coffee. The ginger molasses cookie is a great treat.  I like Philz better though to be honest.
author: Monica S.

description:
Pros: Taste
Cons: Wait

This is the Gary Danko of coffee in my opinion. Definitely worth the 30 minute wait endured on this busy weekday lunch hour. After drinking Blue Bottle Coffee, everything else will taste like gasoline in comparison.
author: Caryn H.

description:
I tried the New Orleans Iced Coffee and it was not bad. The coffee was nice and strong, however having been to Philz multiple times before coming here, it just made this coffee not up to par with Philz. I still did enjoy the coffee though.

One side thing I did not like, even though it does not affect my review, is the cups they use to hold the coffee. For my iced coffee, I felt the condensation coming out and it seemed as if my cup was starting to "dissolve" since the cups are compostable.
author: Spencer E.

description:
Tried their drip coffee and my friends latte and it was just okay.
Don't know what the hype is about. The drip coffee was luke warm by the time I put a bit of cream in it which I can't stand.
author: Rita K.

description:
Can there be enough BBCs?  Apparently not.  And although I don't want this establishment to become a franchise, I do appreciate coming to this location especially for the ferry building, which is a perfect spot for a artisan coffee roastery like BBC.  In my opinion, its got the best best drip coffee in the town...(maybe not the best espresso though)

But even at this location, what better way to enjoy a single drip cup of joe while strolling along the pier or looking out into your bay's truly.
author: Vincent K.

description: Try their waffles! You won't regret it. Pair it with a NOLA iced coffee and you are good to go; breakfast of champions for sure. Remember, the line in the front is for coffee AND food purchases. If you go to the *secret* side window, you can wait in a shorter line for coffee only. A lot of tourists pass by holding their Starbucks or Pete's and don't really know what the fuss is about. The hype is real, and I'm not even a coffee enthusiast but this place makes me want to be one.
author: Diana S.

description:
Monday afternoon at 4pm and there's still a 15 minute wait at Blue Bottle?? Really!?!? It's a testament to how much I love their macchiato that I took my place in the back of that line.

To make the wait even more worth it, I ordered a gibraltar in addition to my usual macchiato (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vJaF4HdnmSVF_V0BjeKjtg?select=_vSsvU3_A5219mP-go8t0w). Both were great but I prefer the intensity of the latter. (The gibraltar was a little too creamy for me--the barista described it as a cross between a cappuccino and a macchiato.)

I just wish I didn't have to bring my own Splenda packets. I get that real sugar tastes better and is better for you, but what about for the diabetics out there?
author: Steph L.

description: One of my favorite spots! I love all of the coffee drinks they have to offer. Also, check out the side line! It's just as fast as their main line, but it's like a secret spot that most people done know about! It's great and = faster service!
author: Ashley N.

description: I just love their coffees, cold or hot. I'm just taking off one star because the lines are sometimes ridiculously long, and baristas can be "stressed". Definitely try latte.
author: Togan G.

description: Blue bottle coffee is not the best coffee ive had hit still decent. I got the mocha which wasn't anything special. I had the liege waffle though, and it was so amazing. It was surprisingly one of the best waffles I've ever had, I would go back just for that. The location is a bit hectic though if you go around a busy time. I'd give it a 3.5 if 0.5 starts were available
author: Dana L.

description:
Great espresso makes me happy and Blue Bottle Coffee never fails to please. 

I've been lucky to find them while visiting New York and now San Francisco. Come to my hometown of San Diego and I'll love you even more!
author: Charlotte C.

description:
Who doesn't love BB? All three of us first timers who were expecting greatness.

We were SOOOOOOO let down I had to say something. I will certainly append the review and post a follow up if I can muster up the courage to go out of my way, plop down my money and hope for the best.

I've read about the place many times, perhaps my expectations were too high. Perhaps there was a conspiracy to try to pass off some half hearted drinks to us, thinking we were tourists or something, that must be it right? There's gotta be an explanation, all these BB lovers can't be wrong.

Glands watering, tastebuds revved up with anticipation, I stepped up to the plate and asked the guy "what drinks are a must have for a first timer?" He said without hesitation, "if you like mochas, you definitely should have one, or a latte" say no more, that's what I want then. So we ordered accordingly.....

Mocha 

Me: took a sip..."hmmmm....umm try this"
Her: "Is this supposed to be a mocha?"
Me: "umm it should be, that's what I ordered"
Her: "is there actually coffee in it?"
Me: "yeah, well, it has espresso in it"
Her: "uhh well if there is it sure doesn't taste like it, can't really taste any chocolate and only a hint of coffee, this sucks"

Latte

Me: took a sip..."hmmmm...."
Her: "Is this their latte?"
Me: "yeah"
Her: "ok if you say so, I don't see what the big deal is, in fact these are just not good at all, what a let down"

Bottom line is there is 1000% more coffee flavor in Starbucks coffee ice cream than we could taste in OUR drinks. I was having severe buyers remorse and should have followed my instincts and ordered a drip coffee, which is what I'm going to order next time. A cup of redemption is in order, I hate to give poor reviews but I couldn't hold it in any longer.

I want to like BB, it'll have to wait until next time.
author: William S.

description:
I've heard a lot about this coffee, so when we had some down time to kill and the ferry building was just a few minutes away, we had to make a stop here. I'm trying to be strong and refrain from caffeine, so I tried a couple sips of my friend's drip coffee. It was everything I imagined it to be -- bold and pure. I'm not a coffee connoisseur (in fact, I used to hate coffee a few years ago), but you could taste the quality!

The line was pretty long and it doesn't move particularly fast, but there's another window on the other side of the main opening that had a shorter line (we later realized). It's definitely worth a try if you want some good coffee, and you'll likely walk a way a fan!

NOTE: There's also a small little counter area you can sit at and drink your coffee out of a real cup (and not one of those to-go cups). Not really my style, since it's literally off the hall of the main ferry building walkway, but a nice option nonetheless.
author: Leana L.

description:
I was skeptical when I was told this was the best coffee around.   There are a million coffee places and I wasn't expecting it to be any better than any other coffee place out there.  But I was pleasantly surprised.  I had a latte and it was the smoothest, least acidic coffee I have ever tried.  The foam also seemed to be made up of these little tiny bubbles that tasted perfect.   I enjoyed it more than any other coffee I have had in awhile.  

I also indulged in one of their waffles . . .  it was a busy Sunday morning and it did take awhile for it to be made but it was soooo yummy!!!
author: Cyndee H.

description: Best Coffee... Well tied with Philz but yeah this is the best coffee. Nothing else needed to say!
author: Rahul M.

description:
First time experience.

Blue Bottle Coffee is one of those "San Francisco things" you should make an effort to try on your trip. There's many places around San Francisco to try Blue Bottle Coffee and no matter where you go, you will have to wait no matter what time of the day it is.
You may be lucky enough not to wait long, but either way it's worth it.

This one located inside of the Ferry Building is the one to go to since it has many places to pick up a great food or dessert companion with your coffee.

This location has great and friendly staff that works hard to get the line moving. 

Be sure to enjoy your coffee while sitting in the back of the Ferry Building.
Great scenery and peaceful despite there being a lot of people.

If you can't make it to the Ferry Building, be sure to find another Blue Bottle Coffee location in San Francisco.
author: John S.

description:
It could have been an interesting experience but the service was so horrific that even if they were serving the best coffee in the world I would not return to this place.

When an establishment has people waiting in line for 20+ minutes, the least they can do is show some appreciation for your wait.  The history of coffee is meant to be a community experience of caring for and sharing the beauty of the bean, and they have unfortunately turned it into a hipster consumeristic idea with no care for the product.

I first asked the cashier about the 'new orleans coffee' that everyone raves about, and he couldn't tell me anything about it except that people tend to like it.  I ordered a cappuccino, then my barista slapped down my cappuccino that had the thinnest layer of foam i've every seen.  There was no consideration to the traditional way of cappuccino of a clean foam top with a beautiful shot of espresso under.  This was a mess.  

From someone who really appreciates a beautiful coffee experience, this had me truly disappointed.  I would not recommend anyone waiting a minute for this overrated establishment.  Go to a local coffee shop that actually cares and you are supporting something that is meaningful.
author: Jonathan B.

description: The coffee here is unique and has a different taste than the normal coffee you get at starbucks. I got the new orleans style iced coffee and i thought it was very flavorful.  It has a light savory coffee taste to it that i haven't tasted at any other coffee shop. This  place gets pretty busy with all the ferry building visitors but that shouldn't be the reason you pass this place up!
author: Samee M.

description: The New Orleans iced coffee deserves all the hype and this place has amazing coffee which I wish would make an appearance in SD and LA.  The line can be a bit intimidating but the coffee is worth it.
author: Eric H.

description:
Long line.

Sort of awkward to wait around in the way of other Ferry Building shoppers.

But really delish. iPad payment + receipt. Pretty prompt given the crowd. Recommend the mocha.
author: David S.

description:
My BF and I were visiting SF and a friend said, if we like coffee (which I have a small addiction....), then we have to try Blue Bottle at the Ferry Building.  We went on a Saturday morning when the Farmer's Market was going on, so it was crowded.  
We waited in line for about 45 minutes (gosh, I was hoping that it was worth the wait!).  IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT!  I had a single-drip coffee and my BF had the New Orleans iced coffee.  Smooth, full of flavor without being overpowering.  Absolutely delicious.  (and I have had single-drip in Costa Rica with freshly roasted and ground beans....this was near as good).  
Worth the wait.  Glad we did it.
author: Becky M.

description:
For a coffee snob this is a real treat.

For everyone else, I've lost track of the number of friends who told me they don't like coffee and somehow when I brought them to Blue Bottle they changed their mind.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
Gah Dayum (is that a word?!) Blue Bottle makes a suped-up caffeinated drink! One minuscule shot of their espresso (no to-go cups, to be consumed right there) had me cray-cray all day & lasted til midnight when my heart was doing summersaults in my chest.

Their regular drip coffee is horrendous to me & doesn't hold a candle to my other favorite local chain that goes by one very special man's name (you know who you are.) 

My go-to is their New Orleans Iced Coffee, but for something quick & lo-cal, their espresso gets my nod of approval.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Awesome coffee especially New Orleans iced coffee!! Even the drip coffee is great. Must have is their street waffle!! Fresh made when ordered.
author: Annie K.

description: So I tried the New Orleans and the hubby had an espresso. Pretty strong and bitter coffee. Good stuff but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Bao T.

description:
I am in love. Yes the coffee is fabulous...made to order, organic milk, local ingredients, blah, blah, blah - but what should make this place stellar is their Caramelized "Belgian-style" waffle. 

They are too humble with their unnecessary and excessive use of quotation marks. When, indeed this is the most authentic of Liege Belgian Waffle you'll ever find outside of the city of Liege - down to those amazing sphere of sugar crystals running throughout the batter. 

Jaw-dropping amazing. This waffle is so tasty, so buttery that it could probably provide world peace and lead to the discovery of cancer. I mean, standing in line for blue bottle coffee co. is already a daunting task - I appreciate the one on one attention, and the attempt to minimize the Starbucks consumerism that has infuriated the art of making coffee. However, waiting over twenty minutes to get near the front of the line is ridiculous. ESPECIALLY when you're in the Ferry Building amongst tourists and locals between Christmas and NYE. One unintended shove could put an individual short of mandated caffeine (such as myself) into a panic attack...but the smell, the allure, and the look of this waffle alleviated all that stress and made the world (and my overall blue bottle coffee co) experience so much better. If not 20 fold. 

Get the waffle.
author: Kimberly H.

description: The lines get crazy long now that the weather is nice for the summer and even the side window line is getting to be too long for a short work break but that doesn't mean I'll stop trying. They make the best mocha and non-vietnamese iced coffee I can get anywhere downtown. Since their service is intentionally slow to create the designs in the foam I can't say this is my goto spot for a cup of joe but if I'm in the mood for something fancy that won't upset my stomach later this is a good choice.
author: Norris T.

description:
I went on a Thursday afternoon, so the line wasn't as long as it is on the weekends. 

I got the New Orleans Iced Coffee. I'm not sure if it's made with the drip coffee or espresso but it's mixed with whole milk and ice. The result is something with a strong but not bitter, yet creamy flavor. I highly recommend it!
author: Christine H.

description: The whole experience took 20-30 minutes but it ended up being worth it. One of the better Americano's I have had in quite some time. The place lived up to the hype and the workers there were all really friendly and helpful.
author: Zach K.

description:
By far and away one of favorite cups of coffee. 

If you like iced coffee...the New Orleans style coffee is the way to go.  It's cold brewed, only down side is that they serve it in a paper cup.  Fully compostable cup though, so way to go there!  But they also have hot beverages too.  I usually opt for a latte.  They have cappuccino and mocha as well.  Even a delicious looking affigato!  

They have pastries on offer too, but I usually opt for other items in the Ferry Building.  

Bring you're own no sugar sweetener for those of you who don't want sugar or simple syrup.  The line is sometimes really long, but it's worth it.
author: Caesar R.

description: Definately not worth the wait.  Took over 15 minutes to get this "special" pour over coffee.  Definately not the best.  There's plenty of places in the Ferry Building to get coffee.  Don't wait in line for Blue Bottle.
author: Lynette J.

description: If you know me, you know that if there's a Blue Bottle around, I'm getting coffee. I was introduced to Blue Bottle by my old roommate who is now the Green Coffee Coordinator for Blue Bottle. Aside from their swoon-worthy cups of New Orleans iced coffee (a sugary, creamy, cup of heaven), the company as a whole is very knowledgable about coffee. After seeing Snapchat story after Snapchat story of bean inspection, coffee tasting, and Dexter's Laboratory looking equipment, I am convinced that they know what they're doing. Of course, this is a bit of an insider's view, but even if you don't see what goes on behind the scenes, the taste of every cup will convince you to keep coming back. New Blue Bottle locations seem to be popping up all around the Bay Area so anywhere you are, you're bound to be close to one. The only setback about Blue Bottle is the price. It is an expensive cup of coffee, but you pay for quality (and hipster aesthetics.)
author: Nani S.

description: Blue Bottle is tucked away between the busy streets of Powell shopping center and some apartment complex near the alley way.  There's nothing wow to write home, I don't see what all the hype is about.  I had their iced coffee couple times, I'd say it's decent, but not for the price, it could taste a bit better.
author: Katie N.

description:
The coffee would actually be 3 stars by itself, it was good but not amazing. I probably had hyped it up a bit more than others because I love coffee and heard this place was the best.

The extra star was for the amazing waffle. Three guys shared one for a breakfast snack and we all wanted another. Probably the best waffle I've ever had.

There is most definitely a line here, but it should be expected because the place is so well known
author: Greg D.

description: It's alright. Nothing too special to be quite honest. I got the New Orleans iced coffee and a waffle but they were both just average. The waffle was not a Belgian liege (even though It took that much time) and the coffee came from a dispenser. Meh. I'll probably try something else a second time if I'm in the ferry building again. Props for location!
author: Diana L.

description:
Been to Blue Bottle many times.  Decided not to get the New Orleans styled iced coffee and order the affogato.  I believe the ice cream is from Humphry's.  DELICIOUS.  Perfect for the stuffy temperature inside the Ferry building.  

I've copied and pasted a description of affogato below from google:
"An affogato (Italian, "drowned") is a coffee-based beverage or dessert. It usually takes the form of a scoop of vanilla gelato or ice cream topped with a shot of hot espresso. Some variations also include a shot of Amaretto or other liqueur."
author: Steven U.

description: I can't say enough about Blue Bottle. You would be crazy to even consider one of the other coffee places in the Ferry Building, this place is simply the best! The lines can get long after a ferry arrives, but it's usually pretty quick. Get the New Orleans Iced Coffee!!!
author: Brian S.

description: A big fan of Gibraltar coffee here. Although the line is always long but its worth the wait.
author: Kunal K.

description:
Consistently the best espresso in the area. 

I am not fan of the modern sharp, tongue twisting espressos, but I also hate the bitter and ashy "old school" espressos typical for sbux and other over roasted coffee vendors.

It seems Blue Bottle found the sweet spot. While their espresso is still full of sparks it is also very sweet with long, clean aftertaste.

I love also that you can ask for the Bay Area "off the menu" coffee drink - Gibraltar. It means they follow barista "stuff". :)

Only thing I dislike on this place is the line.
author: Valerian H.

description:
once upon a time, a girl named charmaine stumbled upon a blue bottle while strolling in the ferry plaza. this curious girl had never seen a bottle so blue, or smelled an aroma so fragrant. the towns people had advised this girl about "the gibraltar" that lived inside the blue bottle and all of its magical powers. the girl took their advice, and dared to empty this blue bottle of its magical elixir.

"the gibraltar" appeared shortly thereafter, with flames of milk from its breath which resembled beautiful palm leaves. and yet another one appeared with a tail so delicate, it projected a series of wafting small hearts. one kiss was all it took and the girl was forever in love.
author: Charmaine L.

description: What happened to their coffee? It's been a few years and the cup of coffee I had tonight was so bad that I threw it out even at $4 for the cup. I love good coffee and in the early days of BB it was excellent.  What I had was bitter with a taste of burned coffee bean. I am a New Orleans native and I know good coffee, this is no longer it. So glad there was no line because that would add insult to injury! Never again sad to say. Very disappointed.
author: Catherine D.

description: Regular drip was not bad. Just don't get the cold brew. People working there weren't very nice. The regular drip, though expensive, was pretty good.
author: Geffen T.

description:
If luck hadn't been on my side, I would have bypassed Blue Bottle and gotten my latte elsewhere because the line for coffee was ridiculous. Fortunately I happened to walk by the "secret window" just as it opened at 9:00a. So rather than be 20 deep at the main counter, I was customer number two and received my beautifully made latte within minutes.

Folks from the Northwest can be coffee snobs, so I've got to say that while this is very good coffee, it doesn't qualify as the best thing ever. There have to be some perks to living in a rainy climate nine months out of the year. Coffee, strippers, beer.
author: Jen K.

description:
Now THIS is how you do coffee. I'm a self-proclaimed coffee snob, and I also have years of experience working in coffeeshops and also owning one, and I'm saying now that Blue Bottle is the best damn coffee I've ever had. That's right, I said it. 

Sure, the wait can belong and they have their little snobby rules, just like every other coffeeshop in the Bay Area that thinks it's shit don't stink (there are lots of these)...for example, double-shots only, no breves, one size, etc. But the difference with Blue Bottle is that they can back it up...once you taste the coffee, you don't care what you had to go through to get it. If they had a rule where in order to get a macchiato you had to sing "I'm a Little Teapot" while simultaneously patting your head and rubbing your stomach, followed by 20 pushups, I'd do it. Not only would I work on my coordination and fitness, my tastebuds would be in heaven as I melted into that macchiato...and I'd be back the next day for more!
author: Joe S.

description:
Perfect espresso shots (with great coffee art!). There's a huge line, especially inside the ferry building, but it's worth the wait for the first time.

After experiencing the whole thing, I just buy the coffee beans and make it myself! So good.
author: Robert H.

description:
Why I need a coffee AFTER work is beyond me, but I keep finding myself here after a long workday. 

The staff is always friendly and still smiling in the evening. I love the New Orleans iced coffee on a warm day, but generally opt for a basic pour-over.

A bit pricey and there's ALWAYS a line, but absolutely worth it.
author: Adena B.

description: Can't go wrong here.. Had some great coffee on a Sunday morning at the Ferry Market Building in SF.  Very rich and full-bodied.  My cappucino was done just the way I like it, with the proper milk and foam to coffee ratio.  Nice and hot but not way too hot that I couldn't enjoy it.  I will it be back for sure!
author: Robert K.

description:
Does Blue Bottle really need yet another shining review about it's coffee greatness? I do believe it does. 

Blue Bottle, I have found, is the most reliably fantastic cup of coffee in the city. Whether I feel like a drip coffee or a good Gibraltar, Blue Bottle never disappoints. This location in particular has some great, friendly baristas, which obviously adds to the experience. 

Also of note- the Belgian waffles. So good. Just get one. You'll thank me.
author: Stacey C.

description: Good location - coffee is great...just pricing is ridiculous...$1 for almond milk substitute?
author: Conny F.

description:
Mocha and a waffle with Ate Anna.
Their coffee was fantastic and their waffle was very delicious, especially when it's warm. Don't wait to save your waffle for later unless you have a microwave. Trust me, it's not as good and satisfying compared to when it's hot. So eat it hot folks!
author: Mariyeth C.

description:
I drink coffee, and am pretty good about keeping to 1 cup a day to get my mornings started. However, here it is in the middle of the afternoon, I've already gotten my morning coffee, but I'm still in this long queue to get coffee at Blue Bottle. Why? Because it's worth it.

There is just something about the richness and flavor of Blue Bottle coffee that just gets to me. It's so creamy and "full". I am no coffee snob so the adjectives are at a lost to me, but I hope you kind of get it. We got the hot mocha and the New Orleans iced coffee. I sprinkled a little sugar in each drink, and both were delightful. They definitely perked us up for the rest of our day. The lines are long, but they move fast. Remember, it's just coffee.
author: Angela T.

description:
Blue bottle made me the coffee snob I am today.  Their coffee just has the right balance for me:  rich, smooth and sexy (sounds like the perfect man - but I digress).  

The single drip is my go to drink for school.  No bitterness or aftertaste here.  Nothing like a good 8 oz pour to keep me up for night class and late night studying.  I think I had to limit the amount I drink weekly though because of heart palpitations.  Best.Caffeine.Fix.Ever.  During warm weather, I heart me some New Orleans.  Mmmmmmm.  

Hint:  If you just want beans, grab a bag and wait to the side of the cashier.  They'll hook you up quick.  Bella Donovan is a must!
author: Maria S.

description:
I've never been a huge fan of coffee. I've always been the type of person that would dump a lot of sugar and cream into it  before I would ever consider drinking it. Therefore, whenever I'd go to coffee shops I would always order something like tea or hot chocolate instead. 

However, when I decided to finally give Blue Bottle a try, I decided I would order coffee. I ordered the New Orleans Iced Coffee, which was a revelation. Holy crap, it was GOOD. I didn't need to add anything extra to it order for me to enjoy it. The drink was on point!

I also ordered a waffle, which they made to order. It took awhile for them to make, but it was worth it. It as fluffy, sweet, and rather large. 

 Now I don't think it's strange that it ALWAYS has a line no matter what day/time it is. I'm officially a fan of Blue Bottle
author: Abena O.

description:
I gave them a few chances and I was not really impressed. The portions are small (I don't need a Starbucks Venti, but the 12oz coffee that was only really 3/4s full was a bit too small) and ridiculously over priced. The coffee tasted OK. There was nothing amazing about the flavor, at least not justifying the lines. 

The service was friendly and fairly quick.

There are far too many coffee options out there to waste the time here.
author: Neil W.

description: I've been to this location a handful of times after eating lunch at the Ferry Building. I've only gotten the pour-overs and it always tastes off. Maybe it's bad luck on my end, but I feel like the pours are either too fast or the water is too hot, causing extra bitterness and imbalance in the taste of the coffee.
author: Edwin C.

description: I always drink black drip coffee and this place pass my litmus test. Definitely better than Starbucks drip if you like black coffee. Although I don't like the line and wait. For a cup of coffee the service should be faster. I recommend Blue Bottle if you like coffee.
author: Evan C.

description: I am not kidding around. This is the best coffee I have ever had! I was so happy to discover Blue Bottle on our trip to SF. And when I found out they have locations in NYC, I lost my mind with joy! I will be going back for a cappuccino tomorrow.
author: Abbie W.

description:
AMAZING, real Italian coffee being made the right way: artfully done by masters who take pride in their craft. My cappuccino was rich and flavorful, made with Clover organic milk...and the barista even heated my coffee cup for me. My coworker and I loved this place, and it's the only place in the Embarcadero that I will ever consider having coffee at from now on. Perfect!

There's a reason the line out front is super long here, it's the best on the pier. If you want only coffee, the secret is to go around to the smaller side window, no waiting. YUM!
author: Compass-Rose X.

description:
I tried the New Orleans Iced coffee and a belgium waffle. So yummy!

The iced coffee was lightly sweetened and the waffle was hot with a crispy with caramelized sugar coat and a soft inside. They also offer simply syrup if you like your coffee a little more sweet. 

Lines are long during the lunch rush, but the wait is not bad. It's worth the wait! 

The staff is also very friendly! :-)

Highly Recommend!!
author: Monica T.

description: Terrible. I ordered two coffee's and two waffles and the waffles took 20 minutes. I was trying to have coffee with my wife at her office and the coffee was cold by the time I got back. I asked the staff if the waffles would be coming out soon and one of them replied that one was on its way out right now. When the first waffle came out they called someone else's name that had been waiting half the time.  My waffles came out 5 minutes later and the staff member who I talked to earlier said nothing.  Remind you, it was not that busy.  Back to Philz for a coffee and bagel.
author: Harvey N.

description: Wonderful coffee is meant to be savored, and they'll make sure you do. It takes a little wait in line (ok not-so-little wait sometimes later in the day), watching the baristas work their craft, admiring the pretty machines, perusing the coffee selection from far-flung places. When you're finally presented with your little cup of joy, probably with some pretty foam art on top, you SAVOR IT. It may cost twice what you're use to paying, but it's for the whole experience. And it's damn good coffee.
author: Vivian H.

description: Quality. Perfection. Balance. Love. Only coffee lovers will understand. One of my favorite stops when I visit the city.
author: Ere L.

description:
If you are not from the area, or if you have family/friends visiting, this is definitely an "it" place to take them. Try the drip coffee and get some yummy beans while you're there. If you are just buying beans, you don't have to wait in the long line; they'll will let you walk right to the front. 

It can be a bit more bitter than other places but for strong coffee drinkers, this is the place.

Cash only.

Also try Smittens ice cream around the corner, and Tcho chocolate for your visitors (one Embarcadero).
author: Andy M.

description:
Blue Bottle may not be the only coffee joint to make their cups one at a time, but they are, in my opinion, the best at it. The New Orleans iced coffee is enchanting and with a little milk it's sorcery.  I like my coffee sweet so I add sugar, but this is one of the few that I can drink just fine without any. 

I started my trip to the SF Farmer's market with a cup, grabbed a coffee cream soda at  Cowgirl Creamery, decided I needed more coffee and made a second stop at Blue Bottle. That's right. Twice in about two hours. This is quality coffee, my friends.
author: Jamie S.

description: Can never go wrong with any of their drinks! I love their macchiato and latte. But a simply black coffee is always good too! Quality coffee.
author: Chris K.

description: How could you NOT enjoy the Iced, refreshing, distinct goodness of a New Orleans-style "not-over-the-top" chicory coffee? I guess if you had to wait in the 35 minute line to get one; that might make it taste a little more sour than usual.
author: Allison H.

description:
I've only tried the Mocha at Blue Bottle Coffee Co. and it had me at first sip. Customer service was great and the drink was excellent! I even had a tree with my drink! It is a bit pricey but prices are usually hiked up because of the location and this one happens to be at the Ferry Building where all the tourist are.
Schucks, I forgot to take a picture of it. Oh well I will definitely be coming back!
author: Anna P.

description: I needed to stop here before we headed home. Got here right when they opened so there was a short line. I love how they take the time to make each cup of coffee and they aren't rushing.
author: Karen K.

description:
Blue bottle coffee is my go-to for very decent coffee that doesn't break the bank. 
It IS pricey but worth it by my reckoning, and my favorite has been their three africans blend. The only drawback to this location is that they only receive a delivery once a week on Tuesdays, so if you go, like I did on a Sunday... their selection had been picked over and I could not get what I had come for, so be advised.
author: David S.

description:
Does Blue Bottle really need yet another shining review of their caffeinated glory? 

Yes.
author: Em B.

description:
Blue Bottle makes one of the best coffee ever in SF. This ferry building location is always jammed packed with tourist and business people from around. There's a nice side window they have that's usually much shorter than the main entrance.

Their mocha are hands down good. It's not too sweet, not too foamy, and not too bitter. They have the perfect balance of coffee, milk, and chocolate for people who like their mocha not too sweet. A plus side is there's coffee art drawn on top that varies from flowers to hearts. A nice eye pleasing bonus when you're taking that first sip of coffee.

Affogato. What's that? Turns out to be a scoop of vanilla ice cream with a shot of espresso on it. How does it taste? LIKE GOOD COFFEE ICE CREAM! Good coffee and a good scoop of Humphry Slocombe vanilla ice cream is a match made in heaven. Literally one of the best coffee ice cream I have ever tasted. Once the ice cream is gone, there's espresso left on the bottom. Good for a half shot to keep you going.
author: Steven B.

description:
I heard about this place from a friend. Best decision to come here!

Beautiful surrounding! Quick and friendly service! 

I had the drip coffee and it was awesome! Plus the streusel.. Uh, they can do no wrong! Haha

Im only giving them 4 out 5 stars because I've only went there once. I give out 5 stars on the second or third visit.
author: Kim A.

description:
Coffee = good. Drip style = even better. Slurp. 0.Osuper strong!! 

I'll be back for more.  $2.50 for the cup of drip style coffee, inside.


If you go go outside to the Farmer's Market stand for it on Saturdays, it'll be $2 a cup (and it's a tad smaller.)
author: Fannie S.

description: Unless you roast your own (and maybe even if you do), this could well be the best coffee you ever taste.  Great drip coffee, great lattes, great mochas (with Tcho chocolate, I think).  Delicious waffles.  And yes, you can buy beans to take home.  Friendly efficient staff, too!  All-around great experience; a San Francisco highlight.
author: Kathryn O.

description:
I can understand why the long time... Great cafe mocha. I thought the ice coffee was okay, not sure why all the review on ice coffee for. Maybe our Franciscans likes to have ice with regular coffee with sugar. 

Definitely come back.
author: Tom C.

description:
The line can be insanely long, but don't let that scare you!!! Their lattes here are a piece of art! it's to totally worth standing in a 20 min. (or longer) line for. hee hee


oh and they sell yummy parfaits and AAAAMAZING waffles! GE-GE-GEEET THE WAFFLE! You won't be sorry!
author: Nathalie B.

description: As everyone has said, the wait is worth it. Had an espresso and it was one of the best I've ever had. Mild yet complex in flavor, not a hint of sourness. Well done!
author: Derwei C.

description:
i LOVE their drip coffee! Nothing beats that! New Orlean Style ice coffee was unforgettable as well. Their baristas are cool and very friendly. Expect a long line, almost 95% of the times though.

//
author: Kim K.

description:
I went here because I was told it's famous in San Francisco and I was a curious tourist.  It's good coffee but I found the line a little long.  It was a Saturday morning so maybe on a day when the line is shorter, I would choose this place.

That being said, the whole handmade coffee experience is pretty enjoyable.  If you're in San Francisco, you might as well try it!  What have you got to lose?
author: Emel S.

description:
Hi, 

I have a caffeine addiction and I may be a coffee snob. 

The first time I frequent this joint, I was a klutz and spilled some of my New Orleans Ice Coffee on my pretty white blouse. At that point, I threw a fit and refused to come here ever again.

But little behold, my pouting spree did not last long. I could not stay away as Blue Bottle is my favorite coffee joint in the FiDi. Their drip coffee has a sweet aroma that I cannot resist, and their New Orleans Ice Coffee is super duper refreshing on those rare hot SF days. 

My favorite drink here is the New Orleans Ice Coffee. I tried 2 versions of it - one made with non-fat milk and one made with whole milk. The non-fat version is good, but the whole milk version is 100x better. The whole milk makes the drink creamier and smoother. It also gives the coffee a more aromatic dairy kick. When you order this, please don't mess with perfection by making it non-fat. That delicious whole milk will not clog your veins because there are no trans-fats, and only cis-fats, in milk! Additionally, your taste buds will love you for it!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
#28 on the SF Big Eat List: A Gibraltar at Blue Bottle Coffee.

The Gibraltar is not listed on the menu, so you have to ask for it. It's a cuppachino in a gibraltar, which is about the size of a double shot glass, so you can enjoy right there at the store. I was up at 5am on Saturday so this was a much needed caffeine boost. And it's really good. Not too bitter at all. And with the ginger snaps from Miette, it made me enjoy my drink even more.

The line can be long which is expected because of the great coffee, the farmers market, and sunny weather.
author: Rhoda G.

description:
On our visit to SF, we went to the Pier Marketplace several times and on the last trip, we stopped by Blue Bottle Coffee.  There was a line of about 20 people but the service was extremely fast and we were entertained by all the cafe art going on.  They sell some high end coffee makers as well as their own beans.

I got a latte to go.  Beans are fresh, dark, roasty, and NOT bitter at all.  They are very green and use mostly recycleable products.

There is only one size so no confusing S/M/L going on here!

Will definitely return on my next visit to SF

Prices are on far with starbucks for better beans
author: Jon Z.

description: Best way to start your day in SF while waiting for the clouds to burn off.  I swear this coffee will slow down time if you let it!
author: Cortney G.

description:
Ok, everyone has raved about how amazing Blue Bottle Coffee is... so we had to try it. What a disappointment!

The Iced New Orleans style coffee was bland and weak. An iced coffee from McDonalds or Jack in the Box is better than that!

The Belgium Waffle was good tho! Buttery and flaky like a freshly baked croissant.
author: Earlene C.

description:
Here are some of my favorite things at BBCC:

Their soy lattes, affogatos, yogurt with preserves, granola with soy milk... Mmm!
author: Janel A.

description:
I finally braved the line around the corner with those brave souls willing to wait a little longer for a coffee made with single origin beans.

And I have to say, it was worth the wait. The single origin latte is an improvement over the standard offering by way of less bitterness and more rich, almost caramel-y flavor.

Despite this, don't head for the side bar unless you're willing to wait an extra 10 minutes over the normal line!
author: Nick S.

description:
*insert annoying patron (who I hope was drunk) here*

Where's the line?  Where the heck is the menu?  That's it?  What kinda pastry display is this!  I don't even know where to order!  Who's manning the till? Hey, who's on first!! heh heh heh heh

Hey how come my coffee isn't served in a BLUE BOTTLE? heh heh heh heh

What's with the cones? I hope it's not the same cones used for the bologna over at Boca Raton or whatever that store is down the way heh heh heh heh

(he was referring to the Salumi cones at Boccalone)

(pulls up pants just over gut) Yeah, what the heck, gimme one a dem regular coffees.  And throw in one of them fancy pic-chas on top just like that lady got.  Whaddya mean my coffee doesn't come with one?  Gimme one anyway sweet stuff.  Daddy wants a pic-cha sweet stuff. heh heh heh heh

Finally walking away with his coffee, he scrubs and spills his coffee over his gut and pants and on the floor.


Serves you right foo.


Blue.Bottle.Coffee.for.the.M.F.Win.
author: Rho T.

description:
Tuesday morning fresh produce in one hand blue bottle in the other. Yes, San Francisco you do get me. 

One at a time, but who told the tourists about the side window???? Ughhh.
author: Carla R.

description:
BEST. COFFEE. EVER.

I've become a huge fan after one drink during a visit to San Francisco. You don't understand, I actually fell off my chair in excitement when I read that Blue Bottle also exists in New York, where I live. Needless to say, I think my Starbucks gold card (I know, I know) is probably going to retire now...

I normally don't like sweetened coffee, but holy cow, the New Orleans iced coffee is out-of-this-world good. The servers are also super friendly, and the baristas are just skilled at what they do. Thank you, Blue Bottle: you've changed my life and opened my tastebuds to a whole new dimension of incredible brew.
author: Allison K.

description:
I don't have much patience for waiting in line for a beverage, but Blue Bottle Coffee is fantastic so when you see people waiting it's for good reason. 

I ordered the New Orleans Style Iced Coffee, which was incredibly good and strong. I drank it so fast and got a cool little coffee buzz to give me a little bounce to my step. 

The only thing better than my Iced Coffee would be a large Iced Coffee. They only had one size and I downed it before our second coffee (a mocha) was finished being made.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
I've always loved clever use of alliteration, so is it any wonder that my two favorite Blue Bottle baristas are named Bryan and Brian? Bryan works at this one - he's the charming cute brown guy in glasses (um, yeah - I'm brown and all ethnical, too) who sometimes is dressed pretty dapper as well. He'll definitely take the time to make your coffee right, yet he can keep that line moving all efficient like and still hold a long enough genuine conversation to charm a good tip out of your pocket. Don't let his perfect foam art fool you. Under that cute heart is coffee that will wake the dead, but not because it's insanely strong or bitter, but because nobody roasted and pulled coffee this good before Blue Bottle existed. If I have any say, I will make sure I am re-incarnated wherever BB is available.

Having said that, I don't think of myself as a coffee snob in that on any given day you might catch me drinking coffee that isn't shade-grown, organic, fair trade, single origin, locally roasted, or from a civet cat's butt; however, I know insanely good, addictive coffee when I taste it, and Blue Bottle is it.
