i am 5'2".  i know, it's not very tall. i used to think that coffee would stunt my growth.  so for a while, during my teen years, i avoided it.  i'm still only 5'2".  however, fortunately for the sake of my love of coffee, i am the height i am and no amount of caffeine is going to stunt my growth anymore!

and thank god because otherwise i'd have to stay away from the coffee at blue bottle coffee co and THAT would be true travesty..had my first cup of their iced coffee like five years ago and recently had again at the ferry building...and it still as amazingly awesome as i remembered it...i'm not sure what sorts of words would do this coffee justice -- bittersweet, smooth, perfect temperature, creamy -- so in a two words: COFFEE PERFECTION.

i should probably be glad my office isn't THAT close to the ferry building because otherwise i'd probably start shrinking...both in height and my wallet!
author: Grace O.

description: Now, I really fancy a latte made with love. Hence, I love them lattes with hearts in them! This place served up an amazingly smooth latte with a beautiful heart in it! I loved it!! I will return!!
author: John W.

description: Although their coffee is good,, their menu is not very exciting for brunch. We had baked eggs which came in small individual skillets and cost $12 ea. Seemed way too expensive for what we got. They were out of scones before noon.
author: Suzanne L.

description: Simply amazing iced coffee! My boyfriend and I have been trying this early am crew thing where we get up early and avoid all the lines at some of the novelty spots in the city on Sundays. Its been working like a charm. We end up avoiding most lines and have so much more of the day.....until we are ready to crash by 4 of course. Although my experience of coffee in Portland this week was truly spectacular, Im still very in favor.
author: Marcella I.

description:
I am addicted.  Also this is my second review of one of their shops.  I am going to end up on Intervention.

Oh well, at least it's not Hoarders. 

What was I talking about?  Oh right, coffee.  It's wonderful.  Go.
author: Will C.

description: The worst out of all blue bottle cafes. I had their mocha which came out to be extremely bland and room-temperatured. My friend's hot cocoa was mediocre. Will not come back again.  I much prefer Coupa down in Palo Alto.
author: Moko R.

description: expect to wait at least 20+ min for your coffee on a bustling saturday morning. i was gonna write a long review as to why i think blue bottle is just "whatevs," but i'm too lazy. so let's just say when people ask for my favorite coffee joint in the city, it aint blue bottle. there are plenty of other fish in the sea.
author: Erin M.

description: Okay, this is some DAMN good coffee.....and I don't even drink coffee.......but I decided to break-down and try the macchiato and see why the rest of the world partakes in such a widespread addiction....and maybe really GOOD coffee is to blame! This is probably not the best place for you if you are in a time crunch....only if you are okay with getting on the slow boat to China and luxuriating in line for quite some time.....their methodology of self-drip for each cup is cool.....but likely not the most efficient. Sooo good though I must say!
author: Lee M.

description: I finally got to try Blue Bottle Coffee.  It's pretty delicious and may even taste more delicious, because I don't drink coffee that often and I LOVE THE FERRY BUILDING WITH ALL OF MY COLD, BLACK AS COFFEE HEART.
author: Christina S.

description:
Do I really need to tell these people that a cappuccino and a milkshake are two totally different things?  After we both told the ultra hip, disheveled  barista that our cappuccinos were very wet lattes she told us that Blue Bottle doesn't do the "Foam thing". What the F is she talking about?  

A warm steamed milk with a hint of espresso and a cute foamy pattern at the top is what you'll get at this joint if you order anything other than coffee. 

Walk another 50 feet to Peet's.
author: Greg M.

description: so sisters friend said this is the best coffee place inside the ferry building, so after hitting up the hog oyster bar we headed this a way. smelled so good as the overcast was heading in and i was in need of a little warming up. the line was long though but we had time to waste so we jumped in. so dad got a regular coffee, sis a macchiato, and i a hot cocoa. very good and worth the wait, my only problem was i wished they had a bigger menu...
author: Jennifer C.

description: I went to Blue Bottle for the first time today with a friend after he raved that it was his absolute favorite coffee place (he's a gourmet chef at a swanky place so I trust his word)  and it completely lived up to it.  I ordered a latte and it was perfect, including the beautiful swirl pattern on the top!  It was very smooth and perfect to the last, room temperature drop.  I will definately go back the next time I'm in the Ferry Building (or near any of its other locations).
author: Dawn L.

description: It was my first time, and I got the drip. Richest coffee I've ever had!
author: Wayne T.

description: So after all the hoopla about Blue Bottle, I decided to try it. It's true, you must NOT be in a hurry when you go here, because the line is long and the process to make the coffee is quite slow. Given that, it's good coffee. Notice I didn't say the best coffee. I got a soy latte as that's what others have raved about. It was hot enough when I got it, but after 3 minutes began to get cool. I would go back ONLY to try the carmelized belgian waffle that looked delicious! Served fresh and wrapped in a napkin so you can take it to go. Yum!
author: Stacey H.

description:
I love Blue Bottle.  I loved Blue Bottle before it became a ginormous hit in the City.  Blue Bottle is bold.  Blue Bottle is rich.  Blue Bottle is coffee at its best.  
I will say that I can do without the attitude that several locations have, but for coffee like that, I'll let it slide.
My all time favorite is a simple Latte.  I remember the exact day, years ago.  I ventured into Velo Rouge and ordered a Latte.  I thought it was weird that it only came in one size, but there was a pretty foamy leaf designed on top and the weirdness left me.  Instead, a strong, rich and bold flavor was introduced to me:  I don't know if I can go back to regular coffee again.  Starbucks who?  Something wonderfully dangerous happened...I became a coffee snob.  Ahhh...It was love at first sip!  
You simply can't mistake the distinct taste of quality Organic Coffee at the measly price of $3.50 per cup.  It's only "measly" if you love designer coffee :)
Today, I tried the recommended Gibralter according to 7X7 as the 27th must eat or drink before you die at the Ferry Building.  Yes, it's worth having before you die...The two shots of the Hayes Valley Blend and milk gently poured over with a sweet heart-shaped design served in a Gibralter glass makes it a must to enjoy on Blue Bottle premises.  To Go?  No.  It wouldn't be a Gibralter!  Very good, a bit on the bitter side, but I loved it, nonetheless!  
I had a vision of how awesome it would be to have a Gibralter served in bed, first thing in the morning...It would make definitely make my morning routine a lot more enjoyable!
author: Jennifer L.

description: just had to compare the one to NYC since i am a Blue Bottle virgin in SF...i was introduced in NYC and loved it and it's equally stellar in its birthplace.  line around the door and all!  its worth waiting so just get in line!
author: Tim W.

description:
I have complicated feelings about this cafe - the coffee itself is top notch, but the experience of getting a coffee here is positively dental.

If the line of people waiting to be served exceeds 6 (which includes most of the average weekday), you will wait for at least 20 minutes before someone reluctantly takes your order.  Smiles are infrequent and the whole place is dense with an attitude that is entirely undeserved.  I've waited in line for coffee several times when I had nothing better to do but generally I avoid going here except when I need beans.

My new tactic when I want to buy beans is to grab a 1/2 pound off the shelf, lay my money on the counter and walk away.  I'm not sure anyone there has noticed what I'm doing (they don't notice much, it seems), but so far no problems so I guess it's a go.  Steer clear if you want ambiance, seating, attention, etc.
author: John F.

description: I love, love, LOVE this place. Coffee is perfect to me, I'm not one for the super hot coffee though, it's hot just not piping burn your tongue hot. I just had their Ham and Egg Crust less Sandwich for breakfast and it was too die for!! $6.50 is totally worth it! Seriously what do they put in their food? Crack?? I just keeping coming back despite the occasional abuse, long lines, half interested staff who sometimes ask you for your order twice! And it can be a bit disorganized, but when it comes down to it, I absolutely love their creativity and lack of corporate order. I would recommend going outside on Tuesdays and Thursday for Farmer's Market, lines are smaller and nice just to be outside.
author: Teisha F.

description: had their drip coffee and boy .. am i in love! :)  wonderfully smooth cup of coffee on a cold winter day .. what more can you ask for in sf!
author: Janice M.

description: Ok, I would give 5 stars any day of the week to their New Orleans style iced coffee, but the wait to get one is obnoxious. Usually when I'm at the farmers market I will get a coffee, but I grumble the entire time. However, once it's in my hands I forget all about the wait. I love Blue Bottle and I love that they cold brew. Yum.
author: jen w.

description: Best, darkest, richest, most satisfying cup of coffee I can think of.  Dense and smooth, it doesn't need any add ins.  Worth the wait, plain and simple.
author: Lauren S.

description:
This will be short and sweet.  

I don't drink coffee ever.  I've tried coffee at your usual spots like Starbucks and Peets and so on but I usually don't like them.  I'm not a coffee connoisseur.  I decided to try Blue Bottle today at the Farmers' Market because it had gotten so much hype.  I needed the caffeine on a sluggish Tuesday so I waited in line and ordered the New Orleans style Iced Coffee.

Wow!  This is some really good stuff.  I was expecting to have to add sugar to drink it down but this is really smooth and good.  This just plain tastes good.  I look forward to having the iced coffee again on a hotter summer day in SF.  For now, I'll sip away at this before my meeting.
author: Scott L.

description:
really great coffee 
(plus I am in love with the black and curly hair with a very tiny braid barista with the wonderful smile)
author: Isabelle O.

description: HA! We snuck in at like 6:50pm on a Monday night and there was NO LINE! So we finally got to try the famous Blue Bottle Coffee. My espresso about knocked my socks off - holy moley that is some strong stuff! Hubby really liked his mocha - considering he has been critical of any and all mochas coming his way lately, that says alot.
author: Sarcastic T.

description: It's been a slow burn waiting for this latest BB to open up, but at long last it's finally here! First purchase: brioche with strawberry jam filling, half pound of Misty Valley beans, and 1 cappuccino. Verdict? Same great taste, convenient new location! Friendly barista also gave the head's up that starting next week they will be offering breakfast and lunch options. So drop that $3 like it's hot and get yo self caffeinated!
author: Lummi B.

description: If you're a coffeeholic, please take a trip to the ferry building to taste the BEST mocha (they use local chocolate) and the BEST latte you will ever taste in your life. It's pricey but worth every single sip!
author: Olivia B.

description:
Okay, caveat emptor: I admit I'm not a coffee drinker, so this is strictly a food review.  But we are such big fans of their sandwich/roll here that I felt compelled to put in a plug.  Plus a shout-out to Brian who works at the counter during the lunch-time rush-- he is super cool!

So far our favorite is the egg salad sandwich with pickles.  I normally avoid any and all egg dishes.  But this sandwich is a nice treat for lunch. Not too "egg-y", they use chopped egg whites, no yolks except in the sauce, which I am certain is a secret recipe!

Will have to try the others.  Only $4.50 each.  
Minus one-star for packaging issues.  They put the sandwich into coffee filters, which is a little too flimsy for a gooey egg salad ready to fall out if tipped the wrong way.  Never try to eat one in your lap unless you have extra pants (which, yes, I was fortunate to have today for yoga class, ha!).
author: June G.

description: Love blue bottle coffee...The precision and care they put into each cup if so refreshing. Great cup of drip and their mochas...wow (and I'm not usually a mocha drinker). Such a nice cocoa flavor. Line is long, but coffee is strong and delicious.
author: Erin T.

description: Best lattes I've ever had. Period.
author: Kim H.

description: Not worth the hype. Decent coffee, but 4 Barrel, Coffee Bar, and others are much better for the coffee, value, space, and location.
author: Amanda S.

description:
this location makes me so happy.  there's usually a line but it's so worth it!

and I can get my beans for coffee I make at home without having to wait for Saturday's market now...!
author: Alyssa W.

description: First time in and what a Line there was to get my drip coffee. I don't think this place is all that...I didn't care for the customer service and or line, which only 2 people, for a beautiful Saturday morning, was so unheard of to have scheduled! Oh well, they must be cutting back on hours..
author: Marco R.

description: BEst coffee in San Francisco? hell no! It's really just OK... I mean it beats Starbuck$$$ but it doesn't live up to all the hype.
author: anna p.

description: um, wow.  I went in to order the Gibraltar from 7x7's list, and LOVED it.  I sort of stumbled over the ordering, since I had no idea what it was, but it was FABULOUS.  yum yum yum!!!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
five stars just for the waffles...3$, cooked perfectly, soft, not too sweet...perfect...
As far as the coffee drips, I would not come back especially for it but for the waffles, oh yes.
author: Daniel K.

description: Thought their hand made drip coffe would be special. Ill go anywhere else next time. Just not that good for price and the wait.
author: Boss G.

description: If you like your Cafe Mocha's heavy on the coffee, then this place is for you! The drinks were okay, but not worth the line or wait. Employee's are super nice and very patient with the people that are waiting.
author: Rebecca S.

description: I went here early this AM, well before the daily ferry commuters arrived and seemed to have the entire Ferry Market building mine alone to explore.  The street side stand along the Embarcadero is where I went (not the actual business inside the Ferry bldg) located at the Farmers Market. It served up a phenomenal cappuccino (may be dry for some, but I like a little dry). I've only had a superior one in Portland. Must try an espresso tomorrow. And a latte the day after.  Then on Sunday pick my favorite of the three!
author: Steve H.

description: Purveyor of perhaps the best coffee right now in San Francisco. This indoor location in the Ferry Building has a terrific espresso counter. The barista's Gibraltar makes this a destination spot for coffee fiends.
author: Alex B.

description: Yummy coffee, sure, but the seating is crappy (bar stools) and there is no wi-fi. Seriously. It is 2009. It is San Francisco. It's a yuppy coffee place. And no wi-fi?
author: Stu M.

description: I randomly went here with my good friend to get some coffee in the morning and ordered lates. I hadn't had coffee that good in ages :3
author: Cameron S.

description: I just wish it was a little more consistent.  When it's on, it's fantastic, but that's unfortunately not always the case.  90%, of the time, perfect, but that 10% is frustrating when you pay $2.25 a cup.  90%, however are pretty good odds, so definitely always worth the trip.
author: John G.

description: Long wait, but totally worth it. We brought our goodies outside and sat on the benches as we watched all the action at the Ferry Building and listened to a gentleman play beautiful music on his clarinet. It was a beautiful morning in the city with a warm Blue Bottle beverage in one hand and a delicious waffle in the other. Aaaahhhhh.... =)
author: Anne S.

description: LONGEEEEST que ever for a cup of coffee...probably becoz i went on a saturday. got a regular latte. it was alright....didn't feel like there was anything special. ya, true that they made it differently, dripping coffee and stuff. quite fancy. that's about it.
author: Sarah O.

description:
I totally drank the coffee flavored kool-aid a long time ago, so in general I am love for blue bottle.

But I got a really weird egg sandwich for breakfast this morning. It wasn't bad, but I was expecting, you know, fried egg on toast, tomato, maybe some mayo. Instead it was scrambled eggs on two pieces of giant, cold, white bread.

It was tasty, but unexpected, and cold (though I do love giant white bread), and it's really the first food item I've had at a blue bottle outlet that didn't really knock my socks off.
author: Wangston P.

description:
I docked off one star because the service is horribly slow. 
And, it seems as though the employees don't seem to care, as if we have all the time in the world to wait in line.

I don't.

Whilst I am standing in line, tappping my foot-- people will turn to me and say, "They move so slow, but it's worth it".

The coffee is worth something, but not over losing my job because I'm late (even when I get there super early). 

I have yet to try their pastries, they look so good & very gourmey-ish. A snickerdoodle w/Saffron? Interesting.
author: Sheila S.

description: I'm not a coffee drinker in the sense that I need it but I was here over the weekend to pick up a thank you gift for a friend so my review is only about the experience of waiting in line. I wanted to get him something "San Francisco-ish" and noticed all these people standing around in line for coffee. I figured it must be awfully good to wait around for this so I reluctantly got in line ready to spend the rest of my afternoon looking at the back of someone's head. I was mistaken. I encountered such pleasant people who were nice enough to recommend me what kind of beans to get, a suggestion to also pick up one of BBCC's signature single drip cups to accompany the coffee and a quick review as to why they preferred this coffee over others. Not only that, the guys behind the counter have got their system down packed because the line ran smoothly and in a reasonable amount of time for someone not waiting for coffee. The half pound beans were whole and roasted within three days (never seen or smelt coffee so fresh!) and the entire gift cost about thirty bucks. This place was worth the the wait in line even if the coffee's wasn't for me...
author: Grace S.

description: Expect a great cup of strong joe whether you are ordering French press or an individual cup that's filtered right on the spot when you order at the Farmers' Market. Because these processes can be a little time consuming, be patient. I promise you that the end product will be well worth the wait.
author: Kristin A.

description: Wow, you so can't go wrong with their hazelnut brioche or their ice cream with espresso on top Affe-somethin' or other.  I love this place!
author: Shum S.

description: At peak times you could wait up to 20 minutes for your coffee here. There's no ambience here; it's a get in and get out kind of place, although they do have some stool seating with newspapers lying around on the tables --considered pretty generous for the Ferry Building. People are obsessed with a strong, robust coffee and San Franciscans are no exception. Their New Orleans Iced Coffee is no exception either! Talk about the strongest kick on a clean palate. You get the darkest coffee ever with sugar, ground chicory, with organic milk swirling around in it. I daresay I feel the milk doesn't soften up the coffee's bitterness at all but I still enjoyed it. I added a bunch of sugar and some may say that ruins the real flavor but I've always been the type to have coffee with my sugar, thank you! Anyway, I truly felt like a hardcore coffee connoisseur drinking coffee from this place. They do have in fact use a $30,000 siphon coffee system.
author: Stacy C.

description: Overrated. I wanted to like this place because they're a local biz & they micro-roast their coffee, but I dont get it. The coffee is ok, but it's not worth the long line or the staff's attitude. I watched a couple in front of me try to order a New Orleans Style Iced Coffee, so they asked what made it New Orleans 'style'. The guy taking the order gave them a look that said "I've got better things to do" and answered them with such an elitist attitude. Calm down buddy, it's just coffee, not the cure for cancer. As my friend put it, maybe we dont get it because our bikes have gears...
author: Hotdogger G.

description: A permanent Blue Bottle stand at the Ferry Building is such a good idea. I had been eagerly awaiting its opening and was not at all disappointed. There was a line on the side open to the main hallway, but no one waiting at the window just around the corner. I got my usual latte and it was fast, cheap (I think maybe either accidentally or some sort of just about to close the window discount) and then I got to enjoy the beautiful sunshine outside while I drank up the yummy goodness. SF has a lot of good things going for it, but it really lacks a lot of really great coffee places. Happy to see there's hope yet!
author: Emily F.

description: This is quite possibly the best coffee I have ever had... and I am super picky! It is so fresh and tasty, yummm... you can't go wrong! I just wish it wasn't so expensive!
author: Bethany C.

description: I guess I don't understand what the big deal is.  It was a good cup of coffee, but the line moved slowly (fortunately, it was a really short line and I had the time) and I wasn't transported to heaven with my first sip.
author: Marcus C.

description: Simply the best latte I've ever had beside latte from Tartine Bakery. That's what latte or coffee drink should taste. After I drink their latte, I thought Starbucks coffee drink in general is really a mediocre, sorry Starbucks I used to love  you, but I found there is someone better than you. How I wish Blue Bottle is more available like Starbucks :-(
author: Jennifer C.

description: I'm not a coffee drinker.  So what am I doing writing a review about coffee?  Well, I did a baaaaad thing.  My poor mother, who only knew about mediocre coffee, Starbuck's style, was ruined.  Ruined by my high falooting friend's taste in coffee.  I hang around enough foodies to be exposed to amazing coffee.  Plus I was working across the street from the Ferry Building at the time so I was close to the coffee crack.  So I bring home a bag to my mother.  I smell the coffee.  I instantly realize, and recognize that if I was ever to become a coffee drinker and lover, this would have been my first and one true love.  Over the top?  I dunno.  My mother had one taste of this coffee and she immediately couldn't go back to any other coffee.  She reluctantly did start drinking other coffee when she ran out of the bag.  Her palate is ruined forever.  She can't go back.  It's all my fault really.  I was her supplier and I let her taste one time of the crack coffee.  She was hooked.
author: Mary Ann K.

description: Just had my second cup of cappuccino at Blue Bottle Coffee Company in the Ferry Building. The coffee is great! Bold, deep, thick... a perfect cup of "Joe" for this wanna-be coffee snob. Like everything else, a little pricey, but worth it when you need an awesome cup of coffee. Highly recommended!
author: R. G.

description:
The coffee at Blue Bottle is very good and beautifully designed, but it's more a coffee stand than a coffee shop. There are very few places to sit in the Ferry building around it, so most of the coffee has to be "to go." This is fine for most, but I saw a man recently who was jostled and spilled his coffee, and they were so busy it took some time to even notice. When they did, they were good about cleaning up, but the servers seemed more sarcastic than helpful, and there was no effort to help the man replace the coffee, or even ask if he wanted to ordered a new cup.

I know it's busy in the Embarcadero, and it is just coffee, but it was almost as if they couldn't be bothered.

As I said, the coffee's beautiful, but don't expect much more than that.
author: J K.

description: best americano ever.  i can't drink americano from other places now. why won't you open up a joint in my neck of the woods.  the americano here is so different from anywhere else.  da best!
author: Joon P.

description: I ordered the cafe au lait and it was perfect.
author: Maureen R.

description: Don't let a long line scare you away.  The delicious coffee is worth any wait!  The lattes are the best I have ever had.
author: c d.

description: Delicious!  The best latte!  But be careful because if you just order a latte and do not specify what kind of milk you will get full fat.
author: Liz D.

description: I like that their coffee is brewed for you when you order it.  However, I found that the coffee was too acidic and lacked a bold and dark flavor that I prefer in my coffee.  I did give it a second chance at the stand in Hayes Valley but didn't like it either.  I'm not sure which blend I got at either stand.
author: Denise C.

description: the coffee may be decent, meaning that i would drink it before i would drink starbucks.  but the service is terrible.  what's with this hipster coffee wave where you can't just get a damn latte or shot or plain old cup of coffee the way you want it????  you are a barista.  you make $8 an hour.  you do not know any more about coffee than i do.  AND I AM PAYING FOR IT...just give it to me the way i f*%king want it!!  every time i have been to a blue bottle coffee place i have heard, "oh...we don't do that"...ummmm...what??  are you incapable?  or are you just being a snob because your skinny jeans are cutting off your circulation?  i paid for the shot of espresso; if i want it in a to-go cup, put it in a to-go cup and go on with your life.  *sigh* lamest coffee experience ever...i should have gone to starbucks.
author: coco c.

description: best coffee i've ever had...i'm by no means a coffee fanatic but the new orleans style iced coffee was amazing!  the line is long but goes fast and worth the wait...i've been craving this coffee ever since i left san fran!  i might go back just for this coffee...
author: Amanda K.

description: I got addicted to the New Orleans Ice Coffee after half a cup, and I've been craving it for the past week.  It's that good!
author: Alex E.

description: blue bottle coffee is a nice treat especially if you're tired of starbucks and pete's all the time...  they make a really nice hot latte...  tacubaya, a favorite mexican restaurant of ours in berkely off 4th street also serves bbcc using their ceramic coffee drip...  h-100...
author: Herb F.

description: I have been a devoted Blue Bottle drinker since they started serving little single cups at the farmer's market in Berkeley. So it is with disappointment that I give them 3 stars (this location in particular). Part of the pleasure in consuming a good cup of coffee for me is the excitement (or at least graciousness) that the purveyor has about the product. The people working here are purposefully lethargic, snap at innocent questions and are generally giving off the stink of snobbishness. The new Jack London Square Oakland location, recently opened, seems more friendly. So I'll try to stick with it... but not at the Ferry Bldg.
author: thats neat o.

description: OMG!  It was worth our 15 minute wait.  Went there twice a day on a visit to SF.  Tried regular drip coffee, espresso, machiatto, cafe au lait, cappucino, and new orlean ice coffee.  My least fav was cafe au lait.  For a person from an area with not so good coffee (sorry West LA!), blue bottle was spectacular!
author: S L.

description: The coffee is that good, but the wait is inexplicably long. Watching the Baristas work is like watching paint dry.
author: Lily L.

description: i love blue bottle coffee don't get me wrong, but to tell you the truth, the service here is not the greatest.  maybe it is because it gets extremely busy since it is the ferry building, with locals and tourists, but i usually go to the one in hayes valley and the coffee makers tend to be a bit more friendly and easy going.  the coffee is still great, just not the people.
author: Jacqueline H.

description: The coffee is okay. The expresso is good. The way they run this place is what I have a huge problem with. My wife and I ordered a drip coffee and an americano. I got my coffee within reasonable amount of time but it took an extra 10 minutes for the americano. I noticed the same thing happen to other customers who ordered more than one drink. If you want better coffee and service, try Rodger's Coffee in the mission district.
author: steve k.

description: Well I used to like BBC, but I will never drink it again due to some twit "barista" working at the ferry building.  After waiting in the long 30min line I order a mocha and a latte for myself and my mother who was visiting from out of town.  Finally, I put in my order and the d!@khead who made our drinks, failed.  I took a sip of my mocha and it was luke warm at best and then I took a sip of my mothers latte which was piping hot like it should be.  No big deal I thought, I'll just have him warm it up.  So I go back to ask him if he would mind heating it up and his reply was, "This isn't starbucks, we don't scald our coffee". Clearly, I know how coffee should be prepared, I've been drinking it for 15 yrs and was once a barista!  I was so pissed and should have given him a piece of my mind, but I didn't want to make a scene in front of my mother.  Thus, hence forth, I shall NEVER drink BBC again!!!!
author: Mary W.

description: this is my favorite coffee shop/brand, which is perfect because it's only a couple blocks from my office.  the new orleans coffee tastes great, and is perfect for when it "feels like 2:30"
author: Joel F.
